California Roll.

(my mouth just salivated thinking of this dinner)

Delicious. Presentation was perfect too. 

We treated ourselves to a Choco Chan, green tea ice-cream with flourless chocolate cake. YUM.

I recommend coming here and probably doing reservations because it gets crowded starting around 6:30pm
author: Lauren F.

description: Very expensive very small sushi.  Service was mediocre to poor.  The miso was very good or I would have given 1 star
author: Gary H.

description: I wish I could say better things about this place but sushi was just ok. It had great descriptions on the menu and was very artfully presented but taste wise something just seemed lacking. Was the quality of the fish or the combinations in the rolls? Not sure...
author: Janet C.

description: Went to Ozumo on a Saturday night for dinner with my wife.  The food was good, not great. The fish was certainly fresh.  We had a couple rolls, a few pieces of nigiri and two of the starter plates.  We especially enjoyed the Hamachi starter.  We tried to order the omakase, but the waiter said it was not available (I read this in several other yelp reviews as well. If you don't offer something, don't put it on the menu - or at least state that it is only sometimes available).   The restaurant was very pretty, and service was for  the most part good.  I think with all  the other nice restaurants to try in the area it will be a while before we venture back to Ozumo.
author: Bob G.

description:
Ozumo for New Year's Eve was one of the best decisions we made! 

Not only is the restaurant glamorous and really atmospheric, like a chic underground lounge, but the drinks and food were amazing to pair! I started off with their seasonal cocktail Kumo, an elderflower and gin concoction that was sweet, but not too sweet. A perfect way to start my NYE libations!

We got several small plates to share and we were not disappointed. The Hari-Hari, their Wagyu Beef Salad, was one of the show-stoppers for sure. The beef was amazing and the salad was a great way to kick off our meal. Fresh tomatoes and a great dressing made the whole salad perfection. 

The Hanabi is amazing too, with the ginger sauce being a very unique flavor that we enjoyed. We finished off the evening with the Moriawase sashimi plate, which split between two people allowed it to be more affordable and enough food to finish off the meal. 

By far the best part, the BEST PART of the whole evening was their sake tasting flights! Not only do they have the highest quality sake, but they bring a print out with it to show you exactly what you are drinking and what notes you should be tasting for. What a creative way to get more people involved in the sake scene!

Overall, it is a bit pricier than I usually go, but for NYE or a special occasion it was such a great decision! The service was great and I will definitely be returning for my next big occasion in the city.
author: Caitlin A.

description:
I loved the ambiance of this place. Amazing, clean original food, but very pricey. They have so much going on and changing that the waitress was tongue tied to tell us the specials and what they have on the menu (seems they are used to regulars) 

I was there for a work thing, so I didn't get to enjoy the views. So I'll be for sure coming back to that sitting on the water view.  You will not be leaving any richer though...
author: Kat S.

description: This was an experience in Japanese food. When they served the Mizo soup they didn't give you spoons. You sipped from the bowl. They believe you absorb the warmth of the bowl. The sushi was fresh and tasty.
author: Brian R.

description:
4.5

I'm surprised this only got 3.5 stars. I had a such a great time here and the food was really good. 

Also they're not kidding about their sake. They have a seriously extensive list of sake on the menu. Unfortunately I don't remember the name of the sake I had here but it was probably the best one I've had in my life! 

I appreciate how they wanted to be creative with the seaweed salad but none of us really liked it. We prefer the normal seaweed salad.

Most of the sushi rolls we tried were really good but it's been a week since I dined here so I, unfortunately, don't remember anymore which ones we ordered.
author: Nin A.

description:
Meh.

High priced - Check
Nice Bar - Check
Nice atmosphere/venue - Check
Trendy music - Check
Good looking female staff - Check

This place is pretty much your typical trendy restaurant.  It caters to those folks who've got too much money to make the trek to find a better restaurant.  I came here just because of convenience btw.  It's got a really nice atmosphere and its super high quality.  I can't say the same for the food.

Had the $10 rolls and now I know why they were $10, they weren't that good.  If you want sushi or anything decently made, you gotta spend a bit more dough to get it.  It's pretty typical, nothing special about the place.  Nice spot to go on a date though, its dark so your date will think you are better looking than you actually are. HA. ZING. Night.
author: Cliff S.

description: I was here last month during the late lunch hour and ate at the bar. The food and drinks were awesome. The staff was great and very knowledgeable. The restaurant is very nice and the endless sake is a heavenly site. Thanks Eric Harris for the conversation and genuine hospitality.
author: Yoteo B.

description: Overpriced mediocre sushi.  There are so many better options available I don't understand why anybody would eat here.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Valet and Street Parking~
This place is huge~! 
The music? In the restroom is a chill interesting beat combined with learning (food related) Japanese. This is one of my new favorite Restaurants. 
Everything I had was Amazing. The Chefs special was so good I ordered two!
author: Adrienne A.

description:
The food and the service was horrific. We ordered our drinks, my friend and I got our drink first and over 45 minutes later my brother got his drink later. He also ordered shrimp tempura for appetizer. It was served at the end of the meal after the waiter was reminded many times throughout our meal. The miso soup was lukewarm, and I had to send to be warmed up. One of the items we ordered was wild salmon sashimi, the 3 orders came on one plates, family style for as if we were in family style restaurant, but this is not the end, the salmon portion was so small, probably no more than 2oz, and it cost $35.00 each. This is highway robbery!!! I ordered a vegetable dish of eggplant and shiitake which were so dry and tasteless.
The bottom line is we will never go back to this restaurant. It was an agonizing night!!!
author: Mona H.

description: First time at this restaurant. It lived up to the hype. Everything was fresh and light.  The atmosphere was lively and our waiter was great   The tuna appetizer was amazing and the sushi boat was on point. The only downside was the green tea ice cream. It seemed chalky and gritty. It was ok
author: Mike S.

description: We came here for a special occasion. Wasted $400 for 4 people on an aggressively mediocre meal. There are dozens of better Japanese restaurants in this city for a fraction of the cost. Tempura was greasy, sushi was run of the mill, menu is uninspired. Only highlight was the calamari 2 styles.
author: Roberto A.

description: Horrible experience. If I could give zero stars I would. Our server was not professional in the fact that he forgot that I had a food allergy which I had mentioned while ordering. Halfway through the meal while I was eating said offending food he told me that it was something I was allergic to. Fast forward and I am extremely sick 24 hours later. Also nearly every single item that we wanted to order was sold out. For $300 this place should step it up and hire better, more attentive servers. And stock what they list on the menu.
author: Rosie S.

description: Very good material. Ordered the Wagyu A5 and it was great. All dishes are exquisite and delicious.
author: Lancelot L.

description: Will definitely be back! We sat by the window, which has a little bit of a view of the water, plus the sushi is amazing!!! We love rainbow rolls -- so in addition to their signature rolls, they made us three for special order.  Love this place, it's now my go-to sushi place in SF! Brandon was great; all of his suggestions were superb!
author: Tatiana T.

description: What an excellent spot this place is in. The view of the bridge is Awesome and the food and service excellent. Wes, took great care of my aunt, sister and I. I loved his suggestions and cheery humor. Tasty Tempura and exquisite sushi.
author: Cecilia D.

description: Very overrated.  We came in looking to eat some food.  But if you are looking for food, you may want to go elsewhere.  They spread a lot of sauces to cover the plate but not much food on it.  If you plan on eating, you'll need to order too many plates at ridiculous prices to actually get a meal.  My stomach and my bank account had a lot in common as we left, they were both empty lol.  Our drinks took forever to get.  Lot's of fake people everywhere.  A big waste of time and money in the end.  Honestly, I don't mind spending big money on food as long as it's worth it.  This was not the case....
author: LaRay L.

description: I have never been a big fan of Sushi - just something I never preferred. We came here for lunch, party of 9, which gave me a chance to try most of the recommended stuff on the menu. To be fair, most of the dishes were amazing, the fried tempura was great, sushi rolls were brilliant, and their Salmon just melts in the mouth. Eric helped us out with some great cocktails and desserts too. Had a great time, I can say I will try sushi more often, and definitely at this place.
author: Rohit K.

description:
Second time here and if we lived here, we'd be here more often.

The food is spot on, no flaws whatsoever and the team, once you step through the doors, is top-notch.

The filet and wagyu beef dishes are amazing, as is the Sushi. 

Make this a spot you don't miss when you're in San Francisco.
author: Craig T.

description: My favorite Japanese sightly upscale (when you come in the evening) restaurant. My hubby and i, we like coming here with friends when we crave Japanese. We came here during the day once and for some reason this place does not have that modern sophisticated feel as it does in the evening. Good food, nice presentation, good service - that does not change no matter what time of the day you come in.
author: Chelse D.

description: Pretty good sushi... yellowtail belly was our fave. The beef appetizer was really good, served over spinach and eggplant. We had the zen desert, which featured some sort of custard with chocolate rocks and strawberries. Very unique and tasty. Service was fantastic. Definitely in the pricey side though.
author: Andy V.

description: This was the second time coming here.  The first time was great.  This time we had a waitress we hardly saw. She was so busy with a party of four we felt non existent.  We ordered two rolls and a large sashimi platter and it took forever.  Needless to say the other tables had food coming out all the time.  We got the food by asking another waiter who was filling our glass to see what was taking so long. Regarding the food, the sashimi platter was nothing like the last time we ordered.  Slices were small and were not the quality we had experienced before and at other places.  One roll was excellent and the other ok. It is too bad.  We had been looking forward to eating here again.
author: Charline B.

description: Awesome drinks. Sushi was fantastic. Would recommend. 5/5. I'll be honest, this is not a tip, it's a review. The salmon belly was lit af. How is this review still shorter than most. How much do you guys write. Seriously I give up; is what I would say if I was a plebian with an limited vocabulary that couldn't muster the diction to relate the sanctification that the sashimi bestowed upon my soul... I now see a path to salvation.
author: Sumukh A.

description: I came in yesterday and met the bartender named Eric. He was one of the most sweet people and was very attentive. I highly recommend asking for him if you go in. Great job Eric!
author: Maria A.

description:
Nice trendy atmosphere but overall a rushed experience. Came here for a 9:30 reservation when they close at 10:30. The waiter must not have been paying attention when we placed our order because every single dish we ordered came out wrong. (Ex: Different vegetable dishes were brought than the ones we ordered). We politely sent back our sushi and appetizers. Within 2 minutes new dishes were brought to the table. Some were corrected, others weren't, and the vegetable dishes never came back at all. 
We got our drinks after the food came out and the second we put our chopsticks down our plates were collected. 
The food itself wasn't anything special. The tuna was slightly fishy. 
Our dinner was over within 35 minutes. 
This place has potential but definitely needs to improve its service.
author: Cherie E.

description:
I've been here a few times.

I always love the hostesses and waitresses but food is just always ok... There are better and more affordable restaurant options in the city.... No wonder the Oakland location closed. 

I feel like rolls are always dry because they are not always freshly made. 

I gave this place a few tries but I think I'm done because I make better Sushi (Shari) myself.
author: C M.

description:
Strange how the bitter realization that you got ripped off can linger in your mouth and keep you up at night until you vent it out with a review. Two scallops in a bed of unseasoned greens for $24. That's $12 per scallop, plus tax and tip. I ordered scallops, I got dry leaves with a couple of scallops on top. 

I received the same treatment with the black miso cod. I know the oceans are depleted... but this is an exorbitant amount of money for something the size of a small egg. 

I came out of the restaurant with my bank account and my stomach both growling in unison. 

I can't for the life of me understand what made the ones responsible think that this is acceptable, so I can only assume they are cynical, unloving people. I have worked a long time in the hospitality business and I am an easy, friendly, accommodating customer. But this isn't right. 

The food should have tasted OK, but came out bland in the face of such stinginess. Good hospitality requires genuine generosity -- an essential ingredient they seem to have forgotten.
author: Peter B.

description:
Very nice restaurant 
Sushi is normal sushi nothing special 
Services is excellent 
We have big bill for little sushi and sake ...
But not bad for all the experience ~
author: Chang O.

description: Quality food at high prices but the food is good. Sushi is solid. Sake is excellent. Atmosphere and ambience is good too. Service is top notch.
author: Tom K.

description:
Super over-priced SMALL sushi rolls. Came here on a Saturday night with a group of friends, it was nice because there was no wait, but that's about it. 

Our server was slow to greet the table, to bring drinks (even water) and I'm pretty sure they missed one meal that we ordered (we ordered over $500 worth of food and drinks). The sushi rolls were described WAY better on the menu than they showed up in person and were way too skinny. 

The best think we had was the black miso cod. Definitely wouldn't come here again...
author: Anastacia W.

description:
Which was wilder: our
dinner or the cray restrooms
that spoke Japanese?
author: Dan B.

description:
My party and I arrived early for our 8 pm reservations on a Wednesday night, and were told we'd be seated early if possible. After getting drinks and an appetizer in the bar area, we had to check back with 3-4 different hostesses on the status of our table. None of whom seemed to be communicating with each other. There seemed to be confusion among them about whether we were staying at the bar or waiting for a table, even though we continuously reiterated to each one of them that we were waiting for a table. At one point we were offered a table on the other side of the bar and we had to again confirm that we are waiting for a table in the dining room and had made opentable reservations days before. Finally at 8:00, then 8:10, then 8:15 we got updates that the party vacating our table was still ordering drinks and there was nothing they could do. How about managing reservations and tables well? 

Finally when we were seated in the dining room, we discovered the reason table turn over is so delayed. About 5 minutes after we'd finished all our initial dishes, our server came over to see if we wanted anything more. He didn't check on us at all when our dishes came out and hadn't noticed we were missing soy sauce. We had to flag the person clearing the table next to us to ask him for soy sauce. We then ordered more food, then someone else came and cleared our plates and chopsticks and we had to ask for more plates and utensils when our second round of dishes arrived. 

Lastly, we ordered two desserts to split among 4 of us, and the server misheard and brought only 1 and the check. There was so apology or acknowledgement of the inconvenience when we asked for the second dessert that we'd ordered. 


Highly highly disappointing dining experience, will never come here again or recommend to anyone!
author: Biruk A.

description: This is a great sushi joint with extremely nice bartenders such as Trista who takes very good care of her patients. The sushi is solid and they have an incredible selection of sake and Japanese specialty beer. Winner.
author: Steven D.

description: First time at this restaurant on a girls night out with my mom and a girl friend. The food and drink is very good here and it looks like a nice trendy spot. There's a lounge bar when you first enter and it looks more like open seating. As you walk further inside the restaurant there are tables and you can sit at the sushi bar and watch the sushi chef make rolls and sashimi. The service is good too, I liked our waiter. The fish tastes very fresh and I tried the Girdara black cod which was very well marinated, tender and succulent. The edamame was typical. The sushi had fresh tasting fish and there was a variety of wine flights. There is also a large variety is sake to share. Definitely would come back here again.
author: Diana T.

description: Great place for lunch! I ordered the Kaisen-don which is prawns, scallops and salmon over rice. The portion of rice was very big compared to the amount of seafood and in the end I still had half a plate of rice left. I would have liked the ratio to be a bit better, let's be honest we mainly want the seafood, but it is a rice bowl so can't really complain. Overall  it was very filling and delicious.
author: Janet N.

description: Come here for the best quality sushi in the city of SF.  These experienced sushi chefs have hookups on fish that most SF sushi eateries do not.  Huge menu, beautiful ambiance, professional wait staff.
author: Kevin B.

description: This was a wonderful bachelorette dinner experience! Our server was exceptional and the manager Mel made us feel welcome and encouraged us to have fun! The food tasted amazing and the service was perfect!!
author: Ashley S.

description: I've been here several times. I enjoy their lunch over dinner. The lunch bento boxes and ramen are amazing. When I came for dinner friends and I shared a few rolls and had cocktails and sake.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Beautiful restaurant with excellent mojitos and absolutely delicious food. Every dish we had was impeccable.

The waitstaff was friendly, and the service was quick, but Mel (the manager) really stood out. Clearly a man who takes a lot of pride in his job, he made a point of introducing himself to all of the patrons and making sure we were having a great evening out. Unlike a lot of managers who stay in their offices, he was out on the floor the entire night. He was extremely gracious and polite and really put my experience at Ozumo over the top.
author: Al I.

description:
Imagine the horror - You are hungry and staying in the next door hotel whose only room service offering is sushi from Ozumo. And you don't like sushi! :(

After scouring the menu my eyes landed on the mother load - a steak rice bowl made with prime steak, sweet onion, and shimeji mushroom served atop sticky rice (a favorite). A total belly pleasure! 

This place is highly rated on Yelp and I will happily lick my lips upon my return to San Francisco.
author: Patrick K.

description: Extremely overpriced for small quantities and average food. Good sushi tends to be expensive, but this was a big disappointment. I will not go back.
author: Nicole K.

description: First class from start to finish. Great service and quality sushi that we simply don't get on the east coast. Even the edamame app was creative. Top scores for Ozumo!
author: Dave H.

description: Love the view of the water and the modern decor. The best saki I've ever had with expert tasting notes to help you decide what to order. Brandon was our server and he was excellent. Great sushi and I loved the black cod.
author: Flavia C.

description: I'm giving this 5 stars for a single reason. The sushi and sashimi was very good. But I'm having a harder and harder time differentiating between quality sushi restaurants.  The hamachi with jalapeño dish was very good, like it is at most good sushi restaurants. But I was blown away by the desserts.  Specifically the Mochi cake dish is extraordinary.   I would and will go back just for that.  Seriously, it's a must try. You won't regret it.
author: David C.

description:
I was hanging out with a group of friends. I believe there were about 8 of us. Suddenly we all decided to go to Ozumo to continue our day of eating and drinking. We didn't have a reservation. Luckily, it was in the middle of the afternoon on a weekend, so it wasn't super busy. They were able to seat us at a long table against the wall in the front.

May 2013
*Kaiso Seaweed Salad http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ozumo-san-francisco#1-F2kPYJsVscU2z2fPCzKQ
*Hanabi http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ozumo-san-francisco?select=QrYPdPKn3s3BRJYTHcllcw#QrYPdPKn3s3BRJYTHcllcw

So I know we ordered way more food than this, but I was too preoccupied with drinking to pay attention. I really didn't eat much, so I can't really comment on the food.

The drinking was super fun! It had been a while since this group of friends got together, so it was great catching up. The front of the restaurant is more of a lounge. Bustling with music playing. It's great if you're in a super social mood.

I'd definitely come back to check out their food and drinks again! Great place to have drinks, catch up and snack on shared plates.
author: Elena N.

description: Tuna and salmon on the chefs choice menu was groundbreaking.  Really disappointed in the supermarket chef selection of $100.  For this reason, never a return.  First dining disappoint ever of American Platinum concierge.
author: Doug D.

description: The food was absolutely delicious. The service however not so good. We would get our sushi and not have ginger or wasabi. We ordered drinks and two dishes later they brought our drinks after we complained (the manager was amazing and comp'd our drinks because of the delay). The kicker of all we order sweet shrimp and after they bought we waited and waited and finally got ginger.  After a while asked when will we get the shrimp head the waiter said "ooh I forgot about that".  Again horrible service but the food is great.
author: Stella D.

description:
The Sekiwake Roll is nothing short of brilliant... Thoughts of spicy tuna and peanut sauce are swirling my memories as I type!

We didn't have a reservation, but were able to belly up at the bar. Our bartender was very attentive and friendly. She made great suggestions, and made sure to check on us frequently. I was very impressed with the Sake Menu, although the pricing is certainly something to note. The small pours don't last long.
author: Jenni D.

description:
We had several different food choices. Raw fish, cooked rolls great cocktails . The raw fish was just ok... Looking forward to some great bluefin toro tuna disappointed . I actually had one bite and sent it back! Fishy not delicious ....our waiter Wes was great His service and bus  was super . I feel like this place would be better if they gave u better quality fish for ur $$
 Great views beautiful ambience
author: Jeanine S.

description: Great atmosphere and the ambiance is quite romantic. Good that they can accommodate big parties.
author: Grennan K.

description:
Overall: Ozumo definitely caters to the business crowd and visitors to SF who are coming for the view and atmosphere. This is also an option if you're craving sushi and the ability to make a reservation that doesn't require a minimum of 30 days. Otherwise, I'd stick to some of the SF staples 

Food & Drink: 3 stars. For $45 I ordered the filet. Overall flavors were great and it cooked solid to my medium order. My friends ordered a variety of the sashimi pieces and seemed to enjoy but not be overwhelmed by them. They countered the Sushi in Seattle is much better - I would agree.

Atmosphere: 4 stars: there's plenty of spacing, nice lighting and with our table at the back of the restaurant, we had a beautiful view of the Bay bridge.

Service: 2-3 stars. While polite and doing the best she could, service was really slow. When I'm paying SOMA prices for food, I also expect the waiter to have some knowledge of the wine regardless of cuisine served. You can't get away with not being on top of everything and maintain the high prices without full service.

Recommendation: So many other great sushi places in the city. I'd skip.
author: Jessica C.

description: Definitely recommend this place for their happy hours. It gets very busy so make sure you come early to stake out a spot. One of my coworkers ordered everyone off the happy hour menu. I would skip on the fried oysters. I personally loved the ramen though it's hard to share.
author: Jackie W.

description: Have tried the Oakland location before but this location is more visually pleasing. It's bigger with a sushi and sake bar. The decor is reminiscent of morimotos. The chefs and waitstaff are on point and the food is delicious. The seafood and paired sauces are light and delicious. Also tried the tofu, scallop, shrimp and all of it was amazing. Would def come back.
author: Linda H.

description:
LOVE this place. Yes it's pricey sushi but you know what you're getting!

The vibe is probably my favorite aspect. They play lounge music and everything is super luxe and trendy. The bar is amazing and the drinks are sweet! Try the giddy geisha, my fav.

Perfect for a date night or a small group night on the town. Workers are attentive and valet in front! Score.
author: Mahsa T.

description:
Food is probably 4 stars, solid sushi. But it's pretty expensive and there are much better places in terms of quality for the price. 

The ambiance of the restaurant and drinks make it a really nice place for dates, business dinners, etc. Been here a few times - never any complaints. 

The bartender deserves 5 stars though. Great service.
author: Peter T.

description:
San Fran 
By the ferry building
Amazing! JT recommendation

Shacho - only four pieces so tiff and I said we'd probably order different rolls instead. 8.5
Sekiwake- 9.5
Hamachi maki- 10
Abate- ribs, not good. 5
Ozumo-
author: Utah F.

description: Seriously, one of the Best Japanese restaurants in the US! Amazing food, wines, sakes, views, and exceptional service on every level! Largest, exclusive sake list that I've seen in all the places I gone to from New York, Boston, LA, Las Vegas and Miami. Ask for the amazing gracious GM, Miho who goes above and beyond to make your experience so memorable! Mel & Jess who will show you how to live it up at Ozumo! My favorite Bartender, Marcos for your yummy drinks and Olivia and Boom for an exceptional dining experience in SF! Don't forget to bring your friends and family, they will love you for it!!
author: Teada D.

description:
Impeccable service. Felt like royalty on night out. The food was great, drinks were delicious. 

Recommendations:
Giddy geisha cocktail 
Tuna tartare app 

Or.. Anything on the menu. Lol! 

Fondue at the end was something to look forward :) 

Very classy dining and can't wait to try the Oakland location.
author: Kate N.

description: Great service and atmosphere, we came for the sushi hoping to be wowed but were unfortunately underwhelmed. Small portions, moderate flavor, and a high price tag. Now I totally understand paying for quality food, but we have sushi in my hometown that tastes MUCH better and you get the same number of rolls for almost half the price. The taste wasn't enough to prompt a return visit.
author: Kathryn B.

description: I met my 3 friends at Ozumo for dinner last Thursday night. I waited in the bar until they arrived and ordered a Sancerre (not on the wine menu by the glass, but he did have it which was a plus, since their selection wasn't ideal on the menu). I paid $23 for the glass ($27 after tip)...by the way, my husband owns a winery and I know this is EXTREMELY overpriced for any Sancerre. Another friend arrives and she orders the same thing...again $23 for the glass. We are seated and order another glass each OF THE SAME WINE during dinner, and we're charged $20/per glass (did I mention anything over $16 for a glass of of any Sancerre is ridiculously overpriced)? Something is very off in the bar area. Either the bartenders are charging up for extra tips, or they have a disconnect with the servers in the dining room. Overall the service in the dining room was good, as well as the food, but I've definitely had better. But for a wine list that is lacking some great vino choices, they're overcharging for everything. I called the manager that night on my way home, since I was so irritated by discrepancy of cost between the bartenders and ordering in the dining area. He was very nice, but had no explanation as to why they have different charges. I've decided I won't be back (and my friends most likely won't be either).
author: Shelly S.

description: Very friendly and efficient service. We were impressed by our servers enthusiasm and style. We were celebrating and she did everything to make sure we were taken care of. It's expensive but the food was delicious. Especially the yellowtail belly sashimi that she recommended...Melt in your mouth goodness.
author: Laurie S.

description:
This place I thought was huge! The inside was beautiful, and we were seating near the chefs station, which was awesome to be able to see the chefs making the masterpieces. There is great sushi everywhere in San Fran. That being said, it takes a lot for restaurants to really stick out in San Fran. We started out with miso soup, vegetable tempura, and the dohyo. I usually can judge a Japanese restaurant off of the miso soup - their's was delicious! Super fresh, not fishy at all. The tempura was light and not heavy sitting, and the dohyo was fresh and divine as well. 

For dinner I ordered the Omakase, which means chefs selections. This is another one of my favorite things to do at a Japanese restaurant. Some of the fish that came with my Omakase were, tuna belly, salmon belly, yellow tail belly, white tuna, and Japanese mackerel. Oh my LAWD! Each piece was delectably fresh and satisfying. I strongly recommend getting chefs choice at any restaurant, but especially here. The staff here is very attentive, sometimes I think they rush to turn over tables, but I think their staff is just attentive and want to make sure everything is running smoothly. All in all, really awesome experience, and I definitely recommend!
author: Cate T.

description: One of my favorite sushi/sashimi spots. Sashimi platter is a must. If you don't try Ozumo you haven't had the true SF sushi experience.
author: Ian M.

description:
Hands down the BEST sushi place I've ever been to! You just can't go wrong with the Bucho or Spider maki.

Great value for money, perfect for a night out on the town. The ambiance is fabulous, the service is top-notch and very, very friendly. We picked this spot randomly for an impromptu NYE dinner to pass time before the fireworks on Embarcadero, and man  oh man, was that a solid idea! They were crazy busy and even then, the service was super efficient and even with the restaurant at full capacity, it didn't feel claustrophobic at all. I left this restaurant a happy camper, and can't wait for the next time I get to dine at Ozumo!
author: Manal M.

description:
We had a really nice meal at Ozumo.  I won't go into every dish but I will hit some highlights. The garlic and soy edamame was tasty but messy - you don't typically expect flavor dialed up in edamame. Very good though. The Shacho roll was a fave, with Maine lobster, jalapeño and cilantro wrapped in tuna and sesame paper (without rice or seaweed). We also really liked the Hanabi, wich was hamachi sashimi, sliced avocado and jalapeño bathed in a warm ginger sauce. The Doyho small plate was also great, with spicy tuna tartare and avocado formed in a round mold and served with fried noodle chips.  It was almost like elegant Japanese nachos with the chips served on the side. 

My favorite of the bigger plates was the gindara, their miso cod, which I'll order anywhere I see it on the menu - that is by far my favorite preparation for cooked fish, and one of my favorite dishes bar none. This version was particularly wonderful.  We also had a number of great rolls too. This restaurant is actually quite large and seemed to go on forever, despite its comparatively small storefront on Steuart St. Very good Japanese fusion restaurant. Really enjoyed it.
author: Michael S.

description:
High price tag on mediocre sushi sometimes less than mediocre.  The fish is fresh and isn't the issue but any sushi enthusiast would know that a piece of fresh fish isn't the only thing that defines a good piece of sushi.  The rice is inconsistent.  Most often times too wet and sometimes undercooked.  Rice to fish proportions lack balance as well.  As of late, our favorite dish there, miso black cod, has been overcooked the past 3-4 times we've been.  This is what you get in a part of town where people in the financial district fuels their operations.  

However, the vibe and setting keeps me and my friends coming back. There's always chatter and a good feel commotion going on at the bar with a very good looking crowd. More than anything we can guarantee a bite at the later hours of the night.  If you're into sake, their selection hardly disappoints with such a large variety.  If you don't know much about sake, their sommelier and servers will be able to take you thru the menu.  

If you come here, enjoy the atmosphere and don't get your hopes too high with the sushi if you're a real sushi lover.  Be prepared to spend your hard earned money here because there would be no avoiding for a good time.
author: Colin M.

description:
The food here used to be some of the most impressive in the city. (This whole strip of restaurants used to be great; I saw Santana eatinfat Chaya once). Since then, it has been superseded by better sushi joints and the overall food quality has decreased. But most shocking was the service we experienced. I don't usually give bad reviews for bad service because all humans have off days but this was a slew of people with unbelievably poor professionalism. Despite spending around $700, we were treated like crap. 

First of all, you can make a reservation for Ozumo at 10:15 and 10:30. So we arrive at 10:20 with a reservation and are informed we won't be able to have dinner but we can sit at the bar because the kitchen closes at 10:30. Now not only did we bring a rockstar guest who was hungry but also why would you make tables available on OpenTable at times when your kitchen is closed?! In the bar area, it wasn't even possible to hear each other speak. 

We waited ten minutes while the waitress fetched the hostess to talk about it and then the hostess fetched the manager to talk about. When she came back she notified us that we had ten minutes to order. So finally we are seated at 10:30 and the waiter just disappears. Around 10:45 I waived down someone else who took our order because I was worried the kitchen would be closed. I had been looking for our waiter for probably ten minutes by then, even went to the window to show our guest the bridge lights while waiting. 

After we ate (the food was ok, some of the sushi hadn't even fully thawed yet), our guest was told to chug her wine by the waiter because the dishwasher was leaving!  Meanwhile the female manager took our guest's credit card from the table (without asking) and tried to run the tab with that card! We had already paid.  I still cannot believe how she just plucked it from the table (where it was sitting amongst our guest's other purse contents) and tried to run it for the check.

Of course, when dessert time came, we couldn't have dessert. So why weren't we given a dessert menu up front? Seriously, if your guests don't even have time to sit down and order food, why do you make tables available at that time?
author: Marina N.

description:
Friendly staff.
Great service.
Lots of seating availability for lunch.
Walk ins ok.
Trendy atmosphere.
Good food.

Seaweed salad was amazing.
Edamame soy beans- loved the garlic over regular .
Tempura was delicious.
Gyozas were very good too.

Bento boxes just ok.
Ramen good.
author: Azizi A.

description: Another place that finally got their health score up, but it's too late. It's unacceptable, and frankly gross, to get such a low health score no matter your food, but a sushi place?! No way. Will never go again.
author: Nancy R.

description: Ozumo is a fantastic high end Japanese restaurant--hands down the best I've ever been to. Amazing selection of sakes, delicious food from the appetizers to sashimi to tempura to special surprises from the talented sushi chefs and even desserts, classy and comfortable atmosphere, and knowledgeable, friendly and capable staff. My first choice anytime I want to enjoy a fine Japanese dining experience.
author: Glenn H.

description: It's an ok place.   A little over priced for the ambience and food.   Dinner is usually crowded and noisy and just tables set end to end like a mess hall.   There's very few items on their happy hour.   All in all, unless it's necessary on a invitation or event party, won't be going there soon.
author: Paul T.

description:
Came here with a friend of mine!   First, the waiter/bartender who served was amazing!  He felt bad the hostess never showed up for a good 15 minutes to seat us.  We ended up seating ourselves.  They need to hire more staff if that busy!

Bay Shrimp salad was ok.  Tempura was great!    
Ambience, was good, good selection of wines and so forth!   3 stars due to lack of hostess greeting us!   I am going to return to give them another chance :)
author: Kali L.

description: If you're looking for the starbucks of sushi, go to sugarfish. If you're looking for an intimate experience where friends all become silent mid conversation... those rare moments... where the food hits your tastebuds and the world stops spinning... come to ozumo. The plates serve as convenient reminders of the geography of places you've been during your walks of life. They are accommodating of shellfish allergies too. You could easily eat 6 meals here during 72 hours.
author: Brian C.

description: Went during lunch.  Hostess seemed frazzled. Sat in the bar area which was lovely. Our waitress was sweet, however not very attentive. The bento box was served at least 10 minutes before the sushi came out. And this is where they barely get a 2 rating - the tobiko was less than fresh. It absolutely did not pop in my mouth, barely squished. And the uni was less than flavorful. For a $100 lunch for 2, which did not even include alcohol (just tea) - it was a less than 'ok' experience. I would absolutely not return, which is unfortunate because again, the ambiance in the bar area, even at lunch, was really nice.
author: Sheryl F.

description:
Miso soup was salty and I like mine on the flavor side 
Had just the shrimp tempura rolls
It was just ok and only came with 5 pieces  
All costing 16 - 17 bucks plus 1 drink a beer and we were at 30 definitely not worth the cost even if they did add fish eggs to the roll
author: Mia P.

description:
Great decor and good service. 
Mediocre food and high prices.

Stumbled into Ozumo on a Wednesday night with a party of 4. Stumbled out $500 lighter and disappointed (~_~).

Based on my last post, I said I'm done with Japanese food for a while. Why didn't I just go back Kusakabe?!

Garlic soy sauce edamame - good, but SALTY! 

Salmon Belly Sashimi & Uni nigiri - my favorite dishes!

Unagi nigiri, Kaarage, Ebi Tempura, raw oysters - eh.. can't really mess this up.

Whack:
Snow crab sashimi
Toro nigiri
Their rolls, we ordered 2 of the recommended rolls. The rice tasted like something from the cold section of 7-11.

We also ordered ribs, 3 ribs. This was TENDER! It needed a dash of flavor, but the meat was extremely tender.

A steak (5 or so pieces) dish that was ruined with a thick berry sauce. The meat was tender, but what's with the sauce? It does nothing.

Overall the food was not worth the price, not even close...
author: Charisa N.

description: havent been to ozumo in years but got treated to lunch this week and it left a LOT to be desired :(  service was super slow - we didnt put in our order for like 15-20 minutes which is hard when lunch is only supposed to be an hour?  we all got the kurasawa bento box - $25.  to be honest, the quality of the nigiri's was pretty lackluster. california roll was...a california roll. only redeeming item was the sashimi.. yikes! i wouldnt pay to come eat here...
author: Christina L.

description: I would definitly come back here again, one of the best sushi i had in years. Service was awesome.
author: Michael C.

description:
Pretty place, but that's the high point.

The service is awful, and the busier it gets the worse the service. The food is OK, overpriced but considering the setting...

the service ruins the experience.

Pass
author: William M.

description: Taking price into account, it was pricey for what it was. Good food. The sashimi was fresh. We had small plates and they were good, but not for that price good. Nice view of the Bay Bridge depending on where you were seated. Great place to learn and taste different sakes. We had 2 different flights. Overall, good.
author: Glendy T.

description: One of the most amazing sushi experiences I have ever encountered!!! AJ (our waitress) was AMAZING, helpful and so sweet! I would more than highly recommend Ozumo!!! AMAZING!!!!
author: Michael G.

description:
A hip and upscale Japanese restaurant that has both a separate sushi bar and tepanyaki Restaraunt. I'll admit when my best friend and I came here our sobriety was in question, but I do remember the ambience of thr place made me feel like I was in Japan. It felt very zen yet not stuffy. Our waitress was very nice and patient with us when I took forever to order. 

We ordered a mixed tempura appetizer which was delicious and beautifully presented. They even fry leaves to add to the aesthetic. Our rolls were delicious as well: My friend ordered the lobster roll, which he loved but wished there was more of. I devoured whatever I ordered. Bottom line is they will take care of you here and give you good sushi.
author: Kitty A.

description: Unsure how to rate this. Loved the food although super high priced! Didn't receive some rolls and uni that we ordered, they took that off the bill. Also were scammed a sake bottle when we chose one and they ended up bringing one 400 dollars more than expected and still had to pay for it. Overall will not be coming back after the sake experience.
author: Brielle W.

description:
So I haven't been back here since my 2012 two star review. My wife and I decided to meet a business friend for dinner here last night. My wife and I arrived early, so we ordered a drink and some edamame, followed with an order of a dozen raw oysters. First bad mistake: edamame arrived and before it even touched our lips.. We both looked at each other and said they smell of stinky old fish! We tried one bean and spit hem out. The waitress came over in a few and asked how it was. We told her and she did not look shocked to hear this at all. She said she'd go get another batch. Then returned and said the 'chef' tried them and said he didn't smell fish. I'm sure he couldn't smell fish if it crawled inside his nose. He worked with it all day, or evening!  
Then she said they would all be the same. So we declined another one. She was very nice about it. Then our dozen oysters arrived as six! Good thing they messed up the amount. They ruined the raw oysters by placing sour tasting soy sauce like stuff in the shell and pimento on top each one! They left the nastiest after taste I've ever had. I've heard people say this place has really gone downhill. And with how few people were in here, and our experience? I agree!
author: Kirk M.

description: I had similar negative experience as what was described in Davey J.'s post from 12/21/2017. I was also staying at the hotel next door and decided to get take out. I only ordered two items and was told that the order will be ready in 20 min. I got there in 20 min, and order was not ready. I was told to sit at the bar table to wait. After another 20 min, still no one gave me my order. I went to ask about my order, it was actually sitting at the back of the bar table and the hostess asked me if I have asked the staff in the back earlier. So it was my fault to not have checked?! I was told to sit at the bar table and wait! Food was okay but definitely overpriced. The service definitely made the experience worse.
author: Allison T.

description:
One positive, the bar area can be fun if you like sake.

If you eat here you should come here for the food from kitchen and not the raw fish. Their cooked food is above average, even though it's a bit more than above average in price. Their sushi is at best average while significantly above average in price. Today we had toro that was still basically frozen. Completely ridiculous when they are charging over $11 a piece. The moriawase was nothing you couldn't get at a random neighborhood sushi place, but your neighborhood sushi place wouldn't charge you that much for it. 

On the plus side, this most recent experience convinced my group that this place was mediocre so I can add them to the growing list of people who won't try to get me to come here for mediocre overpriced sushi when there are so many better options in the city.
author: Jeff L.

description:
One of my favorite spot in San Francisco. 

If you want one of the best wait staff I have ever encountered - you need to look for Danny. Not only is he attentive, and can help with how things are prepared. He KNOWS his sake. Don't hesitate to ask him about anything.
author: Alexander N.

description:
I love the manager! Even though I go there once in a blue moon, he always remembers us! One of the nicest people working there!
     Red Bentley
author: Thomas J.

description:
The interior, central dining area, reminds me of a Sake box!

They have an impressively wide range of Sake collections to choose from and we went with the waiter's recommendation of the Sho Chiku Bao!  It was surely strong for a sake!

Their sushi rolls and sashimi is pricey, but its reasonable since it is near the Pier!

They have a bar setting, upon entering this place!  

It's a great spot to grab sushi, sashimi and sake!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Stale and tasteless fish follows by sub-par service. 

I would not recommend this place.
author: Amber B.

description:
This place has gone massively downhill and now become the worst place for Japanese food in SF.  Overpriced food and terrible service.  Our waiter stopped by our table once every half hour.  Wipe the table and toss a pile of tobiko directly on the floor next to us.  If we want to split the bill - mandatory 20% service charge... no thank you!

This place is shameful to be associated with Japanese culture.

Live only a couple blocks away, have been dozens of times, will never be coming back.
author: Joris P.

description:
3 Reasons I go to SF:

Sissy
Her Dog (shout out to Harley)
OZUMO

As a vegan , I rarely eat anything that is not plant based. However, at Ozumo, I indulge in UNI and oysters, a variety of seaweed salads, and of course, their amazing SAKE'.

Each time we go there, service is 5 star. 

This last time, Boom, our server, was as usual amazing. She was very helpful and informative about the menu and sake selection.

the Director of Hospitality, MEL, was also a rockstar. He is PERFECT at what he does and made us feel very welcome and like we've been a guest at Ozumo for years. Very sweet - entire team is awesome.

Cant wait till next time!
author: Melineh H.

description: I always liked the restaurant but two days ago disappointed by service at lunch - I was sat at the sushi counter and almost 15 minutes no water, no Menu -
author: Jennifer Y.

description: I don't eat sushi but the food was great . Had the tempora (shrimp And veggie) also the calimari.
author: Chris M.

description:
Ozumo is a regular happy hour spot in SoMa. Their beer, sake, and cocktails are good - I can't say I have any favorites. The food/small plates are delicious though (garlic edamame is worth it every time). Other than that, parties of 10 or more need to call ahead and book (no OpenTable for you) and it's pretty dark in Ozumo. I do like that the sound level is reasonable, even late on weekdays. 

4/5, solid spot.
author: Irina P.

description: This review is for the chef and not the servers. The servers were okay but could have done way better if they didn't give all of their attention to the guys in suits. Unfortunately my gf and I waited 20 minutes before a server acknowledged us. The chef however, this cool surfer-looking guy always checked up on us and made sure we were happy even though he wasn't a server. He saw we weren't being attended by our server so he took initiative and made sure we got our server. He engaged in conversations with most guests sitting in front of him. He even got us a sample dessert. Let me tell you that he got a better tip (I tipped him twice because he went out of his way 2 times) than the server. I'm definitely going back and want to sit at the same place! I love the quality of food and service from the chefs!
author: Paulo F.

description: Don't be fooled by the "looks", despite the fancy wannabe design, that place is far from being a nice restaurant. The service is terribly amateur,  to say the least, and the food is not solid. I'm sure San Francisco can do much better. Please send the chef/owner to visit Nobu, Zuma, Makoto to learn what a Japanese restaurant is all about.
author: Antonio C.

description:
A few co-workers and I stopped in Ozumo because we were in the mood for soup and noodles and this was one of the few places by our office in the Financial district that offered a good variety of that menu item.

FREQUENCY: I've dined at this establishment once.

FOOD: I ordered the Yakisoba noodles which had a fried egg, beef, cabbage, beansprouts and some delicious seasoning. I was very impressed with the meal. I find a good bowl of ramen very comforting especially when its extra spicy. The waiter offered both spicy seasoning and Sriracha sauce as condiments for the soup. The soup was a little pricier than I would expect for a bowl of ramen but this restaurants also looks like its a classy place so I wasn't completely the surprised. The prices matched the atmosphere.

DRINK: Ozumo has a big bar at which to order a variety of alcoholic beverages. Since I was there for lunch on a work day I did not indulge but instead had water. They also offer fountain drinks. I do not know if they offer happy hour but I would like to go back some time after work to see.

ATMOSPHERE: Ozumo had a very fancy atmosphere. The lightning is little lower than normal and everything seemed to be made of wood. They had smaller tables near the front for quick drop in dining and a bigger area in the back for reserved tables. I imagine this could be a great place to take someone for drinks after work especially if you want to bring them somewhere with a nice or classy feel to it.

STAFF: Our waiter was very friendly and was able to offer recommendations for ramen bowls to me and each of my co-workers. All of his recommendations turned out to be outstanding. Being lunch time on a work day he stopped by frequently enough that we didn't have to wait long to pay our check which I find is important when patrons might have to rush back to the office.

PAYMENT: Credit cards or cash were acceptable.

I was very impressed with my experience at Ozumo. Do to the price of the ramen bowl it's not a place I'll go to every week for lunch but I wouldn't be surprised if I ended up there about once per month. And food aside, I absolutely see myself going back after work to try a happy hour. If you work or live in the Financial District and you are looking for a good bowl of ramen where price isn't an issue, then Ozumo is a great choice.
author: Christopher D.

description:
We been here a numerous of times and never have a bad experience. The foods here are great and the sushi is delicious.
Last Night we got Z as our server and he recommended new dishes that off the menu and it was great too. Also, the sake was smooth and silky. Overall, it was a pleasant experience because he make us laughing through out the night with good sense of humor. Good job!
author: Vinh P.

description: Good sushi and friendly bar service.  Definitely a good south beach spot for clean food.
author: Steve L.

description: We came here for a family birthday dinner for my brother and I. Made a reservation for 5:45pm on a Wednesday evening, however traffic from the east bay was so terrible we did not arrive until 6:30pm. We called from the road and the hostess was very accommodating and moved our reservation to a later time. When we walked in, the hostess was also very friendly and a welcoming face. Wish I had gotten her name! She even seated us next to the window, with a great view of the bay bridge. I ordered the japiño colada and my parents each ordered a different cocktail that I can't recall the names of. I thought the cocktail was a tad strong for my taste but my father enjoyed his. We started off with garlic edamame and dohyo (tuna tartare), both excellent. We ordered five sushi rolls: ozumo, shacho, bucho, the spicy scallop roll, and a spicy tuna roll. All delicious, but a must-order is the shacho roll. It is a lobster roll, but so fresh!! A great take in comparison to most baked lobster rolls seen in other sushi restaurants. Decided to forgo dessert at ozumo to get specialty ice cream elsewhere in SF, but the waiter did bring my brother and I birthday ice cream. A scoop of delicious vanilla bean topped with fresh mint and fruit. It was a lovely dinner - highly recommended for special occasions!
author: Kira M.

description: Sushi was good but not the value for the price.  It is definitely a tourist trap restaurant.  Definitely would try to go elsewhere.
author: E M.

description:
Awesome Japanese food in Soma area. I had my wedding dinner here and it was absolutely fantastic. Service moved us to the nicest table to make sure it was super special. Customer service is really good. I tend to eat the tapas that are more izakaya style. Probably favorite Japanese place in SF. Only negative is that beers are some what pricey. 
M
author: Matthew M.

description: Very good sushi.  Creative combination of bold and subtle flavors.  Interesting complementary sauces.  Somewhat expensive (especially for those not accustomed to California prices).  It is also not easy to get used to the "self-declared" "SF Ordinance Fee" that some restaurants (including Ozumo) impose on customers as a fictitious tax.
author: Dan S.

description: The fish we were served on New Years Eve wasn't fresh.  Beautiful location, but for the price I expected a lot more.
author: Sam W.

description:
Ozumo is an up market, americanized sushi restaurant

It has nice ambiance.

The service was good and the food delicious and attractively presented..
author: David T.

description: My wallet still hurts from the mediocre dishes I got served at triple the price that makes sense
author: Jason Y.

description:
I'm really surprised that this place doesn't have 4.5 stars. We all did 9 courses omakase with sake pairing and it was amazing!!!

FOOD- wow .. fish were super fresh and the delicious 
They have a great way with food. It's just innovative and kick it into high gear.

SERVICE- incredible!!! Zeon, thank you for your quick, friendly and pleasant service. You're amazing
author: Jesse N.

description: Awesome location,atmosphere,service.food,quality!!!By far,my favorite Japanese in SF.
author: Girandi C.

description:
Food is quite good, but not fantastic. Nice ambience, but over-priced.

I had a Sunday special Omakase with seven courses.

The restaurant has very nice upscale decorations and left me a good first impression. The plates and dishes are nice, BUT with disposable chopsticks, ironically carefully wrapped in napkins. Also, these are even not good disposable chopsticks. To match their upscale environment and high prices, they should probably get rid of these disposable ones.

The first course is white tuna and scallop sashimi. Both very fresh and tasty, but should have been served with ginger.

The second is a salad with three different kinds of seaweeds. The three different kinds of seaweeds form a nice texture and is overall delicious.

Following that comes the best course of the night, Futago, which is seared beef with sautéed garlic spinach and eggplant, topped with miso sesame sauce. The dish has a very rich taste - the three different layers of flavors burst out in the mouth and form a most enjoyable trio of the ingredients.

The fourth course is hamachi and avocado in ginger ponzu. The hamachi tastes a little bit fishy, probably because it's not the best season for hamachi. Would be better if served with lime instead of avocado.

The fifth is miso black cod and grilled peppers. I think this is the worst dish of the night. The black cod was overcooked and had a burnt taste, and the peppers tasted too dry. Also, totally didn't get the point of bringing these two things together.

The sixth is black rice with mushrooms and uni. I would say the rice is too creamy which doesn't go well with the uni. But the uni tastes very nice.

The dessert is coconut sorbet, providing a nice summer taste.

I ended up paying ~100 dollars with a 20% tip automatically included.

Overall the food is quite good, but not worth the price. If you're looking for a restaurant with nice ambience and service, it will probably be good for you. But if you're on a food adventure and care more about the food itself, I would not recommend this place.
author: Jiaxin G.

description:
Lunch in the FIDI can often be a bad burn in your wallet if you are not careful. There are places with overpriced menus, bad service, and lack the extras I need (like valet parking).

Ozumo is the kind of restaurant you know is going to be pricy but you feel fine with it because it is on par with the quality of what you receive. 

They have an extensive collection of Sake. I had a photograph of the expensive bottle I often receive from a Japanese colleague. I showed it to our server and lo - they had it! I was so happy. 

The deservedly popular Hanabi - hamachi with jalapeño Ponzu is what we always start with. Assorted sashimi filled out the rest of our sexy lunch. 

Attentive valet right out front makes good use of my time. 

Constructive critiques: 

Seating isn't comfortable, but I am never here for long (despite my love of leisurely lunches).

The hostess station is right by the front door without a place to sit should she tell you your table isn't ready. I don't like that unpolished part of my visits. 

The crowd isn't predominantly Asian as we are accustomed to when having Sushi prepared by Japanese sushi chefs but - and this is a big but...the sushi here is so fresh it really is a moot point. The service is not of Japanese discipline either. I can feel my purist friends balking and getting mad at me for liking this restaurant...but I do!

I like Ozumo for my numerous positive experiences here. I couldn't care less about what is going on around me because my sashimi is always cold, fresh, and delicious! 

I will be back for sexy sashimi!
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
My husband and I went here last Tuesday evening after a cocktail party. Though it was busy and there was a holiday party going on that night, the service was phenomenal! When a business is swamped, yet it can still perform and give attention to detail and NOT leave their other customers to go unnoticed, or neglected, it demonstrates what a business is really made of!!! 

My waitress was great and suggested some of her favorites like the black cod and the top four sushi rolls (just delicious!) We also enjoyed the filet mignon with mushrooms and the appetizers were refreshing. 

But I have to say I LOVE Mel! He introduced himself, reassured us of a table, and expedited everything. I'm confident that the reason the service is exemplary at Ozumo is because of him. I watched how he communicated well with the staff and other customers, and made sure everything was running smoothly despite the full house. Thank you Mel for a superb dinning experience!!! We look forward in returning not only for the food, but for the wonderful service (5 stars for the service!!!) Such a contrast from our waitress, Christie, (the pretty non existent waitress) at Ruth's Chris the another night but that's another story!
author: Desiree S.

description: Staff was warm and service was attentive and friendly.  Lovely ambience.  Food was mixed.  The miso soup and pork ribs were terrific but seaweed salad initially came without dressing and the sushi was uninspired.
author: Kelly G.

description:
If you like good sushi, you should go. 
Highly recommend! Only a problem is waiters seems busy all the time, you have to be patient.
author: Daisy B.

description: We decided sort of last minute to come here for dinner.  We ended up sitting in the bar area instead waiting for a table.  It was a lot more fun. Our service started out excellent.  It was never bad, but we lost her for awhile.  The food was fresh and different.  The calamari had a wonderful sauce.  The Soy sauce was homemade I believe.  Don't quote me on that.  But it was nice.  Cocktails were VERY good.  Too good in fact.  We enjoyed the restaurant.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
Took my girlfriend here for her birthday after a recommendation from a friend.  We opted for the 9-course tasting menus and she had the beer, wine and sake pairing.  I've been fortunate enough to have a lot of tasting menus at some pretty spectacular restaurants but this one might just take the cake.  There were dishes that would literally take our breath away.  Absolutely stunning execution.  Delicious, fresh sashimi that was hands down the best I ever had.  Same with the A5 Wagyu.  I've had Wagyu all kinds of different ways but this was mind-blowing.

I can't say enough great things about our wonderful server, Ginnie.  She made our night and selected the sakes herself.  Being that we're from Napa and in the industry, she correctly assumed we drink loads of wine so she chose a few more sakes to pair instead of wine and they were the best I've ever had (tired of me saying that yet?).  Those pairings sealed the deal on what was truly one of the best meals of my life.  Thank you, Ginnie for being so hospitable and thank you to the outstanding chefs and staff there that made my girlfriend's night so special.  Cheers!
author: Todd B.

description:
I have to preface this by saying I usually wind up very drunk on sake here, but that doesn't, in any way, diminish the quality of food or the experience. 

I generally eat like a pig and do a lot of seaweed salad, miso, and sashimi (toro, etc.). It's amazing and fatty and fills my bottomless pit of a stomach with joy. 

My sole complaint is that sometimes the ambiance is kind of, well, off. They could do with lightly that is less harsh...it's almost feels like when it's 2am and that hot wo/man you were chatting up in the bar is now less than appealing. 

Besides that the food is great and the staff is informative and professional.
author: CC C.

description: I come here for 3 years now and still love the quality of food and service of staff. If you like Japanese modern sushi , this is the spot .
author: Li S.

description:
Mediocre. 

I think Ozumo could be good depending on what you order but mostly the food is expensive and the fish varies in quality with more bad than good. Perhaps this is a better spot for happy hour. 

Sake (salmon sashimi) was incredible. Tuna tartare was pretty good but the fish was average. The sushi rolls and hanabi sounded interesting but had pretty low quality fish and unredeeming qualities like overly sweet sauces. The sashimi salad was barely better than the food court at 1 Market. 

3 stars for food. 2 stars for price and slow service.
author: Jess C.

description:
Had a great experience here for Japanese fine dining!

came here for spring break and found this place as one of the top japanese spots to go to in SF. Made last minute reservations online and luckily, they gave us a private room for our reservation of four.

staff was very friendly & gave excellent recommendations that we all loved. Came back and checked on the food & us often but not too often till it got to the point of annoying. 

food was great. Like all other fine dining, portions aren't huge but definitely able to satisfy an appetite at the end of the night. 

the decor is adorable and unique. From our private room we were surrounded with wine and sake bottle borders. 

definitely a huge recommend for anyone up for a little pricey fine dining!
author: Ros W.

description:
My date selected this place because it is the best Japanese restaurant in San Francisco, and I can see why he felt that way after having had an incredible culinary experience with discerning taste down to the bottle of sake we shared. As a matter of fact, their sake menu alone is world class and quite extensive. 

We started off with steamed edamame and miso soup, followed by Hanabi: slices of hamachi and avocado served with a warm ginger and jalapeño ponzu, Sake: salmon fillet with shishito peppers on skewers. From the sushi bar we had Benitoro salmon belly, Hamachi Maki rolls: hamachi, cucumber, avocado, tempura flakes, jalapeño, roasted garlic miso sauce, Mirugai: Giant clam, and a Spicy Tuna roll with avocado. This definitely was an excellent introduction to their signature dishes and combined with the company, a memorable one.
author: Anne H.

description: I reserved the private room for my niece's sweet 16 Birthday dinner. The service was extremely poor and lacking. Used dishes kept piling up and we kept asking staff if they could remove them.... food came in so sporadic that some people finished dinner before others. It was a disaster! I was very embarrassed and they charged me 20% for this horrible service plus the minimum spend it was a very expensive mistake. The food was nothing special. I predict with the way this restaurant is being managed, Ozumo will shut down within the year.
author: Erika R.

description:
I don't relish leaving terrible reviews online, but our experience last night at Ozumo was...bad. It was a holiday evening. It was restaurant week. And the place was really, really understaffed. 

We sat at the bar which was pretty crowded...and there were only two bartenders on for the night. Service was slow - so so so slow. By the time we were finally able to grab one of them to order food, 20 minutes had passed. It took another 35 minutes to get our full order out, and they missed a few things the first time around. When we asked how long we should expect for our missing salad and sushi dish, we got a salty, stressed out response of: "well I don't know, we're way understaffed and the kitchen is really busy right now so it might be awhile." We arrived at 6pm and didn't leave until well after 8pm - it was ridiculous.

As an open comment to the managers of this place: Y'all should be ashamed of yourselves for leaving your staff hanging like that on a holiday. It was a crummy customer service experience for us, and it sure didn't look like a cake walk for anyone working there that evening. We won't be coming back.
author: Meagan D.

description:
What a terrible freaking experience. I've eaten here before and always loved the food.  Tonight, traveling to SF on business, a female colleague and I had the misfortune of being seated at the end of a table with 8 extremely drunk men in the lounge (in spite of having a reservation).  Not only did the men proceed to totally harass us throughout dinner, but the manager, Mel Collins, seemed to actually encourage it. At one point, he told my friend that "She is a grown woman, she can handle it." While one of the men insisted on putting his arm around her. To add insult to super sexist injury, we never received 50% of our food - which is was delivered by mistake to these idiots sitting next to us. 

Mel Collins never apologized for this absurdly obnoxious behavior or unacceptable service and laughed off one of the men commenting on our appearance?!  Sayonara Ozumo - your female patrons deserve better.
author: Jenn S.

description:
Ozumo is your trendy, high-profile sushi spot. While it's not your small, cozy sushi bar, Ozumo will not disappoint. They have everything from seasonal fish, cooked dishes, rolls, nigiri & sashimi and an extensive Sake list.

The ambiance is gorgeous -there's actually two parts to this. The front caters more to the Happy-Hour-goers with the bar (drinks, not sushi) taking the majority of the space and action. Fortunately, food can be ordered here, as well!

In the back, by the sushi bars, there's a huge dining room - this is where you want to dine during those business lunches or where you want to actually have a real conversation.

Great for business lunches, groups, date night - all the sorts. Be prepared for a pricy meal. Rolls are $10-$19 each, nigiri are $5-$10 a pair, with Otoro being $20 a pair. There's also a plethora of seasonal and cooked dishes that range from $15-$25 each.
author: Veronica S.

description: This is my favorite Japanese restaurant. I took my then girlfrienf here for our first date. This place was a good charm for me - since then i realized that she was mu soulmate. We git engaged and planning a wedding now. This restaurant is awesome, the food is creative and tasty. My feance snd i come here every once in s while.
author: Niko L.

description:
This was my first time dining at Ozumo.  My fiancé has been here many times, but I found the food to be much better than the service.   The waitstaff definitely needs to sharpen their attention to detail.  In particular, the blonde waitress dropped off miso soup at the table and scurried away yet failed to realize I had no spoon or way of enjoying the soup.   Likewise, I felt the plating could have been better if the food runners weren't in such a rush and hurry to drop off the plate of food that the sides of the plate wouldn't appear so sloppy and messy.  Even the dessert appeared sloppy and messy upon being placed on the table.   

Lastly, I had a hard time understanding the waiter who spoke really quickly and didn't make eye contact.  Again, attention to details!!!


Overall, I would definitely eat here again, but I would specify wanting a good server versus a random server who just happens to have his or her turn next for a table.  I would give this place a B- based on my dining experience.

I definitely prefer being seated in the middle of the restaurant near the sushi bar.  The tables have a much prettier backdrop than the back of the restaurant which made me feel like I was being seated in a cafeteria.  I had to walk back to the hostess/host  station and ask to be reseated since I hated the first section they sat us.
author: Neil A.

description: Our first visit there, we didn't know a soul, and we were treated like VIPs from the minute we walked in; staff all stop what they are doing to greet you as you walk past, and amazing service from every hostess, bartender and server. The aesthetics are trendy Asian eco and we had a window table with a fabulous Bay Bridge view. Flat iron steak, scallops, and sushi all delish and beautifully presented. Can't say enough good stuff about this new favorite spot. Worth the drive from Napa where restaurants abound but primo service like this is rare; even called the Manager, Mel, over to tell him at the end of the night. Really warm and gracious guy who gave all the credit to his staff but if you've been in the restaurant business you know it takes a great manager to create this atmosphere. We LOVED this place!!
author: Stacey W.

description: This is an amazing restaurant! Ate there twice during our recent visit. The service was superb. The food was exquisite and delicious. I could not have asked for a better experience and would highly recommend!
author: Rachel G.

description:
Came here for New Year's Eve. 

People who come here are for the upscale atmosphere and location. Upon arrival, one of the servers spilled water on me while I am sitting. Luckily it wasn't soy sauce or soup... But I did have to sit on my wet pants for the rest of the night.

Dishes look like art pieces but they do not taste nearly as nicely as they look. We ordered a lobster roll which has only 4 tiny pieces and costed $24. It did not taste a bit like lobster. Also, my friend also got stabbed in her mouth by a fish bone found in one of the rolls. I have never found any bone in sashimi, even the ones from cheap Japanese restaurants. 

The food/service here is less than impressive. I do not think it's worth the price.
author: Joey T.

description: Loved this place. It was so good we went there twice in one weekend! YUMM!!
author: Catherine S.

description: Its our fourth time here, its a very upscale place yet really good for a night out! Food is great thats why we come couple times ina month.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I stayed at the Kimpton and they offered a free glass of sake before 6:15pm for guests so I got in on that. Upon first glance of the menu, however, I was surprised to see such high prices (compared to Toronto fine dining anyhow).  

Service was friendly and very attentive. The (free for Kimpton guests) house sake was better than I thought it would be (as a house sake). I've had better but for free it was delicious. 

The miso soup was unique and unlike any other miso soup I've had. It smelled very fermented and somewhat like peaty Islay scotch whiskey, which just happens to be my favourite liquor, so bonus points there. Any miso soup I have after this MUST be like this otherwise I will be sad. Best miso soup I've ever had BUT I love scotch and it smells like scotch so yeah.. 

The seaweed salad ($12) was very good too. Great flavours and a good serving size.  

The sea bass (Suzuki, $30) was a very small plate. The portion of sea bass is minuscule while there are some root veggies on the side (kohlrabi and something brown, possibly beets). The sauces were delicious. I wish there was more of everything on my plate. It left me wanting more. This is the only down side.   

Everything was delicious, some items were impressive and better than others I've had in the past, but the portion of sea bass was too small. 

If you are staying at the Kimpton then I would say definitely come here! It's right next door, you get free sake if you make a reso for before 6:15pm, and it's delicious! Even if you aren't staying, it's a delicious restaurant. The atmosphere is romantic (me, myself and I had a lovely date), the service is friendly and attentive, and everything I ate was delicious. Highly recommended!
author: Tina H.

description: Worst quality sashimi and wayyyyy overpriced. Prices listed as if they were caught right out of the ocean.  So disappointing.
author: Talin K.

description: Everything was incredibly tasty, you can litterally taste the freshness in the fish and the skillful preparation of the meal. I am not a fish lover but I got to say it's the best sushi I've had in SF for sure.
author: Quan P.

description: COCKROACHES-- oh god I have spent a small fortune at this place between hosting business lunches and family dinners. tonight while eating at the sushi bar a cockroach crawled across my plate. yuck I'm never going back i'm so grossed out
author: Sal G.

description:
Some of the best sushi in San Francisco, great location, views and sushi was stellar.

Great bartenders and lounge area up front and in the back a very large dining room with views of the Bay Bridge

If you want to impress a sushi lover, this is the place
author: Jeff B.

description: Food is a solid 3.5. Price is a 0. Silly, quite frankly. If you're hungry, be prepared to take out a second mortgage.
author: A L.

description: Nice spot. Ran into Ken Griffey Jr. During Super Bowl week here. So I went to try their wagyu beef burger yes I know a burger at a sushi bar. Hey sometimes you have to go off the grid. Trust me this burger was something else. Simple and deliciois
author: Humberto L.

description:
Great quality sushi, but definitely overpriced.

Lunch only review. Their fish quality is top notch, if you're willing to pay.

Appetizers: 
hamachi tartare = delish! Great ponzu sauce and fish
gyoza dumplings = awesome, had a sweet buttery glaze, which was a great touch

Main:
Tried the Kurosawa $25 Bento Box which was definitely good. 4 slices of delish mixed sashimi and 4 nigiris of salmon, inari, unagi, and yellowtail.

The unagi special roll was full of delish eel to share for the table.

Tried the 500ml (one glass per person for 4 people) unfiltered sake (forgot the brand), but it was really good, though $50 for the bottle. They have tons of sakes here.

Our server was nice, but took forever to take our order and bring our food. If work is taking you, come here. If you're paying on your own, not worth it for the price.
author: Chuck N.

description:
I was here for dinner with my boyfriend after hearing all the hype about this place. We ordered the Hanabi and some other assorted rolls to share.

The sushi wasn't all that amazing or fresh like stated in a lot of Yelp reviews. For the price, the portions were quite small. 

I live in San Jose and this place is totally not worth an hour drive for their sushi.
author: Chau L.

description:
Its a very expensive place I must say with the amount of serving they give. With just appetizer and drink I end up paying 70 bucks what ? 
Price isn't a problem if the taste is good but for japanese food I rather go to Japan town and have something really authentic.
Not a place to go for food. Its good for romantic dates, team get together (coz its near from a lot of companies).
author: Mimansha B.
