description: Me and my fiancé created a sushi tour through San Fran one day. We went to three places of my choosing, and Ozumo was the "wealth" option. There was a flawless '56 corvette next to a Tesla out front, so I think we found it. The scene is exquisite, bustling and alive. We sat around the sushi bar. I'm from Kansas, so I'm not much of a Sushi fan - in fact, I hate it. My fiancé loves it, so she chose a specific roll. I tried the Ozumo Mushi Ebi. O.M.G. Complete 180. I now love sashimi! It was a massive tiger prawn, nestled atop expertly shaped sushi rice, with a smear of wasabi as mortar. It was room temperature, and I swear before God, I would have eaten 15 of those - if they weren't eight bucks for two. My fiancé basically had a life-changing experience with the roll she selected. It is very posh - VERY posh - as well as a very authentic Japanese waitstaff and decorum. I will return, and I will eat ALL of the Mushi Ebi. Massive bottles of sake lying around, recessed lighting shining on beautiful wood, and the room is full of wealthy people. The guy next to us, sitting alone, orders a drink that cost like 80 bucks, drinks half of it, and leaves. This is a place to try, trust me. Best sushi we tried in the city.
author: Matthew C.

description: This place has fresh and delicious food! The sushi rolls and appetizers were incredible. Their house made sake is great to sip on with your meal and the cheesecake is to die for!
author: Sarah G.

description: Great food and hot professional women if your single. Again the food and drinks are wonderful. I always enjoy coming here and people watch the desparate guys with no game, LOL!
author: David D.

description: So this is a review of their Sunday happy hour, featuring decent hand rolls and ramen. Great deal, chill place to spend a Sunday late afternoon and early evening. The rest of the place - been several times on an expense account, if you want really good sushi without the expensive real estate or prime real estate (that you are paying dearly for), you can do better elsewhere. Not bad, just not great.
author: Doug W.

description: One of my pet peeves is when someone gives a Thai restaurant one or two stars with that rationale that they don't like Thai food.  Duh.  Well this place is 5 stars despite the fact that I don't like Sushi, but I have an 8-year old that loves it.  Great atmosphere with good views, but what makes this place off the charts is the high quality sushi that even a non-sushi guy like myself can appreciate.  Also had the Shabu Shabu which was good, but could have used salt.  Obviously not cheap ($250 for me and two kids with only one beer), but not surprising given how high the quality is.  Great friendly service to boot.
author: Hutch C.

description:
Amazeballs. Every person here made my first experience in sf so great I have to come back.

I was so excited about all the food and amazing presentation I forgot to take pictures. 

I will be back and my review will be reflective of how great everything was.

Lina was amazing I can't imagine experiencing this night without her. 

And the cute white girl delivering our drinks was a definite bonus
author: Jonathan S.

description:
SO good but SO EXPENSIVE. 
The quality of the fish is amazing. 
I am always willing to pay higher prices for higher quality food. But the only way the prices per ratio of food here makes sense is if they were played with pure gold. 
Over $150 for one roll, two appetizers, and four pieces of nigiri.
author: Carly G.

description:
Sat at the bar Saturday night. Live DJ playing Prince tunes while the service at the bar was attentive but not overbearing.

We ordered a sushi combination along with hot and cold sake. It was delicious. Next time I will order more hot items and some interesting new rolls. 

Can't go wrong for great sushi and atmosphere here!
author: Marie D.

description:
I visited Ozumo while on a business trip, as it was recommended by a friend and his colleague, Aaron Allen. Not only was Ozumo walking distance to the building my training was taking place at, I was greeted by very friendly staff hostess who sat  me right away called Aaron to know I had arrived. 

In addition to that, I was greeted by Mel Collins who literally exudes Director of Hospitality. He made sure my drinks were always full and made sure I had enough to eat. He even gave me a tour of the restaurant. 

The food and drinks were delicious and will definitely go back to see Aaron and Mel every time I am in SF!
author: Mandy O.

description: Ozumo is definitely one of my favorite sushi places in San Francisco. Conveniently located in the Financial district, it offers awesome rolls and great sakes. I highly recommend the sake sampling. It is an interesting experience even for those who are not ultimate sake lovers.
author: Nela S.

description: Very much enjoyed our dinner! Sat at the sushi bar with the kids. the chefs were lovely - created mini nigiri and special dessert sushi for the kids. Will definitely be back!
author: Sofia C.

description:
I am a huge fan of this place and go back every year.  

My friend rick just said "yea.  That place is awesome."  

Cool bar scene.  
Great food 
And many great memories.
author: John R.

description: Very normal sushi. does not worth it at all. Very expensive Saki that doesn't even match the quality of the sushi that you get. So sorry to hear that it is becoming such an unpleasant restaurant after management changes :(
author: Reza F.

description: Very pricey and the food was not worthy it. I couldn't finish my plate - it was stinky and the description of the plate did not match what I've ordered! We paid $250 for a dinner for two and we were very disappointed. A big no-no. Giving two stars for the sake collection.
author: Fanny M.

description: Very average but a nice spot close to home. The prices are slightly ridiculous. I only go if lazy but it is nice quality but it is sushi ran pricing without the quality.
author: Natalia G.

description: Good sushi, a bit overpriced, nice location. The staff was extremely friendly. Decent spot but forgettable.
author: Ryan O.

description:
Great place. Beautiful view of the bridge. Hip ambiance. Very attentive staff.

My Ebi Tempura was OK, maybe even average. But the sushi with cilantro and jalapeño was spectacular. It's a little on the pricey side,but well worth it.
author: Gerardo D.

description: Ok quality but super duper expensive for the portion and very ordinary food it was so quiet and not that many people were there! I wouldn't recommend this place only because the small portions and high prices.
author: Sara K.

description: The quality of the location and potential for great food is overshadowed by the inattentive service. My party would have ordered many more drinks and food had we even been serviced by our waiter (nice enough guy, but was nowhere to be found) . All we got was a hello with a drink order, a food order and then the check in the 95 minutes we were there. No checking up on our meals, no refills on water, and we had to flag down a hostess to get our second cocktail. The inside is clean, the salmon was fishy, and the chairs were kind of weird. If the service was better, I'd give the place a 3.
author: Shanna B.

description: Service was impeccable! Absolutely recommend wagyu steak with foie gras! One of the best sushi and uni I had in the Bay Area
author: Kim A.

description:
Not gonna lie, this place is way too swanky and expensive for me to come here on my own. Good thing it was a company lunch. Came here the other day with a party of 10 after making reservations the day before. We were given a private room with a traditional table which is supposed to fit 12 (the table is somewhat small and no idea how 12 people would fit... 10 fit perfectly). All of us forgot to take off our shoes before entering and it wasn't until in the middle of the meal that I asked the waitress. She said it was fine (how awkward would it have been if we all got up and took off our shoes?).

It's kind of a tradition for us to order a bunch of appetizers and share. Unsure of what to order, we asked the waitress if the chef can put something together. Let me tell you, it was one plate after another (x2, one for each side of the table). Plates filled with fresh sashimi, nigiri (if you don't like wasabi, be sure to tell them to take it out), rolls, pork gyoza, vegetable gyoza, and garlic edamame. I ordered a Chirashi ($35), which is sushi rice and fresh raw fish.

Most of my coworkers ordered bento boxes which were about $20 (or less). They do not come with miso soup, which can be a little disappointing because bentos elsewhere usually do. Our meal could have easily been affordable if it weren't for the lavish amount of appetizers that filled us up. I'm not complaining, the food was so delicious and we got to really experience flavorful and quality Japanese food.

Having a large party means 20% tip to your bill. A little cute there's an additional line for additional tip if your heart desires. Service was on point and we had 2 waitresses serving us along with another person who took helped clear our dishes. 

Bathroom talk.. So amazing.. Love how the faucet looks like a pipe from a well that spouts out water. The decor is just breathtaking. Even my journey to the restroom was breathtaking. There were bottles adoring the walls and the cute chairs along the sushi bar.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Service: VERY slow.  We were seated at the sushi bar and expected they would try to get us out quicker to get more customers in, but service took forever.

Food: Pricey and small portions.  The sushi was good, but 4 pieces for a $20 roll wasn't that good.  Th COD was served with 2 pieces of fish, one cooked perfectly and the other mushy.  Flavor was good, but texture inconsistent. 

Good: desserts! Not what you would expect, but we ordered fondue and rice pudding.  All delicious.
author: Madonia Y.

description: Planned a team dinner at the restaurant was more than accommodating considering we were 20 minutes late for our reservation. Dohyo is the BOMB! I could have eaten that all night. Amazing menu, beautiful atmosphere and tons of sake to choose from. Love it!
author: P F.

description:
I don't know why it has been getting lower than 4 stars. I've eaten here twice (Jan and now), and service and food were outstanding! Would highly recommend. 

I will say place is a little deceiving, you walk in to gorgeous trees and a darker ambience and then head to the back where the sushi bar is and lots of openness and a different vibe. Both are good in my opinion, but if you're going for a more romantic vibe, ask the hostess to seat you up in the front two rooms.
author: Jasmine C.

description: Very disappointing and overpriced. Look on tripadvisor. Crunchy rolls are not crunchy and overpriced not great service.
author: Frederic G.

description:
Gorgeous restaurant, fairly large with awesome bar & great atmosphere/decor. But I guess that is what you are paying for - the ambience.
The food is lack luster to be fair. The amount of money you pay - I expect some of the freshest fish I've ever had & some exotic dishes - none of which I really found here. The nigri pieces are some of the smallest I've ever had.
My BIGGEST problem was we split the bill & my girlfriend opt to get the tip - I check my credit card statemet & they added an extra $10 to my already expensive bill. NOT COOL!!!!
Unfortunately this is why I won't be returning & for the one star review.
author: S. M.

description: Sushi was fresh and appetizers were exceptional. Sake selection is impressive. Service was great, Hillary was a total pleasure. We will gladly come back for another round.
author: David G.

description: Who's that a great place to hang out after hours. Food was good but nothing more than a 3 star rating.  Service and atmosphere will be closer to 4 star rating.  Being that there are so many quality places around town, I would look for something more economically priced next time.
author: S. Sean B.

description:
Wow-- Ozumo is good! I came for a long, relaxing lunch on a Friday and sat in the bar area.  The atmosphere is obviously great and the decor is beautiful. My aunt and uncle are regulars here and knew just what to order.

For three people, we ordered two orders of the hanabi, three bowls of miso soup, a Shacho roll and a Hamachi roll.  Yum! The hanabi was great, and I loved the Hamachi roll. The meal was pretty expensive (around $170+, with drinks), but I was treated... so you know... 5 stars.
author: Melissah L.

description: Eh..... For the price I was pretty disappointed. The sushi wasn't any better than any other Japanese restaurant. Portions are really really really small. Chaya is much better
author: c L.

description: Food was alright but one of the bartenders was a total jerk! Def not coming back again
author: Carlyle M.

description: Best sushi I've eaten in North America. Amazing atmosphere, and super friendly and helpful staff! The sushi rolls were out of this world. I recommend the spider sushi and bucho rolls. We went on New Year's Eve and witnessed the fireworks on embarcadero afterwards. Best experience in a long time :) Be sure to sit at the bar so you can talk to the chefs. Reasonably priced for a high end restaurant. You need to visit this place.
author: Arif F.

description:
Nice Place!

Cant Really give a full review, I only had 4 dishes!
But off those, 3 Stars seems just.
Great view of the water!

Waiter misheard my order, got a salmon skewer instead of a salmon skin roll, it does get Quite noisy.  - 2

Crab in California roll is a tad... Dry. 

Miso soup is what you'd expect, just without a spoon. 

Hand rolls are nicer here than anywhere else, 
Defo try it out, but try something different.
author: Niko M.

description: We totally got scammed here last week! We ate dinner at one of the tables at the bar. Our waitress said that if she told the GM that our food was slow at coming out that he would bring us a round of sake. Of course, who doesn't like free drinks? So like clockwork, the GM came out with a round of sake, and drank with us. At the end of the night though, they charged us for this round. What kind of establishment allows their GM to go around drinking with patrons, and for their waitresses to scam their clients?! On top of that, it was a $144 charge on top of a $400 dinner. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? You lost my business.
author: Taylor L.

description:
Overated for what you get, swear you can get same quality Any good japonese Rest, dont get me wrong It is good but not excepcional .
The black Cod Wont disappoint you but rolls will.
author: Jacky A.

description:
My firm hosted a big group lunch recently and I was looking forward to something other than the usual FiDi power lunch venues, but we all left pretty disappointed with our experience here.

I get it. It's hard to cater to a group of 16 people. However, you would think a place as large as this would know how to navigate serving a large group. Orders were mixed up, forgotten, etc. It was a mess. They need to take better notes when they serve such a large group.

Aside from that, the food was really nothing special. I was surprised to see so many ramen options, so I ordered a bowl and it was terrible! The meat tasted old and the boiled egg was greyish and tough. I almost always finish my food even if I don't particularly enjoy it (thanks to my strict Asian parents) but I could only take a few bites of it. 

Two of my officemates called in sick the next day with food poisoning from the beef dish they shared. 

Though the venue is really gorgeous, the food is definitely not up to par and it is expensive to boot! I think we ordered pretty conservatively and it ended up being close to $60 per person, with no alcohol ordered.
author: Jenn C.

description:
My Haiku review --

A walk through cool bar
To great service and sushi
Take the sake flight!
author: Robert R.

description:
Just finished having dinner here :)

We ordered a few things to share: mushroom tempura, spicy tuna roll, steamed edamame, and garlic + soy edamame. The garlic + soy edamame was a nice touch to the menu, how ever our waitress failed to notify us that they were out of the maitake mushroom tempura...until we inquired about it :(

We ordered two bottles of the Konteki "tears of dawn" Daiginjo filtered sake. We had asked for a recommendation for filtered sake as their sake menu was quite impressive and extensive. :) very smooth, flavorful, and fruit-forward sake! Thanks for the rec!

For main courses, we ordered the hamachi belly sashimi, sekiwake, kitakaze, and Ozumo. The flavor was very nice, but the rolls didn't have anything very special to them. The sashimi was very nice and melted in our mouths. 

For dessert, we ordered the Chocolate Fondue. There was an assortment of fruits and sponge cake for us to dip in a bowl of melting dark chocolate. I was very surprised that among the fruits there were persimmons! Lovely touch.
Service was okay, and the ambiance of the place is nice. 

The front of the restaurant is more of a dark casual/bar setting, while the back opens up to an enormous dining area with a sushi bar and plenty of seating + lighting--perfect for large dinner parties.


A bit pricy for the quality of food and variety...but still good. It's a good place to come after work for a quick bite and drinks.
author: Rachel C.

description:
The hostess was really nice getting us a table with a view, the waiter gave us an excellent service. The place is nice as well

I'm giving it a one star rate because I think their menu is over priced for what it is, I wasn't impressed with my roll. But I did loved their tuna tartare and the duck!
author: Harumy R.

description: Been here three times. Their Sake selection is good. Food is not bad but not the best and relatively over-prices. The ambiance is good and they have valet parking.
author: Shanzay H.

description: This place is fantastic.   Try the black cod.  It's amazing. The bottle of house Sake is a must.  The hamachi was perfect.   The waiter was so helpful in helping me choose things I may not have chosen it made my experience that much better.
author: Tyler G.

description: Great sushi and awesome experience.   The staff was super friendly and really made you feel welcome.    I would definitely recommend.
author: LT R.

description:
Blown. Away. I can't believe I've lived in the city for almost 3 years now and last night was the first time I tried Ozumo. The sushi is the BEST I've ever had. Yes, that's a very BOLD statement but it was that amazing. The freshness and quality of the fish is what will keep me coming back here. 

I also loved the decor of this place! It's super swanky and modern. It's the perfect place for a date or business dinner. Not to mention, they have pretty good cocktails ;)

Definitely will be back here!!
author: Tina J.

description:
I love this restaurant! Fish is always sooOo fresh! We had a table near the window and you can see the view of the bridge. It was an awesome view!

We ordered a variety of dishes to share:
Hanabi - melts in your mouth 
Dohyo tuna tartare - tasty flavorful 
Gyu kakuni braised short ribs - falls off the bone. I order this dish every time!
Gindara black cod - so light 
Kamo negi duck breast - very good seasoning cooked perfectly
Futago beef tataki little challenging to eat but very good combination of flavors 
Shacho lobster roll - very good, you can taste the chunks of lobster meat
We had the Sake Mama recommend a sparkling sake and it was sooOo refereshing and good, served with a flower inside the glass. 

Service: Server was attentive and very friendly.
author: Mimi K.

description:
we were really disappointed to learn that the sushi chef was not available to make the omakase that i traveled all the way from nyc to sf for... (i'm exaggerating) but yea, it was a weekend and found that really surprising..

so we decided to go with the regular sushi omakase (tht doesnt include entrees).. was disappointed to see Unagi included and overall the selection and execution was mediocre...

the hot entrees we tried were also hit or miss. the uni risotto had no uni taste. the scallop was totally overcooked and chewy. the black cod was very enjoyable though and the matcha panna cotta was to die for..
author: Donna S.

description:
This review is really about just 1 dish...unfortunately it was the only one I ordered.  I saw the description of the Seafood Hot Pot and it sounded great.  I was thinking some nice seafood, misc veggies and a light sipping broth. The menu reads:
"sablefish, Kauai prawns, salmon and scallops in a seafood broth with assorted vegetables "

However, what I got was this elaborate lava fire rock with a bowl of steaming brown broth on top.  You couldn't eat directly from the bowl...way to hot.  Instead you had to dish it into an empty bowl, wait for it to cool, add some rice and some sauce and eat.  Then repeat over and over.  Kind of tedious.  However, I could have lived with that.  

The real problem was that the sablefish was just bland/plain white fish about 2 inches square.  I ate that and hoped the rest was better...it was not.  The 2 shrimp were thrown in whole with the head and tail attached.  This was very difficult to eat with chop sticks and hands.  It was way too hot to pick up and by the time I finally cracked one open, it was mushy on the inside and inedible.  Same with the second one.  There was no scallop in the dish.  There was no salmon in the dish.  All that remained was overcooked cabbage.  Not mixed veggies, just nasty cabbage.

To add to my misery, the main ingredient was tofu.  I hate tofu and would never order something that contained it...never mind being the most prominent ingredient.  It is not even in the description?

Lastly, the broth was completely bland, boiling (literally) and not something you would eat.

So, for $35 I ate 1 piece of white fish and a bowl of rice. And left hungry!  (i tried the cabbage, but left 90% behind)

I was really disappointed.  It was the worst meal I have ever been served in a nice restaurant. 

That being said, the other people at the table ordered sushi and said it was good.  If I were to come back, next time I'll stick with sushi.
author: C B.

description: Love the food. Love the space. Love the friendly staff, except for the maitre d' or whoever that rude woman is by reception. I made an open table reservation last week and few days later it was cancelled by the restaurant. Thought it was weird that they didn't even bother to send an explanation so I called and booked the reservation over the phone. Show up yesterday for dinner, and the maitre d' insists I requested 4 seats, when I only reserved for 3. I don't understand why she was picking a fight insisting I requested 4. What is the point other than having your guest start dinner with a bad taste in their mouth? Then she handed the menus to someone and said out loud, "just give any table to her I don't care". Seriously, if you don't like interacting with patrons, don't understand basic courtesy and don't know how to talk to people with respect then you shouldn't be in the restaurant business. Shame on you and shame on Ozumo's management for hiring and keeping on staff such a sour apple.
author: cassy f.

description: I know this place getting expensive. But my favorite 5grain risotto with uni are bring me to here...and I'm a sushi lover but I can tell this place sushi are okay it is like number 2 in the San Francisco in my list ;)
author: Laura S.

description:
Really?!  You want to have dinner with moi?

* faints *

I can't believe my brother is actually initiating some quality time with his big sis. 

This is what happens when your baby bro goes through a break-up. They don't know what to do with themselves!

He said dinner was on him, so I immediately looked for the most expensive resto in the Embarcadero. (kidding!) He wanted Japanese food within walking distance to BART, so Ozumo it was.

Ozumo is great place for top quality sushi and impressive sake collection. The space can easily accommadate large groups, couples on dates and perfect for a pair of siblings who happen to be dateless on a Monday night.

We started with two apps, both made with tuna. The first plate had fresh slices of tuna juxtaposed with green avocado. The other was a seared version served with seaweed salad. Overall, nice presentation and solid dishes. 

The slow braised prime short ribs with daikon cooked in a miso glaze sauce was so mouth wateringly delish that there really are no words to describe it. I didn't even have to chew on it since the meat was super tender. 

The sacho roll was the priciest sushi roll on the menu. But the maine lobster and mango pairing, with a kick from jalapeno was worth the price tag. We also liked the shrimp tempura roll.

My brother has a big sweet tooth and likes peanut butter, so dessert was already a given! A light peanut butter mousse with a delightful ginger-chocolate crust and genmai ice cream. Interesting combination of flavors but it all worked together!

Service was great with an ever present smile on her face. I just love that!

Baby bro might have his heart (and wallet) broken, but in due time and with Ozumo's impeccable cuisine, everything will be just fine.
author: Janice C.

description: Dropped in on a rainy night and were not so warmly welcomed without a reservation..  we waited to sit at the sushi bar to be blatantly ignored throughout the evening. It took 6 people to provide our meal which was adequate. We waited too long for a glass of wine and request our order. My miso soup was forgotten as well as my second glass of wine. So sad we were treated so badly for a $100. Dinner
author: Pam O.

description:
I'm not a sake fan so I wasn't impressed when our waiter was boasting about the extensive sake list.  Largest selection in San Francisco, apparently.  Maybe he even said in the country?  I have a feeling my inability to recall this detail can be attributed to the large portion of sake I consumed.  It was really palatable - the first sake I have ever enjoyed.  Perhaps all I needed was to try the unpasteurized version of this popular drink.

Yamabuki - strong uni flavor but not overpowering.  Very creamy and rich.  Superb. 
Yaki Tako - octopus is moderately charred with a good texture.  Cooked to perfection without being rubbery. 
Dohyo - my least favorite. Not bad - just not my favorite. It is listed as spicy but I did not find it so. Served with chips 
Hanabi - my favorite of the favorites.  Fresh hamachi and flavorful avocado.
Gindara - excellent excellent excellent. Melt in your mouth delicious.  Umami to the max.
Chocolate fondue - fun, large portion and very good.  The fruit is fresh, mochi is rich, pound cake is fluffy - and these items were enhanced by the delicious chocolate sauce.
Kurogoma creme brulee - barely edible.  Do not order!!
author: Ariana N.

description:
Amazing sushi!!!

Why not 5 stars?  The prices are very steep and the seating was really uncomfortable so by the end of our meal my back was aching to leave.

We started off our meal with the garlic edamame.  Oh...my....god!!!  How did they make a vegetable taste so amazing?  I must always have roasted garlic on my edamame!  I stuck with the prosecco while the others at our table ordered innovative cocktails.  Their cocktails were so good, but so expensive!!!  

Our table ordered several sushi rolls including the spicy tuna roll, spicy scallop roll, orange dragon roll, and the yuyake roll.  Most of the rolls were $11-20 (a tad too expensive).  My husband got a four pieces of nigiri that cost over $30!  The spicy rolls really were spicy which I loved, but my in-laws hated; so be warned if you cannot handle spice!  While the orange dragon roll was amazing I felt that it was hard to justify the price.

We ordered the chocolate fondu, kuromitsu cheesecake, and the green tea ice cream for dessert.  I loved the cheesecake, but could have skipped the other two desserts.

Great sushi, but the bill was a bit brutal at the end of our meal so I couldn't see myself being a regular no matter how good the food is.
author: Michelle M.

description: This restaurant has good food (therefore the 1 star).  But the female operator was super rude.  I forgot my umbrellas there and called twice afterwards that I'd pick it up and said specifically it's blue and had my company name on it.  She said sure come pick it up and I asked her to keep it for me.  Apparently she did not keep it and let someone took it.  I had someone walked all the way there to pick it up (and checked with her one hour beforehand and she said yes there are bunch of umbrella here) and when we got there, there is none.  She then told me "ask your company to give you another one".  That's none of her business and if she cannot keep it, don't say it.  I don't have to walk all the way there and wait my time.  Advise to you- don't lose anything there.  They could lose my umbrella and next time is your purse and they will ask you to buy another one!
author: Lisa W.

description: The cocktails and service are on point and the staff is incredibly friendly! I will be back and it is a great place to have a couple drinks either before or after a fancy dinner at Boulevard!
author: Hayley H.

description:
Not a place for sushi aficionados anymore. Last two attempts at ordering omakase --expecting special fish, thin cuts, piece-by-piece service --have resulted in lackluster results. Lately I've gotten pre-cut fish and nothing special: tuna, salmon, eel. 

To be fair, the fish is fresh and fine. But usually when I ask for omakase and include some guidance such as: 'let's start with ankimo, then some sashimi --particularly anything different and fun --and move on to nigiri' the chef usually has fun with the order. 

That hasn't been the case at Ozumo lately. It feels like they are going through the motions and cranking out what I'd disappointingly call supermarket sushi. 

At my most recent visit, I uncomfortably raised my concerns with my server. She actually explicitly said we'd be doing a piece-by-piece tasting. The first course ended up being a plate of tuna, eel and salmon from the kitchen. When the bill came, I was charged for multiple toros --to be clear, there was no toro all night. The manager offered to comp part of the bill. Honestly, I would have preferred they hear the feedback in earnest.
author: Nick D.

description: This place is the best Japanese food in SF. No contest. Flavor, atmosphere, service, variety - absolutely the best. Real certified Kobe beef here - not that cross-breed bovine other restaurants pass off as Kobe. Have any doubts and Mel Collins will break out the certificate for that particular cut of beef and show it to you. Service is personal and attentive but not overwhelming. Genuinely friendly. The whole experience was pretty emotional. This can be SanFran-spendy to very expensive but you get the same restaurant experience in its entirety. Excellent variety of sake you wont get just anywhere and other libations genuinely Japanese. They have a more social setting in the front of the store, group tables and then more family style in the back near a hugh sushi bar. Top notch front of house to the kitchen. I'm selling my car so I can go back and really sample everything.
author: Richard H.

description:
Being in San Francisco, we pulled up Sushi restaurants on our Yelp app and came up with over 52 restaurants within 10 miles of us... holy cow! We asked the conceirge for their suggestion and they recommended Ozumo. It was only rated 3 1/2 stars so I was a little leery but we trusted them. We asked them to make a reservation for us and heavily tipped the concierge - ended up being totally worth it  because after a 15 minute wait we were given the 'private' glass room in the middle of the restaurant! Super cool! Glass walls of floor to ceiling shelving filled with sake! We looked and felt VIP all the way!

We had a group of 6 so we ordered and ate family style - everyone sharing with everyone. Our waiter was super nice giving us plenty of suggestions. Every single thing we ate seemed to be better than the last. Our taste buds were begging for more. We even ended up reordering one dish and adding 2 more rolls and 2 more orders of sashimi before we could call it quits.

Here's what we tried:
Edamame - fresh soybeans served warm with garlic-soy (2 orders)
Yamabuki - fresh uni and shimeji mushroom genmai risotto
Ozumo - grilled unagi and cucumber roll topped with snow crab, tuna, avocado and spicy sauce
Sekiwake - spicy tuna roll with tobiko, tempura flakes, salmon and hamachi with peanut sauce
Hamachi Maki - hamachi, avocado, cucumber, tempura flakes, jalapeño, roasted garlic miso sauce
Hanabi - hamachi, avocado, warm ginger-jalapeño ponzu (3 orders of this!!)
Spicy Tuna Roll
Gyu Kakuni - Slow braised prime short ribs, spring vegetables, savory aka miso sauce

By far our favorites were the the Hanabi, the Ozumo and the Gyu Kakuni (the ribs). We didn't try any of their sake but they had a HUGE selection, the menu was pages and pages and the bottles surrounded us!

We loved the royal treatment here, and the food was truly amazing! It was pretty pricey, but usually is for quality sushi at an upscale restaurant. I would eat here again in a heartbeat.
author: Kayla M.

description:
I love Ozumo's food - it's a little pricey but what a great treat.  

The service can be improved (hence the 4 stars) as follows: 
 I often use open table to find a table as the restaurant is super busy and your chances of getting in without excruciating wait is not great. so when I have a reservation, I expect to be seated within 15 min of that reservation time, not 45+ min... and get a good spot and not one between the restroom and the kitchen hallway.   On one occasion, my husband and I walked out of the restaurant because we were not seated within 30 min (Their manager apologized but didn't fix the problem and we still ended up eating somewhere else.) 

Another time,  I had to wait over 40 min even with a resa - 

so a little better table flow would be appreciated.  If you can't sit people don't take them in.   For the price the restaurant charges, one is expected to take their time and enjoy their food & sake!
author: Severine C.

description: Such an annoying experience here. The atmosphere - okay if you like that sort of thing. The food - meh. Had much better, nothing to write home about. Prices - way over the top. Service - stuck up. Menu - unreadable. The plates came to our table in a very weird and slow pace. The explanation: each sushi chef has one roll he's responsible for. Lame excuse for not being able to get the plates to the table all at once. Not coming back.
author: Mashav S.

description:
Ozumo made my favorite taste at the Fallfest event this past weekend.
Braised short rib marinated in sake with daikon. This stew-like dish was so flavorful it made me want an entire plate of this stuff to eat! I could definitely see a wave of fans swarming up to the counter once people tried the bite and told their friends about it. The meat was tender enough to fall apart even using chopsticks. The daikon chunks were tender like potato. If Asian soul-food (as in reach into your soul and warm you up) is what you're looking for, this dish fits the bill. Since I've never been to Ozumo, I'm looking forward to trying other dishes at their restaurant.
author: Joanna T.

description: If it were cheaper j would give it 4 stars but for the price it's a 3. It good but not great. Place is cool and happening scene, nice Ferrari pulls up in front while I was there so you get the point. Good client place. This place is what you expect, high prices, high end spot and decent sushi.
author: Brad M.

description: I really enjoyed this place! I came here on my dad's birthday and I really loved the food they had! my favorite part would have to be the sushi rolls because they came in so many varities, I would have to say my favorite of those would have to be the spicy ones with the jalepenos on them! I hope I had a great time here and I loved how me and my family members at my dad's birthdy cake there! I really recommed you guys to come here sometime as it's really good and great for a birthday or other event!
author: Asher D.

description: I've lived in San Francisco for many years and somehow missed this jewel of a restaurant. It was a nice surprise having a table with a beautiful view of the bay. The decor was impressive, clean, and the ambiance takes you away from the hustle of the Embarcadero. From the dishware, flatware, and lighting every piece is perfectly placed. It was a bit crowded and the noise level low to moderate, but tolerable to talk with friends easily. Although it was a busy night it did not go unnoticed how attentive and professional the wait staff remained. We had a great server (Zeon) who took care of everyone. The calm service persisted thoughtful the dinner with stellar recommendations from the staff.  I was served the Gyu Filet which was fantastic. To close, amazing decor, food, service, and at a reasonable price. I'll go back!
author: Xan B.

description:
Oh emm jee!!! Never again. The service sucked ass!!! There were 6 of us 4 adults and 2 kids. We barely got waited on. Our drinks took over 30 minutes. Even the water took forever which we should of got first. We ended up having to go to the bar because it took so long. We waited over an hour for our food to come. The kids got their food about 15 minutes after us. It was so bad the kids started complaining and fussing and crying and kept asking when the food was going to be ready. We didn't even order that much. We even complained,um still bad service!!! Bill came up to about $450 n plus gratuity was included which i refused to pay because we didn't get any type of customer service whatsoever. Being over priced and having no kind of customer service, they should of removed that damn gratuity fee. I complained and argued and they still
didnt remove it. So now anyone who asks me "Have you eaten at Ozumo?", im loke dont even..... Cause the service sucked and it is way over priced. Id rather go to McDonalds and feed a gang of people with my $450 than ever eat there again.
author: Theresa M.

description: Came back to Ozumo after deciding to give it a second chance. I will not come back here for sushi again. They serve great hot entrees but their fish still is not up to the standards of other upscale Japanese restaurants in the city. Furthermore, I was very clear and specific about instructions with our table's nigiri order (repeated twice to the waiter to have wasabi served on the side and not under the fish) but it was completely ignored. Even though they offered to correct it, the restaurant took a short cut and tried to clean up their mistake by scraping off the wasabi. I would not complain if they did exactly that but when the plate came back, under all the fish, you still saw and tasted chunks of wasabi on the rice and under the fish.
author: Erica J.

description: Got the ozuma roll. Thought for the $20 price tag it would be lump crab meat... more like tuna fish consistency- disappointed.
author: Liz H.

description: I've been in so many sushi places but I definitely can say this one is the best of the best! Hilarious service! Everybody respect you here and treat you as a king! The sushi is crazy, crazy good! I mean I honestly never tried anything as good as here. It is an expensive place, but it definitely worth it!
author: Vladimir V.

description:
Tourist Trap

Server suggested outrageously priced sake and mediocre food. Really sad place that should close its doors before the public does it for them. 

You have been warned.
author: Matthew B.

description:
I really enjoyed the food in this restaurant. 
The ambience is pretty great. Dim in when you come in, and fairly bright lighting in the area when you go deeper into the place. The place is pretty big. I definitely liked the atmosphere. 
They also always great you in Japanese when you come in. 
We ordered a ton of dishes, so I can't really point anything in particular, but everything I had was very tasty and of good quality. 
Their cocktails are amazing! 
They brought a wrong dish in the beginning, but corrected the mistake after we pointed it out. Wouldn't say they had the most attentive staff though.
author: Luba Y.

description: The service here is simply horrible. There's really nothing more to say about it. My boyfriend and I walked in here. It was the end of the night and there were seats available everywhere. They decided to sit us at the bar right next to other people even though there are empty seats at tables everywhere. Whatever, fine. You might get a magical rush of 20 groups of 4. It took the waitress 10 minutes to bring our drink menu, another 15 minutes for her to come back with 1 drink - apparently the other drink was all out. So now my boyfriend is drinking by himself and we're almost a half hour in. Our entrees came out 10 minutes apart. We didn't see the waitress again after our food so we couldn't even get a second drink. It was just mind boggling. The food itself was tasty, but the entire experience was a bit of a let down, especially for the price.
author: Annette D.

description: Been there too many times constantly trying to discover why this place has high ratings. With my last night dinner there -- I realized that no matter how much you pay for your sushi here, it still just okay. Omakase, appetizers and fish quality overall does nothing spectacular to this place. Extensive sake menu and trendy designer atmosphere make it a fun place to have a dinner at.
author: Anelya S.

description: Came for omakase and they strongly suggested we do a sashimi/nigiri plate instead. We had to request a few more sashimi items to feel full.  For the price ( all in, more than $300 for 2), quite underwhelming. No creativity and service was ok. Fish was good quality, which was a positive..  Opentable is waaay off on its ratings. Maybe it's just that we're from Seattle and have been spoiled on the sushi front, but this was a disappointing meal for the price.
author: Kiran A.

description:
Here is the thing with fancy places:

-You can get 75% of the quality of food/service a lot of places with more affordable prices, but you pay close to 25% more to get that better food/service. You also pay more for the better ambiance and design of the restaurant. Ozumo fits the bill.

Ozumo is a super trendy japanese restaurant that is beautifully designed inside and out. Everything looked really modern and expensive. The venue is pretty big going from stuert street entrance and has a view of the Embarcadero in the rear.  I def recommend making a reservation since it does get packed on the weekend. All the waiters are super nice and friendly. My friends even took pictures with them. haha.

So we ended up ordering a 3 course meal. 

Short ribs: They are braised in till really tender and is cooked in a savory traditional beef sauce. Cooked perfectly. 

Hamachi and salmon:The rolls are pretty average with the exception that they use higher quality fish in their rolls. The roll creations are pretty standard tho to most sushi restaurants in SF.

Rice Pudding: I was pretty surprised when the rice pudding came out. It is topped with fresh ice cream and this sweat fried chip which almost taste like a crust on top of creme brûlée.

The saké is amazing. Way more expensive options. I normally drink the cheap stuff, but their saké selection is something you sip on and not shoot. 

I had a great time at Ozumo. Yes, it is more expensive than most sushi places, but its more expensive when you consider all the factors. I recommend coming here if you enjoy contemporary japanese food and want to celebrate a special occasion.
author: Ryan R.

description:
This is truly the finest sushi restaurant in San Francisco! The sushi is fresh, filling and melts in your mouth! I highly recommend trying the seafood gyoza - you won't regret it!

Five stars for amazing sushi, ambiance, service and overall experience. I will definitely be coming back here again!
author: D K.

description: Not only overpriced, the food just isn't good. Sushi tasted like they just took it out of the freezer and served it
author: Jeremy Z.

description: I came here for the second time about a week ago and everything about my experience surpassed my first, which was hard to do. We sat at the sushi bar this time, which was really fun. Our waiter was amazing, very knowledgeable and timely! I can't remember his name, but he was the tall, handsome guy with the side burns, you can't miss him! He answered all of our questions about the menu and gave great recommendations!! Everything was amazing, the food, the drinks and the service! Will definitely be back!!
author: Nicole I.

description:
Amazing service and tasty food, but is it really worth the high price?

The best thing about Ozumo was undoubtedly the great service. Our waiter was charming, extremely helpful, incredibly knowledgeable, and yet seamless. The extensive sake menu was daunting, but we got a solid recommendation. 

The local is split into two section with very different atmospheres. At the front, it feels like an upscale bar with dimmed lights and high chairs; in the back, the sushi bars and tables make it feel more like a restaurant. We were sitting in the restaurant portion, but I think the front would have been a little more interesting, yet also louder, so perhaps it depends on the purpose of the dinner. 

The food was all good, but nothing really stood out to me. The bill ended up being ~$100 a person (including drinks), so perhaps I would have liked to be wowed just a bit more. 

A favorite at our table was the Spanish octopus appetizer. It was perfectly cooked and tender. 

The sashimi we tried was very fresh. I was a bit disappointed though that the scallop and sea urchin were served atop a slice of orange. The very typical flavor from the orange really overpowered (and I would argue ruined) the more subtle flavors of those two items. 

We also tried a couple of rolls which were definitely needed to fill us up. They were good, and not TOO expensive, but  none of them really stood out. 

If you can afford it, Ozumo is worth a look. You will definitely have a good experience and a pleasant meal.
author: Augusto T.

description:
Every time I go here it is not for personal but rather business, and each time I leave shaking my head at the obscene bill at the end of the night.  I'm not the one that ultimately pays but as a matter of general principle, I do not appreciate having to pay premium-to-Nobu prices for what is basically a Nobu ripoff.  And I don't even particularly like Nobu.

That said the fish here is pretty fresh and some of the cooked dishes are not bad, the deal breaker is really the prices - it just really not that special...not enough to warrant a $300 price tag for two on what should be max $150 or so at any other decent sushi place.
author: Stephen J.

description:
Great ambience.  A bit pricey, but not unexpectedly so.

Tuna tartare was good.
Ozumo roll was fresh and well prepared.

Black cod was rich (maybe a bit overly so).

Solid showing.
author: Kathryn C.

description:
A nice restaurant, but seriously lackluster and overpriced food.

Service is slow, no hand towels in the bathroom, fish didn't taste very fresh.
author: Kim T.

description:
Big, beautiful spot with bay view at the back.

Shrimp tempura roll was the surprise favorite! Spicy tuna was good, hotate and Cali rolls just fine. Hamachi appetizer good. Miso black cod was the best liked hot dish. The medium-rare beef ended up being a bit blue, as you can see in the picture.

Japanese beer selection more interesting than the other beers. I had the Japanese hefe, good enough.

Chocolate fondue with mochi ice cream, matcha cake and fruit was fun to share.
author: Dennis W.

description:
this place to me is a 2.5 star place, maybe 3 stars on a good day.   for the money the food can be experienced at other places for less $.  nearly every single dish we received was too salty and the portions are pretty small.

the service i really where i deduct some stars.  they appeared understaffed and non-responsive. i  had to ask for things multiple times in order to receive it. (this was on a Thursday).

i would not recommend this place nor would i go again unless it was a company function in which case the tab isn't on me because they have plenty of drink options and the ambiance/decor is nice.
author: Danny N.

description: Ozumo does it right! My girlfriend and I went there per a friends recommendation and we were surprised and delighted. The general manager Miho sat us in a trendy little corner of the bar and then pointed out her favorite dishes. We ordered all of her choices and enjoyed every bite. The staff is amazing, the atmosphere is cool, the food was delicious, the presentation was beautiful and the cocktails were creative. And don't forget to order the lobster roll as the finally... Yum..!
author: Breck D.

description: I tried a few different rolls here, and everything was pretty good. The fish is fresh, the  special rolls are pretty special, the restaurant itself is huge, and service is great. I don't know if I will be back though, as it is pretty pricey for what you get (It can be $20+ for  a roll that is about 6 pieces).
author: Jeanette S.

description: My fav to go spot in SF while visiting! Miso soup and any sushi roll is AMAZING. Can not go wrong here.
author: Jenaya B.

description: Loud, large, crowded, impersonal, overpriced, rushed, very tiny portions, very average food. Strikes me of a place that is recommended to out of town visitors on corporate expense accounts by hotel concierge. Not a good fit for me. I like local, traditional Japanese family owned restaurants that are smaller, quieter, and more intimate. I won't return.
author: M D.

description:
The poor service really sunk my rating of this restaurant, which used to be one of my favorites for high end Japanese food.
I am unlikely to go back.
author: FOO D.

description: GREAT for happy hour which is 4-6pm. The chicken karage was a huge amount for the price, the lychee press drink was strong, brussel sprouts were awesome, we had 3 sushi rolls for $18, shashimi, and calamari! This place gets busy during the end of happy hour and it is not listed on yelp and foursquare the time but it is a great spot to meet up with great prices.
author: Lily P.

description: It's decent sushi but not the best. The environment is fun and eating at the sushi bar is always a treat. But I feel like the sushi is overpriced.
author: Samara C.

description: Great atmosphere. Great bar scene. Beautifully presented sushi. Some things a bit pricey. I especially liked the side of roasted corn.  Most sushi rolls were innovative like the mango, lobster, jalapeno roll.
author: Andy R.

description:
Being a regular anywhere means top notch service. We sat at the bar for an hour or so before our reservation. I was starving so I opted to sip on water...until the sake came out. Not sure what it was, but very tasty! I was buzzin' after half a shot and no food in my system...

Decided to sit at the sushi bar instead of the table. The sushi chefs were super nice and funny. After a few beers and shots with them, they were definitely in a good mood. We didn't even order anything. It was just served to us, omakase! I wish I knew what they gave us, because now we'll never be able to order it since it's not on the menu.

We started with miso soup and half a dozen oysters. After that came rounds and rounds of fresh, delicious fish. The first dish we got were hamachi spoons with ponzu and a bit of uni with a crisp lettuce in the center. After many dishes, we ended with a fresh salmon salad tossed in a ponzu-ish sauce with onions. A must try in the city if you love sushi. Make sure to sit at the bar!
author: Stine H.

description:
One word: CRACKAMAME!!! That is what my friends and I think of when we think of Okoze. Why? Well, go there, try the garlic soy edamame, and then let me know of you still need clarification. Simply epic. 

That said, they've also got a great bar scene that is much cozier (in my opinion) than the slightly stuffy feeling restaurant in the back of the house. I always sit in the bar area, regardless of the hour because I like the vibe better. 

They've got some great rolls as well (in a rolls kind of sushi gal). The Ozumo roll is fantastic, and there is another one that has a jalapeño on top, can't remember the name, but it is delicious. The regular spicy tuna roll is good too. 

Only 4 stars because while I usually love everything there isn't a ton of selection for sushi. But that won't keep me from coming back!
author: Krista S.

description:
I don't know how much longer I could hold my balls calm bathing in the soul-sucking dull and creepy vibe of my date. Good thing that the pretty looking Ozumo roll and Sekiwake roll were tasty enough to distract me. 

Service:
-Slow and forgetful considering there weren't that many people in the restaurant at the time.
author: Tian Q.

description: Just home after a Valentine's meal! Loved the atmosphere, lightening . We did move seats, much bigger inside than I thought! Had a really nice meal :) great choice ! Tasty cocktails and we had a fab server ! I will be back for sure !
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Terrible, terrible service. Waited 20 minutes for the waitress to bring water for the table. Another 15 for the waitress to bring our actual drinks, 30 more minutes for our order to be taken and an hour for our food to arrive. 

For a place needing reservations, the service is extremely slow.

The prices are pretty high but the food was good for what was ordered. Even the waitress had to re-recommend food for us though as she agreed some of the portions are extremely small, strange for an already limited menu.
author: Evan D.

description: This was a truly 5 star dining experience. The sushi was phenomenal. The tuna tartare is perfection as well as the edamame. Good choice of wine. Our server was pretty good but could have checked in on us a little more. The inside dining area is very unique with the teak dining sets and accents. I'll be back for more.
author: Christopher J.

description: Where to start. Party of 6 - bill ~$750+. Rolls and sashimi nothing spectacular to justify the high price point. The Ozumo roll was the only thing unique and quite good.  Multiple bottles of sake out after rounds of inquire, sushi plates coming out randomly and individually (nothing was combined into a platter), server rarely/ sparsely checked up on us, couple of errors during our order, and the sever was kind enough to add an additional bottle of sake we never ordered (which was fixed). All in all, not a good experience for a restaurant charging a premium price point - so many better places in SF - would not recommend not return
author: Muschi T.

description: Terrible service from our host and waitress. Be prepared to spend $50 bucks on a few pieces of no more than average tasting sushi. The waitress was oddly slow and would stare on her way off. The hosts were less than hospitable if you have more than 1 interaction with them.
author: H Z.

description: The fish is outstanding, as good as it gets. Extraordinarily expensive, but anybody who considers it too pricey really doesn't care about sushi/sashimi. If you want top-notch, you'll get it here.
author: Yowz A.

description:
Yummy! 

Love the atmosphere, drinks and food.  The Himachi sashimi was delicious and fresh.  The staff was knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating.  I would recommend Ozumo for any occasion.  We continues with their special rolls and everything we ate was beautiful, fresh and delicious! Highly recommend!
author: Su K.

description: The fish melts in your mouth, it's that good. Pricy, but worth every penny. I am rarely moved by Japanese restaurants but this place made me a believer. So glad we stumbled into this place. The only con is the fact that I can't look at sushi the same. This place ruined a lot of others for me.
author: Jay P.

description: We took our daughter to Ozumo for her 16th birthday. She was wanting sushi and we wanted to take her to a Sweet 16 worthy place. I would say we picked a winner. We had sushi and wow it was fresh. The service was excellent and the suggestions were perfect. Too bad we do not live near Ozumo but I am sure the next time to the San Francisco area we well stop in for some sake and sushi.
author: Steve W.

description: Ozumo was great for atmosphere and the food is very fresh and authentic. I had salmon and tobeko sashimi and both were very fresh. I also had a special roll and it was delicious. I sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef is usually more friendly to singles in my experience but in his defense he was busy and it was kind of dark in there.
author: Debra R.

description:
Was in SF on a work trip and my co-worker and I wanted to get away and have a nice dinner. We decided on sushi and I found this place on Yelp. Odd, when we showed up, I realized I had been here before. Great experience the first time, so I was stoked to be here again!

We opted to sit at the sushi bar in the back of the restaurant - a little more intimate than the super trendy, SF scene in the front. As much as I love to dress up and as much as I love to visit SF - I'm a flip flops and beach hair type girl. It is too buttoned up, New York-ish in the front of the house for me on this dinner date. Plus, much quieter in the back. 

I had a nice buzz going before dinner and I wanted to keep it going! Sake flights! Sign me up! My girl had the Light & Fresh flight and I opted for the Richness & Depth fight. We sipped from each others. Hers were definitely lighter and easier on the palette - tasted like rose petals and citrus juices. My flight was vivid and fun with unexpected flavors, but accompanied our sushi very well.

We ordered some salmon and yellowtail sushi and some assorted rolls - Yuyake, Sekiwake, and the Hamachi Maki. The sushi was melt in your mouth quality and the rolls fresh, but nothing super inventive - for that I knocked a star off. 

I enjoyed my time here and my colleague and I had many laughs enjoying a great time away from the work crowd. Will be back when visiting SF in the future.
author: Gia R.

description:
I dislike to throw in 3 stars among a sea of 4 and 5 stars, but I have to be honest about experience and expectations. The decor/ambience of the restaurant is very hip and swanky, suitable for a drink date, dinner date, or business dinner.  For us, we walked in on a Saturday night with one expectation - to be rocked by West Coast sushi and sashimi.

My husband and I are seasoned sushi eaters and usually go for omakase at reputable eateries regardless of price.  In this case, we have to report that we were not in love with the moriawase. The server asked if we wished for quantity or quality, and we chose quality. The items that came out on the plate, not piece by piece even though we were sitting at the bar and it was not busy by the way, were not higher quality cuts nor presented and seasoned for a knowing palate. We got the young chef the first time. 

When we ordered more pieces, we got the older chef, who took the time to season and present the pieces, and those tasted better. Perhaps, to the Chef or server's eyes, we did not look experienced so they thought to throw us the lesser cuts and put less effort to serving it until the older guy heard us whisper to each other? This is the touristy area of SF and also home of many "techno-riche", please do not underestimate someone for wearing t-shirt and jeans, so long as they act politely.  The couple next to us were in cocktail attire but didn't know their aji from their ebi, so remember that looks do not tell you about a diner's palate nor experience.

We finished with the chocolate cake and green tea ice cream, which was delicious and beautifully presented. As a nice bonus, we received an extra scoop of green tea ice cream for staying at the Harbor Court hotel next door. It was a nice sized dessert for my husband and I to share.

Will we return to this restaurant? Perhaps after we hear that they have a better source for their seafood or they receive more raving reviews for their sushi/sashimi from experienced eaters. Weird thing is that our Uber driver said he stayed in Osaka for 2 years and loved Ozumo's sushi and there are plenty of reviews on here that praise their sushi and sashimi.  Next time, I will try to get rezzies at a sushi spot known for their omakase or take an Uber to Ichi.

Thank you for the excellent FOH customer service, beautiful decor, and yummy dessert.
author: Siu L.

description:
I don't like my sushi places fussy but I'll make an exception for Ozumo and let them slide becuase the food makes up for the stuffy dining experiece.  

Been here for lunch on different occassions and I must admit that I've never been dissapointed. The food is top notch. I've always believed that the true judge of a sushi place is the simple nigiri - where you don't hide the quality of your fish behind lots of sauces and ingredients. We had a nice sampling of nigiri this time round (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PNxwbgtfdpldd3CyJFIw3w?select=Eut7D1NMW7ydB9Chtj2n-w) and as expected, they did not dissapoint. It's visual ecstacy to see all that wonderfully fresh fish lined up like that. The salmon belly was hands-down amazing. Nice and fatty but instantly melts in your mouth. 

The bentos are a good choice here too if you want a little bit of variety. The Mifune bento offers a nice mix of nigiri and rolls if you want sushi. We also split a bowl of Udon (can't remember the name but it was also a special for the day) this last trip and I must admit that was one of the sweetest, most tastiest broths I've had the pleasure to slurp. It was a nice combination of crab, pork, and veggies that created said delightful broth. 

I'm still torn about Ozumo. It's a cavernous and fussy place for sushi - not my favorite per se, but gosh darn it Ozumu is just plain dependably good and that's why I'll probably be back again. Pay attention to your server when they mention the daily specials using Japanese phrases you won't remember after - it's probably something good.
author: Jon L.

description:
I absolutely LOVE Ozumo and have been dining here since they first opened.  We come for special occasions, romantic dinners and for happy hours.  Staff is well trained and knowledgeable about the menu and their extensive sake list.  Everyone is friendly and we always walk away happy and feeling like we've been greeted as good friends.

Mel Collins their GM is outstanding.  He remembers everyone and always makes us feel special. Ozumo has ruined us to enjoy sushi elsewhere- we haven't been to a better sushi restaurant in the city or elsewhere.  (Maybe Sushi Ran... but very different experience!)
author: Janet F.

description: Great Dinner tonight. Ozumo treated us well! We had a variety of flavorful dishes! We started with a bottle of Ozumo saké and we were impressed with the quality of the house bottle. Very smooth. We had an assorted sashimi platter with 7 different types. So FresH! Also a few rolls and the Gyu Filet. For dessert the green tea OC cream and flourless chocolate cake. Loved the Hitachino Stout. Good job by Management here. Good music and Ambiance.
author: Steve R.

description:
3.5 stars. The quality of sushi is good here, not amazing, but fresh enough that I'm satisfied.
Everything we ordered was good, including:

Black cod: perfectly cooked, bf cannot stop raving about it.
Fresh nigiri (I ordered pretty much every toro they had on the menu)
Green tea panna cotta
Pork belly: good but a little heavy
Uni risotto: ok but you couldn't taste the uni so much
Hamachi appetizer: I didn't get the hype, it was good but not too special

We also had a big bottle of sake. The waitress was very attentive and made recommendation as to what sake to order. Overall it was a good date spot as the experience was very pleasant. A bit pricey though.
author: Ngan B.

description: Lovely place with great ambiance. Food was delicious and the texture of all the fish vas splendid. A favorite was the fried baby squid and the spicy tuna roll. Would gladly come back.
author: Jo R.

description:
Went here on a business trip with a colleague that lived in SF for several years.

The sushi was delicious and fresh--especially the salmon and yellowtail belly. I live in Seattle now where it is nearly impossible to find sweet shrimp, I love the fried shrimp heads.

The ambiance is great, especially the sushi bar in the back with the view of the bridge.
author: Brian C.

description: Fantastic. This is an upscale beautiful and delicious place to eat. Great for a fancy date. The view of the Bay Bridge with th sparkly lights is fantastic. The Quail appetizer was so good. Pricy but the taste and quality of the fish is great. The Garlic edema was really tasty as well.
author: Leigh S.

description:
I think what'll keep me coming back to Ozumo is not their sushi or their sashimi, but their desserts. On a scale of one to fantastic, I would place Ozuma's dishes slightly above average. The sushi, sashimi, and cooked fish all tasted very fresh, and the meat of the Futago was definitely tender, but everything seemed very standard, and nothing really made me go "wow."I will, however, commend the chefs the consistently stunning presentation of each plate. Now, moving on to the dessert round...

I am the type of person who considers dessert to be the most important part of a meal: everything that is served before dessert is an appetizer, as dessert is my main course. Up until dessert, I felt that our meal was decent at best. However, once our dessert came, everything changed. My friends and I made the mistake of ordering one dessert each (there were 4 of us total that day), but that was probably one of the best mistakes we had ever made. Definitely no regrets were had that night... We ordered one order each of the Choco Chan, Kuromitsu Cheesecake, Rice Pudding, and Chocolate Fondue served with bread and fruit. While 2 of my friends absolutely fell in love with the rice pudding, my favorites were definitely the Choco Chan and Kuromitsu Cheesecake. No doubt, the rice pudding was delicious in that it was perfectly light, creamy, and not too sweet, but I definitely like my desserts rich and dense, so the Choco Chan and cheesecake were what won me over. The Choco Chan is served with a generous scoop of green tea ice cream that counters the richness of the chocolate in the cake quite nicely. The cheesecake was dense and wasn't too fluffy, which I loooooved.

So all in all, decent but pricey "food" food, but the desserts just steal the show.
author: Gaby W.

description: Since we moved to the city two years ago, we have been to Ozumo at least six times and each time the experience was getting worse and worse. On our most recent visit, it took at least 20 minutes to get drinks and the second round arrived after we finished entrees. The special fish dish that I have ordered was overcooked and barely warm. It tasted off and I was right because hours later I was suffering from excruciating stomach ache. This restaurant has certainly become a tourist joint, which is frequented mostly because of the view because I don't see how the food can be the main attraction here.
author: EG P.

description:
I have eaten here twice.
Gorgeous views of the Bay Bridge, especially the lights at night.
The sushi is excellent and the attire is upscale.
Service is excellent.
author: Natascha G.

description:
**Happy hour review**


-starts at 4:30pm
-inexpensive drink/food menu
-crowded but enough space to sit and stand around
-not too loud, not too quiet.  you can still hear and talk w/your goup w/out screaming.
author: Angelica C.

description:
First time here and I've got to say I'm loving it. The vibes, the ambiance and the rolls are great! Not to
Mention DJ HRMONIK is killing it with a smooth R&B set. I have not stopped vibin and eating since I got here. Good times with my home girl Priscilla.
author: Ashley S.

description: I enjoy the Saki flights to sample different flavors. Sushi is always good - fresh and creative presentation. Staff is always friendly and knowledgeable. Definitely a SF staple.
author: J. M.

description:
I just wanted to give an update, even though I can't give half stars, this is close to 5 stars!

I had dinner for the first time here the other evening with my two bosses & coworker. We ordered a bunch of stuff to try from. We started with the garlic edamame and Hanachi which were delicious! The garlic edamame was flavorful and it just made me want to keep the entire shell of the peas in my mouth until I have sucked off all the flavor. We also had the Tuna Tartare which lacked a bit of flavor; bland - but it went well with the flavorful garlic edamame so it was a good balance. We also ordered oysters which were 6 small ones for $20. They didn't taste fresh, were small, and we only had a slice of lemon - which wasn't enough and wont be ordering that again. We also ordered two rolls - Bucho which was avocado with shrimp tempura & crab, which was not bad but nothing I haven't tasted before. Also had the lobster roll which was super unique aesthetically and tasted awesome - the lobster was fresh and soft along with the tuna, tobiko and the sauce to dip in. Too bad there's only 4 pieces. We also ordered the fish of the day which had the fish fried with the fish meat and bones separated. It came with mushrooms and BACON - which made every bite of the fish that much more awesome with some bacon alongside it. I thought the fish lacked flavor as well, but the bacon made up for it. We also had tuna nigiri which melted in our mouths. But my ultimate favorite dishes came at the very end of the meal - the A5 Waygu beef and Green Tea Panna Cotta dessert! The beef is the most amazing piece of beef I have ever tasted (since this is my first A5 beef too so I dont know if that's saying much). The beef was a really small slice, and between 4 people, we only had about 2 pieces each. The beef was so soft and not chewy like meat usually is. We bit down and it just melts in your mouth! The truffle sea salt and the matcha powder on the beef were AH-MAZING! The beef made my night! To top that off, we had the green tea dessert, which was like a green tea flavored flan. It was super delicate and soft, but not too sweet so I enjoyed every bite. I cleared my plate! The chewy nut part on the side (sort of like a peanut brittle) was my least favorite in the dessert since it stuck to my teeth when I chewed it, but it was one of highlights to this meal. Definitely want to come back for that beef :)
author: Amanda C.

description:
This review is for HH.  I forget who our server was, but she was awesome!  She was very attentive, organized and took charge when we were brought the wrong order.  The food was clean and pretty good - we had a couple of rolls and the karaage chicken.  Skip the oyster and mushroom skewers.  I'm not a big fan of skewers anyway.  

The giddy geisha drink was not that great, the lychee drink was much better.  

The crowd here after HH was a bit older.  And there were quite a few significantly older white guys with younger Asian women.  Not really our crowd, but the drinks and food were good nonetheless.

Also, can someone explain to me why there are like 3-4 hostess people in the front?  The one that helped me get change got confused when I told her exactly how much cash I needed back and to card a certain amount on the one credit card.  It's not that hard and that's her job, no?  Our waitress was much smarter so we were able to explain it to her once and she got it done.  

Overpriced sushi but HH is worth it!  Live DJ too!
author: Chris L.

description:
Two stars for wonderful customer service,  good cocktails and an attempt at excellent service.
Down three stars:
If you serve sushi and maki-zushi:
The rice should fall apart and be seasoned perfectly
The nori should be tasty and not chewy.
The fish itself should be a succulent piece of fish,  not a chopped mess
Visually the roll should appear appetizing and lovely
It should be a delectable experience, a balance of all the elements and not a smashed gummy mess.
author: mi m.

description: Love this place!  The bucho roll was fabulous as was the black cod.  Kudos to the manager, Mel Collins for making us feel right at home...and for the sake.  And, the garlic edamame was terrific.  Definitely recommend and coming back!!!
author: Liz G.

description:
Line: we had reservations, and we were seated as soon as we walked in.

Drinks: very hot green tea. It was nice because they gave us a pot for our table, but it was pretty expensive for the amount.

Appetizers: we had a miso soup, and wanted a house salad, but they apparently don't serve those. Instead, our waitress brought us a regular salad with a ginger dressing. It was nice of her!

Sushi rolls: Ozumo, hamachi maki, and sekiwake rolls. Hamachi maki roll was my favorite because it has actual jalapeños on it and gives it that extra kick! The sauce it comes with is also good. 

Wait time: the food didn't take too long to come out. 

Service: Jena was our waitress and she was super cute! She's really small. But anyways.... She brought us everything we asked for, including the customized salad and extra water.

Overall: the sushi was not the best tasting sushi I've ever bad, but the atmosphere is great
author: Morgan H.

description:
Almost always delicious.  Nice staff great decor and most importantly fresh ingredients.  

Hostesses take themselves too seriously at times, turning away business when there's room in the back or asking if you have a reservation at lunch when it's clearly half open.   Oh well I'm sure they have their reasons.   

Remains the best sushi I've had in Oakland.
author: M K.

description:
I love coming here for lunch. The service is superb and they offer a nice variety of bento boxes and sushi choices. The sushi here is always very fresh. 
I tend to avoid this place for happy hour or dinner because it can be a scene...
author: Mimi T.

description: This is a high class style of place, I'm from out of state and a local recommended it. Super easy to find, right next to the beautiful sites 2 mile walk from fisherman's wharf. I felt a little under dressed for sure! I felt like I got good service and knowledgable about sushi. It was hard to read the menus because it's uses the Japanese terms for fish.... I'd go back - and bring a bigger wallet and nicer clothes
author: Nic O.

description:
Usually I love Ozumo but....today was horrid.  the service was SLOW.....Beer took 10+ minutes.  My main sushi never came, after almost an hour.  Finally I cancelled it and told her we had to go.  Clearly I was irritated and it took almost 10 minutes to get the bill back.  When the bill finally came the manager said, we took the roll off the bill.  GEE, really?   Like it was a favor that they took the roll off I never even got.
Next time....I'll be getting my sushi elsewhere.  Especially.........at those prices.  Geez.
author: Robin G.

description:
Ventured into Ozumo on a Friday night based on a foodie friend's referral. The restaurant is actually much bigger than it appears from the outside. The host directed us to a table on the Embarcadero side of the building with a beautiful view of the Bay Bridge light show. 

Everything was delicious!! My favorites were:

1. Hanabi - hamachi, avocado, warm ginger-jalapeño ponzu - great flavor
2. Gyu Kakuni - slow braised prime short ribs, daikon, tohoku aka miso sauce - so tender!! the meat literally fell off the bone. 
3. Hotate - pan seared dayboat scallops, brussel sprouts, forbidden rice, moromi miso - great flavorful combo
4. Fondu platter - chocolate, fruit, and ice cream mochi - Delicious!! Let the chocolate warm up for a few minutes before you start. 

You have to try their sparkling sake too! Ask their Sake-mama which sake will pair well with your meal. She is very knowledgeable and friendly. :)

Everyone at Ozumo is friendly, attentive, and professional. Can't wait to come back and try other dishes!
author: CL S.

description:
Have been here three times, and it is a good if spendy option for the sushi-craving solo business traveler to SF.  The sushi is fresh, the specials worthy of that word.  Had wonderful salmon belly and hamachi belly last time.  The uni negiri was really fresh and briny-sweet.  Also had a really nice salad with heirloom tomatoes and snow crab and a delicious Korobuta pork small plate.  That pork was really super - soft, salty-sweet and oh-so-oink.  Mmmmm.  The portion is not large enough to induce guilt, leaving its eater to still feel somewhat virtuous for eating so much other healthy stuff here.

Really nice selection of sakes-by-the-glass.  The service is good, but not great.  I have always been oblivious to the "scene" around me while sitting at the sushi bar, so that doesn't really impact this review.

By all means, go.
author: Steven H.

description: Fluffy, commercialized sushi with high price point, but portions are not bad. Waiters are over zealous and not that knowledgeable. Nice decor, large space. Go if you want to splurge on sushi and sake. If you want to impress your date, this is a good place, if you can afford it.
author: Sherry L.

description:
We totally loved this place.

But we made a big mistake.  

When we came into the entrance, we decided to sit in the bar area.  Little did we know that the dining area has beautiful view of the Bay Bridge.  Next time, table with a view.

Great sushi.  Excellent service.
author: Carrie B.

description:
Some of the best sushi I've had in the city, with stunning views of the Bay Bridge if you snag a good seat in the restaurant. 

Appetizer: Garlic Edamame is life.

Sushi Rolls: Bucho and Ozumo Roll were fantastic! Very flavorful and fresh. We got ours thinly sliced, which was a nice option

Super overpriced, but seems like you are paying for the view/location and it's quite dressy and upscale inside. Very good spot for a date night or date night with the girls. You can easily spend $75 per person if you order multiple rolls and sake. Watch out if you are on a tighter budget for the evening :)
author: Justine M.

description:
Came to San Fran on a business trip this time around and went out here for dinner/late happy hour with some colleagues since it was next to our hotel...and wow, was I amazed!

This place look small from the outside but just you wait...as you walk inside, this place seems endless, it's huge! It has a variety of lounges, a bar, sushi bar, and it's very stylish/fancy. It's definitely a top notch sushi restaurant and the menu is amazing. Their staff is all pleasant as well.

I've had excellent sushi before, but even the most simple dishes elsewhere, were presented so beautifully! It is quite pricey but the quality of the fish and ingredients is very good. I would highly recommend their garlic soy edemame, spicy tuna handrolls, sashimi, and sake. They have a vast variety of sake and other drinks such as lychee mimosa like beverages. We all shared the dishes and enjoyed each and every one.

I will definitely return when I come back to SF (which I will soon! love that city!) and would love to try more items on Ozumo's menu!
author: Akvile D.

description:
