Don't do it. Food is seriously overpriced. There are literally hundreds of restuarants in the city much better. Went to Ozumo years ago, and it seems the only people who go there now are business travelers.

I had an expired Pinchit certificate here... $81 for $108 in food. Called the day I went and was told that a manager said the $81 I paid for the voucher would be honored. Made a reservation. Went that night. Told the server about the voucher who said it was not a problem. Got the bill and Mel the "manager" only took $45 off the bill saying the voucher was expired. He made a ton of excuses and told me to take the manner up with Pinchit. Classy. Really classy. Hey, Mel, that's not how you run an "upscale" restaurant. Won't be back. Ever. Telling all my friends. 

I don't mind dropping $$$ on a good meal, but this is just not the place and is run by people who obviously don't know what they're doing.
author: Sannie C.

description:
Love the atmosphere here. Upscale and refined but not pretentious. The food is even better. 

Yellowtail collar. Do it.
author: Will P.

description: Good ambiance on a Friday night. Decent sushi and various rolls and specials.  Really liked the white asparagus salad and the corn soup with crab on grilled peaches. I'd say 3.5 stars for food but minus 1/2 star for how expensive everything is.  Nice service and good views of the waterfront though.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Ozumo has one of the best restaurant atmospheres in San Francisco.  When you initially walk in, it seems like a small, dark lounge, but then you're led up a few steps into the dining area, and it's HUGE, and gorgeous.  Very modern and perfectly lit with a large sushi bar in the center.  Big windows give you a beautiful view of the Bay Bridge.

I'll start by saying that the food is not so much more mind-blowing than your next Japanese restaurant, but the ambiance does make it that much more enjoyable.  I always have their uni risotto, and usually throw in an assortment of nigiri.  They offer fish that you may not see at an average sushi bar, since they do bring in a lot of specials.  Everything has always been super fresh and beautifully presented.

I wouldn't go with their sushi rolls.  They're a little overpriced for what they are (not that they aren't tasty).  Their beef tataki was a bit of a let down for me... just a little overcooked.  Their tuna tartare and Hamachi appetizers are great selections to start off with.

Great sake selection, and very professional staff.  I highly recommend Ozumo for special occasions.
author: Gina L.

description: Had a delicious sushi lunch today.  Had the sushi bento box and we shared a spider roll and a bottle of sake.  Also had the chocolate fondue and a scoop of Ice cream.  Everything was delicious- but not sure the price is worth the quantity.  Great for girls- but maybe not a hungry guy.
author: Madhuri K.

description: Expensive but delicious. If you like fresh sushi this is a must try.  Everyone I was with enjoyed what they had from the fresh sushi to the pork, the meal was great.  I will say it is expensive but if you have the cash to spend check it out.
author: Betty W.

description:
Nice ambiance - decent bar and decor. 

VERY pricey. Food I thought was delicious. Manager, Mel, came by and greeted us and made sure everything was ok. I thought that was nice and good customer service. Fusion Jpns. I will save up my money and go there again. Busy at dinner time... waited 30 min for a table...
author: jess c.

description: I've eaten here twice, now - the first meal was fine, but the second was phenomenal. Nothing here is inexpensive, but you're much better off going for the really good stuff. The lower-end options are just fine, but the best experience Ozumo has to offer comes with a hefty price tag. And if you're a foodie, it's worth it. The Wagyu, in particular, is absolutely incredible.
author: Mason H.

description:
While the ambience was amazing, the service was a bit slow and the server apologized several times for it. 

The food was ok but not outstanding. We loved the fatty tuna but the rest was simply ok. I spend a lovely evening with my son but would not really go back for the sushi.
author: Heike Y.

description:
My friends and I were visiting San Francisco and my niece recommended this sushi restaurant.  When I called to make reservations, I was so disappointed that the next available time for dinner was 9:15pm on a Saturday night!  Makes you think that this must be a real good restaurant and it didn't fail me after we had one of the best sushi and great service at this establishment!

 First of all, they offered me the sushi bar if we wanted to come in earlier and since we really wanted sushi, I said fine!  They reserved the sushi bar for us which usually never happens in a sushi restaurant as the bar seating is first come first served.  When we arrived, they logistically seated the three of us in a corner of the sushi bar seating so we could still face each other while eating!  They were very welcoming and accommodating and our server was most knowledgeable of their menu and offered great suggestions.

Needless to say, we had a great dining experience here and the food was superb, fish super fresh and the restroom had learning Japanese broadcasted loud and clear!!!  They had fancy and interesting cocktail drinks which were fantastic!  The prices was kinda high but it was so worth it!  I would come back to this place again next time I am in the city!
author: Inday C.

description:
***************

             Left Americano Happy Hour to come back here last night for some yummy sushi with my dear friends Thuy & Stephen. Sitting at the sushi lounge again &  Mel, the manager was as wonderful to us as always!

What we ordered:

- Hamachi Sashimi
- Aji Sashimi - super buttery & nice texture!
- Ika Sashimi
- Konakanpachi Sashimi - so yum & fresh!
- Spicy Maguro Handroll - enough spice for my taste, love it!
- Maguro Tataki - must try dish!
- Sacho's Shabu Shabu - Washu Rib Eye with daikon radish ponzu dipping sauce, swished through a simmering pot, of miso-dashi broth. 

               & some sake & shots to end the night with good DJ, good food & good friends. Life is good, indeed!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: Nice atmosphere. Food was good and we enjoyed our evening. We sat in the back and ate which was lovely but I think that next time I would like to sit in the front bar. My only complaint would be that our waiter was a little slow and when I paid the bill he did not bring my change back until I asked for it ( he assumed the remainder was his tip, which would have been almost 35%).  I am by no means cheap but please let me decide what amount of tip I would like to give you. Other than that I enjoyed the restaurant
author: Ashlee P.

description: Trendy, lively and excellent sushi. Seaweed salad was not as good. Easy walk from Union Square
author: David S.

description:
Beautiful, upscale restaurant with minimalistic and elegant decor.  We were warmly greeted and seated promptly upon arrival.  Our waiter was helpful with our menu selections as well.  

We started with the Dohyo--tuna tartar with gyoza chips (fried won ton wrappers).  This was served over a bed of avocado and topped with caviar.  Yummy!  Also had the Giddy Geisha x2 (fruity lychee goodness!!).  

4 vegetable medley--basically grilled okra (i think), eggplant, cauliflower, and kabocha squash.  The cauliflower was the best of the four.  I found the okra (or maybe they were peppers) bitter and the eggplant and squash slightly bland. 

Lobster roll--This was delicious.  I was kind of expecting very thin slivers of lobster but they were actually quite generous with the chunks of lobster meat in the roll.  

Spicy scallop roll--nothing special but very good.

Black cod--We ordered this upon the recommendation of our waiter.  The fish was cooked to perfection--so buttery soft and full of flavor.  It was so good that I forgot what the garnish was.  

Hamachi roll--yes another delicious roll.  At this point, we were so stuffed that we couldn't enjoy this the way it should have been.  

At the end of the meal, we debated whether to go with the chocolate fondue (that every other table seemed to order), flourless chocolate cake, or just throw up from all the over-eating.  Eventually decided to go with the flourless chocolate cake and we were glad we did.  Absolutely delish!
author: Janine L.

description:
Have you ever had amazing sushi?  If you answered yes and it was at Ozumo then proceed on, if you answered no/not really then read my review!

So....I came here oh 5 years ago and could not stop thinking about how good the sushi was, really no I couldn't stop because it's super good!  It really is!  And worth every penny!

So we (almost) ordered everything off the menu, and to be honest we didn't hate anything!  You have to have to have to have to order the Doyu (spelling?) it's a tasty appetizer dish of spicy tuna on a bed of guacamole with chips...whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaattttttttttttttttttttt?  It's amazing, seriously amazing!

One of our night we ordered the $35 duck, CAPITAL O-M-G!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Soooo tasty, I swear it was the best duck we'd ever ad, I almost ordered one for myself but I was stuffed on the 4 sushi trays I'd ordered!  

Look I'm saying this place is amaze balls, and I don't usually go to the same sushi place more than once, but this place made us come back TWO times on our trip!  It's hard to have sushi anywhere else after Ozumo!!

Also a side note, our waiter John (or was it Jon?) was so awesome, you need him, REQUEST HIM!  He knows his stuff, NO JOKE, he's so super nice and will totally without a doubt take care of you!
author: Yekta A.

description:
It was date night for my lady and I, so of course sushi was our number one choice. Ozumo's is our favorite place to go to enjoy smooth sake and sushi. We ordered two appetizers garlic edamame and ahi tuna tartare. An order of toro and an order of the ozumo roll. 
The night started off great..up until my lady found a long course black strand of hair in the ahi tuna tartare! It was disgusting! I immediately got the server's attention and showed him. He took it right away and apologized.  We noticed people in suits glancing our way while talking near the kitchen. Sure enough a lady came over and apologized and said 'the next fresh one is on us'.  .. Now my lady and I could have gone crazy over this but we really love this place and didn't want this to ruin our feelings for Ozumo's. 
We finished our dinner and then ordered a dessert. I really enjoyed the green tea custard (i forgot the name). As they server brought our check he told us that the second appetizer and dessert was on the house. The total was still high. Now considering they took care of two pates..if you ask me..and you are a high end classy cuisine that generates revenue every day of the week..and you want to make sure your customers are happy and leave happy..i would think you would take care of the whole bill, not just two lousy plates!
Finding a strand of hair in my food was very disgusting and disturbing. And tampered not only mine but my lady's every thought while trying to finish our dinner. Its as if we must dissect our dishes before we eat. I don't think we will be coming here..not for a long while.
Thanks Ozumo's..but try again.
author: Arielle O.

description:
I've been to that restaurant for many times.  Food is still excellent.  Very fresh fish. Huge variety of drinks and they are really unique.  
The ambiance of the place has changed.  Not too many people.  Looks like lots of tourists.
author: Elena M.

description: AWESOME for those of us who cannot have gluten! They offer Tamari sauce substitutions and have amazing food! The sashimi selection is great and the quality is high. We loved the ozeki roll! The grilled kabobs are also really good, especially the chicken and salmon ones. Fun atmosphere with a live dj makes this place even better!
author: Sheena N.

description:
Have been here a handful of times. Overall, great quality sushi, yet the quality still lags the price. 

Great ambiance for happy hours and dinner: fun, relatively spacious and reasonable wait time on the weekends. 

The food is definitely fresh and well prepared. Some dishes/rolls are better than others. 

Location is convenient, yet parking would usually be a problem if you don't to pay the $20 valet fee. 

Bonus: Fun to sit at the bar as the bartenders are usually great and lots of fun. They just add to the experience! I have taken a few friends - from out of town/country - and they've loved the overall experience!
author: Azi Z.

description:
On our trip to SF our concierge suggested this to us for an anniversary date and it was definitely worth it!

Loved the ambience. Started with drinks at the bar and then moved for an amazing dinner to the dining area. 
Dont remember what we ate exactly but whatever we did was spectacular!! 

5 stars to the ambience, service and food!!
author: Maitreyee R.

description:
The Dish: We had the Ozumo, Spicy Scallop, Sekiwake, and Orange Dragon, all of which I thought were really good. Each one was really unique and I think what makes this place really good is the sauce that comes with each sushi order. I think it was the Sekiwake that came with a sweet sauce that was totally surprising but paired really well. The quality of the sushi is pretty good, but the rolls are TINY. For the price of this place, I don't think the size (and even the taste) of the sushi was worth it. But to be fair, if I were allowed to give half ratings, I'd rate this place a 3.5.

Ambiance: Very classy - has a bar in the front and seats in the back. They definitely have good service here. Get the hot tea & save room for dessert!
author: Gina T.

description: Amazing!!!!! Food was spectacular. Service was outstanding. Ambiance was lovely. Can't wait to go back ......tomorrow??!
author: La C.

description:
The prices are completely absurd.  A bottle of their cheapest 300ml sake and a side of edameme = $50.

That price would have been fine if it included great service, but our waitress seemed to have only one thing on her mind during our entire visit:  turning the table.  When we told her we weren't going to have dinner service, she our waitress proceeded to become the meanest, most pushy service employee I've ever met.  What a shame that we were seated AT THE SAKE BAR.  

In her grand rush to get us to leave, our waitress took the edameme 'discard' bowl away when it was only half full (?), then returned a few minutes later and started taking away the edameme bowl away while there was still edameme in it (??), then brought us our check without asking if we wanted anything else (we did; we were going to order dinner), then didn't bring me coins when she brought my change.

For all the stress this business's owners have in getting people to come in and sit down, it's a shame that our waitress was so eager to get us to stand up and leave.
author: Charles Y.

description:
We got some hookups coming here and had a great experience!  Very sleek cool design throughout the place with GREAT service.

Was seated next to the window overlooking the Bay Bridge oOooo!  We tried a number of dishes- all family style (sharing).  It was suggested that we order a roll  each, a couple of small plates, and 2-3 mains.  I must say overall we did a good job ordering for the food was plentiful- but each dish was on the small side and some of the rolls only came with 5 pieces even though we had 6 people.  I know it can't be helped but it just made it all a hassle trying to split and let everyone have a taste.

My favorites: the garlic edamame, black cod, and the terriyaki pork.  All that deliciousness that  just melted in my mouth!  

Overall a great meal even though it was pretty high for my budget.  Wouldn't mind coming back if they switched their menu (we had ordered everything we wanted to try already) and of course when I find money in my pocket to splurge with.
author: Esther S.

description:
I had a client dinner here and it was great as it wasn't too crowded but sufficiently busy.

This place is a bit pricey ... I probably wouldn't come here if I were to have to pay for it myself, but it's still good. I had to the softshell crab roll, the crab was fried to perfection!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Dear Lunch Waitress (forgot your name, because you didn't bother to introduce yourself), 

If your absent-minded and ignorant treatment is any indication, I don't expect for you to ever read this....but, in case curiosity prevails, here goes. 

I guess you are wondering why you received a meager $2.00 dollar tip from a party of 4?
- it took you 15 minutes to greet us after being seated
- another 15 to ask for our order
- over 30 minutes to get cold edamame (we ordered "hot edamame" btw...)
- and another hour to get our dishes

Not once, did you apologize or check in. You didn't even bother to come by after our meals were served to see how they were (in case you were wondering, they were nothing special). Come to think of it, you didn't even bother to bring out the dishes to us (a runner did it for you). 

When we were ready to leave your "fine" establishment...it took you another 15 minutes to run the card. 

To the Restaurant: 
- you had 4 in the kitchen and a dedicated expediter 
- you also had 6 sushi chefs dedicated 
- a Front of House manager
- at least 4 runners (and quite a few servers)

Why aren't the orders going to the kitchen? Why is the kitchen not hustling? Why didn't the Front of House manager step in to reorganize and take hold of the service? In fact....why was the Front of House manager just having small talk with the Hostess while things were backing up?!?

I know you are in a "touristy" part of town and you don't need to impress as you know the crowd and cash will continue to flow in....at least, humor the locals with trying.
author: Kris K.

description:
Maybe I was just a road weary traveler, but I really, really liked Ozumo... Perhaps it was the spaciousness of the interior (nothing like the sardine cases we fit into in NYC), but I enjoyed myself every second I was there. 

The highlights:
- a terrific table with a view of the bay bridge shortly after the lights exhibit began
- a rotating, knowledgeable wait staff that remembered small details about our table throughout the evening... such as.. 
- a terrific old fashioned, made to order, with subsequent drinks astutely not including those silly little umbrellas
- edamame with garlic, 
- tempura ebi (tiger shrimp), 
- gindara (mushrooms) 
- bucho sashimi
- and the chocolate dessert to die for

Overall, I had a great time, and would recommend Ozumo to anyone with the budget to spare. Enjoy!
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
Awful. Just bad. We were staying at the hotel next door, and in over a week in San Francisco this was easily the worst, most overpriced meal we ate. The manager was turning away people who were coming to eat because he closed the kitchen early, and there were 4 hostesses just standing around when they weren't turning away hungry potential customers. However, if you ask me they got lucky that they didn't have to be disappointed by the food.
My food was just okay, but was incredibly overpriced. The cocktail that the waitress recommended tasted like generic NyQuil. Overall it was $100 that I would rather have saved, and just gone to Subway for food instead.
author: Christina J.

description: Walked in, and was greeted by at least 5 different people. Everyone was very polite and helpful. Our waiter Mike walked us through the menu and explained everything with detail and precision. Thanks to him, everything we ordered was amazing! So fresh, and really a cool ambiance. Great view too. Thanks Ozumo.
author: Mikayla R.

description: I've been to Ozumo twice and they never fail to disappoint.  The place is habitually packed to the brim so I would make a reservation unless you enjoy waiting at the bar, which I do - the bar there boats a great number of domestic, imported and Japanese beers and delicious mixed drinks - but don't drink too much, or you'll lose your appetite for their vast array of appetizers and succulent sushi list.  With sushi, you tend to get what you pay for: great sushi comes at a great price.
author: Amanda G.

description: Shabu was good, good meat but lots of cabbage which is the cheapest vegetable. We had shabu which is a kind of soup but no spoons were provided. We had to ask for it. We ate at bar area, our waitress was not that good. Seaweed salad is salty. We told her it was salty & we needed some lemon. All she was " you need some lemon", not saying anything about the salty salad. Cocktail is really mediocre.
author: Linda L.

description:
I think Ozumo has good sushi, but really overpriced for what you get! Dishes are small and sometimes not so special.
The rice pudding dessert was great though!
author: Shirin E.

description:
I travel to San Francisco quite frequently, and when I am here, sushi is often on my mind.  Last night I asked the front desk at the hotel where i should go, and they advised Ozumo.  Once I arrived, I realized that I had been there before.  The last time I went was based on a referral from a friend, and that is a good sign that two different people would recommend it.

I had the Sea Urchin and the Spider roll, and both were perfect.  The wait staff was very friendly and there were many other wonderful dishes to choose from.  An added tip, I checked in on Foursquare and received a complimentary order of Edamame, so be sure to check in when you go!
author: Brian R.

description:
First and foremost, I have to thank and applaud our waiter Wes (W-E-S)! He gave amazing recommendations, told some hilarious stories and had the patience to deal with our obnoxious party of two (that was eating and drinking for four). Sure, this place can be expensive, but I'm all about the overall experience and for special occasions there is no better place to enjoy some delicious sushi and sake. 

Hanabi - amazing, even more amazing was watching my friend fumble with his chopsticks attempting to pick up the thinly sliced avocado pieces. Dinner and a show!

Garlic Edamame - Super tasty, I only wish that I didn't order this with dessert hahah I blame the sake!

Kaiso Seaweed Salad - I was pleasantly surprised at how crisp and flavorful this salad was. Would definitely get again.

Ozumo and Shacho Rolls - Both delicious, I was probably more satisfied with the Ozumo roll though. Definitely get it if your a fan of unagi. 

Toro Nigiri- Literally butter. Worth trying at least once but it is a mighty expensive bite. 

Salmon Belly Sashimi- Best thing I ate all night, I probably could've ordered 3 more rounds but I got too distracted by our Sake flights.

Choco Chan (Jackie Chan!)- Super rich dark chocolately goodness. 

I wish I had more recollection of all the Sake we tried (I think we may have had 3-4 flights each and then some additional glasses! Shout out to Wes again for looking out for us and making sure we were being responsible =] I remember our first round of flights because of how awkwardly wonderful the names were "Black Dragon" and "White Waterfall". After that it just became a game of choosing the sake with the best menu description, good times. 

Can't wait to go back to Ozumo and splurge again in the future. Totally worth it in my book.
author: Leanna Z.

description:
3.5 stars.  I've eaten here a few times over the past few years and hung out strictly in the bar area on a couple of occasions as well.  Although there's no question that the food here is good, if I am going to spend the amount of money that inevitably gets thrown down when I dine here I'd normally opt to choose to dine at another restaurant.

The restaurant and bar area are well decorated and it's clear that part of the reason for the prices here can be attributed to the trendy decor and location of this restaurant as, depending on where you are seated, you will have the added benefit of a view of the Bay Bridge while you are dining.

On the most recent visit our group ordered and shared the dohyo (sashimi tuna tartare with avocado cream), veggie tempura, dragon roll, the suzuki (seabass on top of mushroom risotto), and the gindara (black cod).  Of all the dishes the best tasting and most memorable were the suzuki and gindara.  The fish in each of these dishes was delicious, tender and moist, and cooked very well.  The mushroom risotto in the suzuki dish was also very good.

Ozumo also possesses a very nice selection of sake as well.  We ordered some sake that was bottled in an oil can-esque canister.  Aside from the gimmicky packaging it was excellent and extremely smooth.
author: Erich D.

description: Ok, for everyone thinking this place is over priced, it's not. The old adage of 'you get what you pay for' definitely applies. Not only is the food incredible but the service is unparalleled. I didn't have to wait for water, my server was attentive, friendly, and fun, and then there was the food....BEST BLACK COD EVER. If you're up for a little adventure, try the 'Charlie's Special' (uni shooter)....delicious.
author: Mike L.

description:
Best calamari I've ever had (miso marinated and super tender) and edamame has yummy garlic soy glaze. 

I went here with my boo before a Giants game and boy am I glad I did. The bar is great if you are just looking for some great seasonal drinks and apps to tide you over, but the restaurant is delicious! 

Try the Hawaiian glazed fish, sushi roll (my boy said its the best he's ever had) or crazy crunchy tempura!
author: Heather T.

description:
Good sushi and a great sake selection. I tried the sake flights with my wife and we ready enjoyed the opportunity to try so many variations. Being from NY and having our own great sushi places, I would have to say the sushi was good and a bit over priced. 

I would recommend this to a friend.
author: Dan H.

description:
Great service..Excellent ambience.
And food was amazing. My last visit was almost 3 yrs back - their service and quality of food has only changed for the better. 
Definitely coming back more often..
author: Prema S.

description:
Trendy/modern/sexy ambience and great service. The food was also delicious... actually thinking back on the meal I had here, I can't think of one bad thing about the whole experience. 

It is pricy, but since it's a nice sushi restaurant in a location where everything is expensive, that's not surprising. Two Kirins, a bowl of edamame, two orders of nigiri, two rolls and the fondue dessert was ~$100 with tip. Personally, I think the price was worth it. However, the prices do mean that I can't eat at Ozumo as much as I'd like to ):

Ozumo is a great place to go for a special occassion or a date (or just a regular meal!).
author: Alison B.

description:
After I ate here I was really sad that I hadn't eaten at Ozumo sooner. I was blown away by everything -- the decor, food, staff, the view of the Bay Bridge. 

This is going to sound strange, but while I was there I felt like I was in a daze. I was just so overwhelmed by how GOOD everything was. Everything I ate was rich with flavor. My favorite thing that I ate, which I recommend, was the Bucho. 

Since this place is so close to where I work I will be coming back frequently. The only negative thing about this place is that it is so damn expensive! Don't eat here unless you are willing to spend a lot of money, because otherwise your experience will be ruined by the pricey bill.
author: Abena O.

description:
One word.... overpriced.   I don't mind expensive restaurants as long as I'm getting value.  This place isn't it.  The 2 of us blew through $180 of small plates and sushi... 2 glasses of wine... and left hungry.  That doesn't happen to me often.

There are FAR more satisfying and better Japanese restaurants in San Francisco.  This place is good for that occasional corporate dinner.  Nice view of the bridge.  Good service without much warmth. Beautiful 'sexy' bar area. 

I will say that their dessert menu is very well done.  I could have had anything on the dessert menu as everything was quite inventive. Rare the restaurants do so well on desserts. 

I'm amazed at all the favorable reviews.  These people must not eat out often.  I don't have the energy to comment on each plate as they were all pretty much lackluster .. and did I say overpriced?
author: Victor P.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday dinner. First of all, you can wear something a little more dressy since it is a nice restaurant. Prices are relatively high. Everything on their menu is relatively delicious, so it really doesn't matter too much if you sort of decide to order randomly.
One dish I would never forget is their uni-risotto (sea urchin risotto). Now that one is oh-ma-gah. I do not like raw sea urchin by itself and would very unwillingly pay $$$ to eat them. Risotto is meh for me, but when you combine the two together......I can eat this all night long. (negative + negative = positive) haha
Anyways, the only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is because they don't validate. However, parking is convenient because they offer valet (until 11PM).
author: Melissa S.

description:
After cruising my chopsticks all across the city,  I have finally come to the conclusion that Ozumo is the Best Sushi Restaurant in SF.

And if you care to disagree with me then you really should go again

and have David as your server

and sip on the the "Sexy Sushi-Tini" ($9) 

and savor the Robata grilled shimeji mushrooms with tempura broccoli and aoli sauce ($7)

and splurge on the fresh from the market Toro Nigiri ($20)

and foodgasm over the undeniably delicious Dragon Roll (16)

and indulge in the Warm Chocolate Bignets with vanilla bean ice cream ($8)

Because if you did all of this -  I'm pretty sure you'd leave with the EXACT same opinion as me. :)

THANK YOU OZUMO for another 5-STAR sushi experience!
author: Caroline J.

description:
My mifune sushi bento box was tasty

Goyzo veggie potstickers were bland

The tuna salad was nice

Service is great

Loved the view in the back room
author: Foodlover B.

description: The food was fantastic... Our service was ABSURD. The waitress, AJ, was ridiculous. We went there with a group of friends and she forgot our friends' order completely. She didn't even bother to apologize or let us know what was going on with the missing entrée. We literally had to hunt her down to figure out what's happening. The missing food comes out after everyone had finished eating... Then she brings the check and acts like nothing happened... She didn't comp the missing meal, apologize, nothing.... So weird.. Horrible service.
author: Bella D.

description: Evening event with a group of 17, lower stars for that. So will update review when I go back with a smaller group.  The flavor of their food was great. Fish or sushi done just right.  Improvements would be have the food come out in a reasonable amount of time.   We were there 2 hours (no dessert time) and food was spread over 1 1/2 hour, not sure why they needed to spread out that much, didn't make for comfortable visits as some of us were starving.  After the first hour water was not refilled.  But food flavor surpassed service.  Hope to increase stars later.
author: Sandy N.

description: Yeah, yeah the sushi is pretty damn good. Great, in fact. But dear god it's expensive! If I'm going to drop that kinda cash on a meal it better be 5 star cuisine and service, Ozumo is not that.
author: R C.

description:
Came here for lunch, its close to work. The bento box I got was gross! The steak was very stringy and the sides which I couldn't choose cuz they pre determine them were bamboo shoots and a cold piece of tofu.

This place is a 3.5 star sushi place for a reason. They have the potential to be better but there not living up to their customers satisfaction. I will not be coming back here.
author: Jess O.

description: I have been coming here a lot over a span of 7 years (probably was coming every other month, I am a California native).  And every time I came here the service from the waiter, the chefs, the hostess, the food have always been spectacular.  I have even turned friends into regulars.  Highly recommend, love the food, love the drinks!  Everything on the menu is superb.  I am a humble person so I was always discreet, polite when coming here.
author: Stephanie I.

description: Great, fresh sushi and the bar is awesome. Good spot for Friday night drinks. We ate at the bar, had a selection of rolls, the brussel sprouts were surprisingly good. Nice selection of saki and full liquor available. Good people watching, it's a mix of financial people and tourists. The ambiance was my favorite part about Ozumo. It'd be a nice place for a date.
author: Maria S.

description: This place was good and the inside is super big and trendy. I loved the vibe and the rolls were delish. Def a place I will go to again.
author: Brittini S.

description: service is good ,food is fresh!  just a bit too pricey!  Well it is financial district so!
author: Shuting Z.

description:
I went here recently for my sister's birthday and I had just the best experience. Almost everyone at the restaurant seemed to be informed of her birthday, as she would pass various busers, waiters, and hosts and they would all wish her a very Happy Birthday. 

The waitstaff was extremely attentive and well informed about the menu. I usually have somewhat of a hard time finding food at most places (especially sushi places) as I am a vegetarian (and one who will not be satisfied with a "cucumber roll")... but not only did the waitress show me my options, she asked the chef to make me a special roll when I couldn't find anything I liked on the menu. It was absolutely delicious! It was a veggie caterpillar roll, with sweet potato tempura wrapped in rice and avocado... completely nom-worthy. 

We were visited often by the manager of hospitality and even the chef himself visited our table to check on us. 

All in all, this was a wonderful experience... the food was great, the service impeccable, and the location to die for with a gorgeous view of the Bay Bridge and water. 

I HIGHLY recommend this spot... you can't go wrong!
author: Arielle S.

description:
Amazing service, terrific ambiance, great food, very clean and fresh.

Big ups to the garlic soy edamame (a must) and the Hanabi- sooo worth your investment.
We asked the server for reco's on best dishes and she failed to disappoint; also ordered a great bottle of cold unfiltered sake per her guidance and loved our lives.

I have never given 5 stars.  Until now...
author: c d.

description:
If you're looking for a trendy spot with a nice atmosphere.. then by all means, Ozumo is the place for you.  But if you're looking for great food, and at these prices... i expect greatness, then try Ozumo once, and move on.  

Don't get me wrong.. the food was definitely good, but at no time during the meal was i awed by anything that we tried.  The tuna tataki salad was perfectly palatable as was the Hanabi we had for the appetizer.  I must say those were probably my favorite parts of the meal along with the red bean paste beignets we had for dessert.  I tried the shiromaguro, aji, hotate and Uni.... and again, all were passable, but portions were small (to be expected), prices were high and quality was simply average.

I love my sushi... and after spending 300 here (including sake).. i was still left wanting more.  In my book, that should never happen.  So to review.. a definitely trendy and hip place to be seen and eat at.  And if price is no option, then maybe this is the sushi joint for you.  But for me, i want to be satisfied after my meal and not have to wonder if i should keep ordering because the nigiri is 9 bucks and that i can pop them like mentos.
author: Felix W.

description: Came here while in San Francisco and while nothing was bad nothing was amazing either. Got many cut rolls and nothing really amazed us. Will probably come back just because of the lack of good sushi restaurants in the area but won't be excited to do so.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
Over a thousand reviews!?!  Guess I'll keep it short and sweet.  

Have friends flying into town on Friday night who want to go out and need to eat but after getting in from SFO and making themselves pretty its almost 10?  Ozumo is my go to spot to get everyone fed, feeling frisky and ready to rage despite the jet lag.

Upscale sushi place with full bar and extensive sake list.  More of a lounge type vibe than a restaurant.  Upfront is the bar where its a lil' louder and good for a party of two.  In the back its a perfectly good spot for friends coming into town where you can grab a table, actually hear each other speak,  eat, drink  and be merry.  They serve food until at least 11 on fridays and the sake bar is open even later(Careful with the sake  those nights can lead to war between Japan and Colombia(inside joke)).    Sushi is high grade and you do pay for it but thats what you come to Ozumo for.
author: Eric V.

description: was here with a huge group from work. THe food was excellent as was the service
author: charlene s.

description:
I appreciate makimono that can delight without resorting to excessive tempura and goo, but the Sekiwake and Saishoku Maki rolls I got for lunch today were bland and blander. They wouldn't be worth the price even if they were twice as large, which they should have been. Between my two visits to Ozumo I've tried nearly all of their specialty rolls, and nothing stood out. Not terrible, but not noteworthy- expensive mediocrity.

An establishment could compensate with atmosphere, but Ozumo's back room is really noisy. The front room looks more inviting, but I've never been seated there.
author: Barry E.

description: Fantastic sushi, if you go for the more expensive stuff.  The prices seem a bit exaggerated for SF, but is still hands down one of the best sushi experiences in the city.
author: Allan G.

description: If money was no object I'd eat here for lunch everyday. But that may speak to my love of Japanese food and the meager selections around the fidi more than it does about the quality of this particular restaurant. I've only had their happy hour items before which were all pretty good. I'd imagine their regular menu items and sushi items would be good. Someday.
author: Juliette W.

description:
Okay, so here's the deal...I love the designer ambiance, don't really care for the designer prices.  This is a great place to take business clients.  They have a "private" room in the middle of the restaurant, which is kind of cool (must take off your shoes there).  They totally designed a pre-fixe menu for my team and the customer service was really good.  The sushi and like 10 course meal was fresh and the dessert (CHOCOLATE FONDUE) was a winner with my team members.  Yet, the price... I am glad that I didn't have to pay the bill.  

The bar area is a nice place to mingle and it seems to be a "happening" spot for after work happy hour (I was there on a weekday - Tues night, I believe).  

I have seen social networking deals on-line for Ozumo lately, so maybe, in this economy that's how some of us will (outside of company expense accts) would be able to afford the food now.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
I don't know what people are talking about. This place is amazing!

I ate here for the first time. I came in at 7:30pm and got seated right away. The atmosphere was great and had a great view of the Bay Bridge! The server named Charlie checked up on us often and gave us an overview of the menu and her recommendations and kept coming back to make sure we were doing okay. Very attentive and very helpful staff!

The food was to die for. We got the futago, which was kobe beef, spinach, eggplant, and cucumber. I don't even like eggplant and cucumber but it tasted amazing in this dish. The beef was so tender and delicious. We also got the Ozumo roll, and the tuna was so fresh and delicious, and we got the Tazuna (sp?) roll which was also really good. The salmon was really fresh tasting. Salmon nigiri was amazing, we had both the farm salmon and the sockeye and both were so fresh and melty and delicious. Freshest fish I've had at a sushi place. For dessert, we had the chocolate fondue which was amazing and it was a perfect way to end our meal.

Overall, I would definitely come back. It is pretty pricey so I'll probably only return during special occasions. Amazing food, great service, nice atmosphere.
author: Alissa T.

description:
If everything on the menu was marked down about $5 - $10, I would give Ozumo more stars. Don't get me wrong, I don't mind paying more for food, but quality has to always match the price. The food is good here, but not worth the prices you're paying. But I guess this is on the Embarcadero in the SOMA, so what do you expect? 

Last night my boyfriend and I ended up at Ozumo. We tried going to Izakaya Sozai (I know, totally in a different area) but after finding out that their wait was at least an hour and half, we said screw it.. And drove back home and walked out to the Embarcadero. We decided on Ozumo since we were still in the mood for Japanese. 

The one great thing about this restaurant is the decor. When we were first waiting in the lounge for a table, I thought, "oh.. just another typical swanky/contemporary city spot." But once you walk in the restaurant, the vibe completely changes. The inside of the restaurant is reminiscent of a traditional Japanese restaurant, just modernized up (lots of light colored wood, the style of the furniture, etc). I also enjoyed the view of their Sake display - gorgeous display of Sake bottles and the inside of the display case is a private dining room! Hmms, I might want to come back in a group just to sit in that room, heh. When I went to the bathroom, I noticed they have sushi boat style seating in the back - another thing I thought was cool. This restaurant has versatile yet blending rooms.

Anyways, on to the food... For dinner, we had: 

- Dohyo: (Spicy Tuna Tatare w/chips) This dish was ok - our server suggested it as her favorite appetizer but I thought it tasted like every other Tuna Tartare I ever had. eh. 

- Tontoro: (braised Kurobuta pork jowels) absolutely delish - this was my favorite dish here along with the Gindara. The fat was yuhhhhhmy - definitely recommend this dish if you visit.

- Gindara: (Black cod) very good dish - the fat on the fish was so delicious, sauce was good, and cooked perfectly - definitely recommend ordering this dish alongside Tontoro.

- Shacho Roll: (Maine Lobster roll) this roll was creative and good, but I thought it was a bit overpriced - the roll wasn't all that amazing, just good.

- Spicy Tuna Nigiri: disappointing - rice was not fresh at all, and spicy tuna wasn't that tasty
 
- Big Eye Tuna Sashimi:  also disappointing - texture was kind of weird, was very gelatinous and okay tasting. i think it would have been better if they sliced it a little thinner. 

Overall, beautiful setting and some food options are great while others I would skip. From what we tried, I would definitely go with their cooked food options over their sushi - I rather go to a hole in the wall sushi joint that serves up fresh, great tasting sushi. Would I return? Yeah, maybe for the environment and the good food options - would be a nice place to take friends out for special occasions - just order the right dishes. Oh, lastly... I had their Shi-Mitsu drink - Shishito peppers w/ginger - delish! (also a bit overpriced, but nonetheless delish and creatively handcrafted)
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Price: 3.5 stars
Food: 5 stars
Service: 3.5 stars (see review below)
Atmosphere: 5 stars

Overall: 4 stars


Ozumo. One of my favorite upscale sushi restaurants in the city. The food is phenomenal, always fresh, and really shows a level of care and intricacy that often finds itself absent in restaurants. Although, for the price you're paying, you really shouldn't expect any less.

Dinner for a party of two (without drinks) will run you approximately $90~$120 there. This includes standard tax and gratuity, an appetizer split, and a dessert. Price can easily double/triple (or more) depending on what and how much you drink.

The ambiance is amazing, trending, and fun. Decor is up to date, cozy seating arrangements, but you won't be rubbing elbows, and the lighting is perfect for eating out with friends or in an intimate setting.

The only thing that I can really knock on this place is the service. It is hit or miss (often hits, but, for the price you're paying, it needs to always hit) but there has been more than 1 occasion where I'm waiting for my waiter for 5-10 minutes. There was one instance, where we're waiting for our check and the waiter was caught up with another large party nearby. No one came, we waited probably 15+ minutes. The table next to us (a party of 2, looks to be on a date) waited the same length to get their initial drink orders in.

I try to be fair in my reviews and rate an establishment based on the price I'm paying. Can't expect a fine dining experience when I'm paying for a Big Mac. On the flip side, when I'm spending hundreds (per person sometimes), I expect the very best -- don't charge that much if you can't deliver on all fronts.

Overall though, still a great place to take a date and have a meal. 4 stars.
author: D K.

description:
I'm more of a hole-in-the-wall sushi joint kinda girl. But. With that said, I really can't hate on Ozumo for the mere fact their service is superb for being so close to the Embarcadero and borderline tourist trap. Besides the extensive (and expensive) sushi selection, they serve a variety of sakes and your servers will know their sakes. Modern, upbeat, and a plus for me--right under the Harbour Court Hotel which is a great place to get the BEST view of the bay bridge and waters on a clear day.

My husband loves this place. We ordered two rolls, some garlic edamame (wow-so tasty and garlic-y), hamachi & maguro sashimi, and tasted three sakes before deciding on one that wasn't too dry with a tad sweetness. Everything was really good and I left stuffed and satisfied. Like I said this place is a little too mod for my style, but convenience played a big roll and I can't say the service was bad either.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
Yes, this place is uber pricey but their sushi is creative and it is such a modern & cool dining spot. Easy to find location and large space makes it perfect for visitors and groups!

*Minus one star for $$$ house sake!
author: Michelle D.

description:
Amazing Tokyo-style Japanese cuisine.  Funky, beat-based music, busy floor space, and amazing food and drink.

In the past, I've been here about 5times - had the chef's-choise omakase twice, and otherwise selected from the menu.

Not cheap:  normally something like $140/pp, inclusive of tip and drinks (and food, duh).  But really excellent food.

The most recent time I sat at the bar on the main floor and just enjoyed being part of the energy of the space.  I had a cold sapporo which I love with my sushi, and also decided to try some cold sake.  After talking with the bar-tender, we agreed I wouldn't do a "tasting menu" but would taste a couple he presented and give some feedback on what I liked.  Eventually, I had some that was smooth, enjoyable and quite dry; not sure of their name, but I think the style was Gaiginyo (polished rice style?).

For food, I selected a tempure blue-crab (I've been craving soft-shelled crab, from East coast ...) which was nice, but I thought the batter was too think in some spaces.

Then, I had a spider-roll, which was excellent.  Great wasabi/horseradish, and beautiful power ginger. Yes, I love to blow my mind with a lump of wasabi, ginger dipped in soy sauce - however, in my defense, this is un-related to my enjoying the sushi, which I eat separately.

I also had some toro, and great rice.  Very smooth flavor.

Finally, had a pork-jowel, which was rich and amazing.

That's it.  This time, something like $125 for my meal.  The sake that I chose was actually cheap, something like $12 for a small (300ml) drink.
author: Liam R.

description:
Great food and recommendations, a bit pricey though.

I came back and the waiter recommended the Hanabi and became one of my favorite dishes.
author: Guillermo M.

description:
Ozumo was recommended by friends and the concierge at the Mandarin Oriental.  The night we went, the air conditioning was not working well, so we had to leave as my husband couldn't take it, and there were no other seats available.  The following night we tried again.  A/C was fixed, the manager and the staff recognized us and proceeded to treat us like royalty!   The food was great,  yes, one might consider it pricey, but the portions were NOT small.  Compared to a comparable sushi place in Newport Beach, Orange County, this was par for the course.  

Food was great!  Lively scene, and you've got to try the chocolate fondue dessert!  

We'll be back, because we don't mind paying for good food, great service, and great ambiance!
author: Jacqui M.

description:
Returned for dinner on Sunday with a large party. Our guests are foodies and from Asia and know good Japanese food. 

Overall we were impressed with the cooked foods -- the presentation was exquisite, and portions were appropriate, and the taste was excellent. We especially loved the pork dishes -- the Buta Bara and Tontoro just melted in our mouths, so good!

The cocktails drinks were exquisite, and we were impressed by the selection sake wines. In fact we seated in the Sake Room, which was a cool semi-private glass-walled room surrounded by sake bottles. 

The reason why I am giving it four stars is because the sushi slight fell short of our expectations. We order an assorted sashimi dish to sample. The hamachi, uni, ebi were excellent, but the ultimate test was toro. We really expected at $10 for a piece of toro it should be out of this world. I have had the toro in my life -- it should be fresh with the right amount of fat and smooth and buttery in texture. The toro dish we had was disappointing, and in fact we had to send it back and asked for a better cut. We wouldn't mind paying for the ones we already ate. The waiter came back and told us that what we had was already the best cut of the night, and the restaurant tends to cater to the palette of Americans, who prefers leaner cuts of toro. Hmmm. That is just too bad, because most people don't really know they are missing.

Oh and excellent service too. Our was waiter very attentive and helpful.

The finally bill was right at the minimum charge for that room. We were glad that we were right on the mark ($100 per person with tip and tax), and 8 of us completely stuffed ourselves.

All in all, we were happy with the meal, and I will definitely return for special occasions, but really for the price the sushi does not live up to my expectations. But I am now addicted to their pork small plates and the miso black cod dish.
author: L S.

description: Food was great and great ambience. On the expensive side though plus service and dj was bad!!!
author: Shwetz M.

description: The server was nice, but the sushi and sake were very overpriced, they did not have cream cheese, and the spider roll was dry and lacking flavor. This was supposed to be a "hot spot" for sushi. But I give it a 2 thumbs down.
author: Nicki P.

description: Great relaxing atmosphere, and amazing sushi.  It's nice for a fancy dinner or a lunchtime bento box.
author: Niniane W.

description: I chose Ozumo with some trepidation as some of the reviews are less than flattering, especially with regard to service.  I have to say that I really enjoyed my experience there.  The cocktails were well crafted, the food was quite tasty, and the servers were actually quite attentive, knowledgeable and helpful.  Sure it's pricey, but decor and location make it quite worthwhile in my opinion.  I highly recommend Ozumo.
author: David T.

description: To start, the servers should be instructed to NOT point out something on the menu and say "This is my favorite"  Who cares what a server's favorite is except the server who is trying to sell a high priced item.  Our server did this and for every course we ordered, he tried to sell something else on the menu. I guess, to run up a tab to increase his tip.   The Maguro was not top notch --kind of tough versus melting in mouth. And, the octopus was dry and without any flavor.
author: Joseph N.

description:
Amazing, AMAZING food! My partner and I loved every dish we had. Sure the portions aren't large but in my opinion, portions in this country are way too big and we need more restaurants serving less but with higher quality like Ozumo. 

We also had wonderful service. We'll be back!
author: Sean H.

description:
Been exploring the SF culinary scene and ended up at Ozumo.  Its a great place, but not mind-blowing.  I thought as if I was sitting in a Nobu restaurant. So if you've been there, you now know what this place is like.  The food is great, not spectacular and overpriced. Great menu with lots of options including an outstanding Sake list.  

Waitstaff was OK.

Seems like a nose in the air kind of place.

The fish was fresh but they sure do skimp on the servings.  The nigiri is super thin. not impressed.  Rolls were unimpressive.

If you do go, get the Hanabi. Best item on the menu, I could eat that plate all night.

Glad I went, however, I won't return.
author: Matt T.

description:
I hosted a small work lunch at Ozumo to welcome a new employee . We were waited on by Eric. I was underwhelmed with the service as he did not take care to refill our empty water glasses, ask how our food was, or if we needed anything else. The real issue was that my ramen never came to the table. 

After everyone was finished, Eric stopped by to tell me that my ramen was delivered to the wrong table and that the second order he placed should be right out. Since everyone had finished, I asked that he package it to go.

He delivered the bill and charged me full price for the order that never arrived for my company lunch.

When I got back to work and dug into the food that should have been consumed at lunchtime, I found the broth to be ok (have had better and worse) and the meat was super fatty and gamey. Unimpressed for $16 soup.

Needless to say, with other options in the area, I will not be going back to Ozumo.
author: Kevin K.

description:
First of all, the sake list was the biggest that I have ever seen. They offer flights with informative descriptions. Nice idea!
The sushi was amazing. The chef does some incredible things with layers of flavor.  The variety of creative flavor combinations reminds me of Nobu.
The view of the bay was incredible. The decor is nice. The service was excellent. Our server, Barbara, was very helpful in our decision making.
author: Deanna B.

description:
Last week was my second lunch at Ozumo in San Francisco.  The ambiance is perfect for a business lunch.  We arrived at 11:30AM, and were out by 12:20PM - impressive!!

My guest and I ordered the Sekiwake roll, the Bucho roll, the Ozumo roll, the Hanabi, and a little sashimi.   On each visit, the sushi and sashimi has been very fresh, with delicate and pure flavors.  I have yet to taste a poorly conceived or executed dish at Ozumo.  The servers have been attentive, but not annoyingly so.  

Beware, this is a hot spot for lunch!  It gets extremely busy after 12PM.  

Also, be advised that Ozumo is a little on the pricey side for lunch.  I spent $80+ for two, and we didn't drink alcohol.  That being said, good sushi & sashimi is worth the price.  I'll definitely be back to Ozumo.  

4-1/2 Star food minus 1/2 point for $$$ = FOUR Stars.
author: Jeffery G.

description: My girlfriend always makes it a must stop when I am in town. The fish is fresh and melts like butter in your mouth. I have sampled almost all the rolls and have not been disappointed. This restaurant also has a nice selection of old world wines. For this lunch date we choose the Sancerre and we were not disappointed with the fabulous pairing to our rolls.
author: Sandra S.

description:
So, Ozumo is a bit of a scene and so, Ozumo can get loud. The question is: Is Ozumo a great place for sushi? The answer is a resounding "yes."

First, there aren't many great places SOMA to get good sushi for lunch--especially around the Embarcadero. Second, these guys are always coming up with inventive rolls, which is something they really don't have to do, since the quality of the sushi is so high that they don't really need gimmicks.

The sake list here isn't massively deep, but it's solid. They've got your Wakatake along with a good mixture of nicely and slightly-overpriced bottles.

It's tough to say what I like best--they always have great uni which isn't something I expect at most places. Their maguro and toro are also always aces.
author: Paul C.

description:
The interior has a warm and sunny feel to it during the day, and I'm predicting toasty intimate feel at night. The inside is big and separated into different sections. Depending on where you sit you have a perfect view of Embarcadero and the Bay Bridge.

I ordered the Ozumo roll, which in itself had sort of plain ingredients, but tasted fresh and delicious. Also came with a spicy  mayo sauce, delicious. The ramen my friend's ordered also was good. Another plus is that it came fast! Within 10 minutes during peak lunch hour.

Great place to come for lunch, dinner, or date!
author: Adele Z.

description:
very nice ambiance. I called before and made reservations and we were sat on time.

The quality of the fish was great..I could actually taste the freshness. I ordered the spicy tuna (simple but good) and tried a few of the more fancy roles and they were great too.

Service was nice, the manager took the time to thank everyone for coming so that was a pleasant touch.
author: Yas G.

description: Service was excellent. Food was also very good. Wide selection of sushi, lively without a lot of attitude.  Pricey but good.
author: Jafer P.

description:
A few days later my friend Raj stopped me and remarked, "That was the BEST sushi and sashimi I ever had.  I've been to "Nobu's," I've been to (etc.) and THAT WAS THE BEST SUSHI/SASHIMI I'VE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE."  Raj has a pretty illustrious background so he ought to know.  Then again, I am Japanese American from Hawaii and I ought to know and I do know and I concur that pretty much whatever Ozumo's serves, it's going to be stellar.  

Head Chef Mike worked the "Tabemasho" food event at the JCCCNC a few weeks previously and I had the opportunity to watch him work up close (Miyazaki Wagyu Beef ... no finer beef in the world).  I noted his meticulous preparations and insistence that every bit that was going to be served was prepared perfectly, spiced perfectly and this was for a massive non-profit fund raising event with 3 other celebrity chefs.  

After an Uncle Mikey/Rat Pack sashay over at "Americana" I suggested we saunter over to Ozumo's since the festivities appeared to be in a lull at Americana.  It was packed so our group situated at an outside table for drinks whilst awaiting a table inside.  The MatreD was extremely courteous and Uncle Mikey and Colo went back to Americana because UM left his credit card there.  At our table they noted that the drinks they were having outside were not delivered to the table but our waiter graciously replaced them with fresh ones "on me."  

We ordered indiscriminately.  Our waiter made some scrumptious suggestions which we went with, adding some rolls, sashimi, the black cod which is de rigeur, more drinks, it was a Kettle One and Soda night for me ... EVERYTHING WAS EXCELLENT.  You can't go wrong at OZUMO.

A couple of platters of various nicely ripened fruit slices were delivered to our table with a elegant, clever lit device that kept the chocolate fondue dipping sauce at the perfect temperature for our salacious fruit chocolate fondue dipping ~ the perfect capper to another UM Gonzo Adventure.

It's just like Japan.  EVERYONE is really serious about doing the best they can do with the best ingredients that they can find on the market.
Okay it's pricey but as mostly always:  You get what you pay for.  

5 stars Terry says.
author: Terry A.

description: Very good sushi and nice sides. Best to go for the sashimi/rolls rather than the hot entrees. Service was fantastic.
author: Sunny G.

description:
"Ishimasay!" 

I heard that frickin word ALL night! We sat by the open kitchen. Every time new patrons walked in,  the entire kitchen staff  would greet them with "Ishimasay!" Two more guys in unison "Eee-Shi-Ma-Saay!"  It went on ALL night!  I mean, if you're trying to say "Irashaimase," pretty please say it right. Better yet, spend some time in the frickin' bathroom and learn Japanese!  I'm not kidding. Go to their bathroom. You can learn some Nihongo up in there!  (I'm not Japanese but my bf and his mom are. And I'm sure they were just as annoyed as I was. Next time, we'll sit somewhere AWAY from the kitchen.) 

This place is expensive. I guess you're paying for the trendy atmosphere and the view of the bay??  Can you believe their California roll is $9?! I couldn't either. Their portions are also very small. I was expecting their small dishes to blow my mind away (like Kappou Gomi) but it didn't. And where are all the Asian folks at?!  

They had a sushi omakase dinner for around $45-$50. I wanted to order it but I wasn't sure how many pieces it would come with. I was afraid I would only get 5-8 pieces.  They also had a 6 or 7 course omakase dinner for around $125. Maybe next time. 

I ordered a hamachi kama salad http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PNxwbgtfdpldd3CyJFIw3w?select=7K5rjEHjrIt-Vs-6lLY67g  (it was one of  their specials), a spider roll ($13), and Maku-uchi roll ($13). I also got to sample my boyfriend and his mom's dish. Their sushi wasn't all that. Ive definitely had better. My hamachi kama salad was really small.  It was good but I wish they hooked me up with a bigger portion. The maku-uchi roll was pretty interesting. It was actually a negi-hama roll with jalapeno and some other stuff. It was accompanied with a tasty dipping sauce. We also ordered some nigiri and some other rolls.

3.5 stars rounded up. If you want to impress someone on a date, take them here. Don't forget to buy a gift card from Costco. http://www.yelp.com/biz/costco-wholesale-warehouse-san-francisco#hrid:HwNV2kGajwSjjDvfh3iSSw They actually sell a $100 gift card for $80. Just sayin.  Wish I knew about that gift card BEFORE we came here.
author: B B.

description: It's hard not to love any restaurant with a great view of the gorgeous bay bridge! This is a trendy sushi restaurant with wonderful service and great quality fish. A bit overpriced, but definitely worth it
author: Victoria W.

description:
Went here for my Dad's birthday dinner, and we were all quite satisfied after our meal. What really made Ozumo wonderful was  the attention they paid to each dish, in which the garnishes work well to make the dishes attractive and to add unique texture and flavor. I was particularly taken by the tuna tartare with avocado and caviar, which played with your palate in a way that I've never quite experienced in Asian style cuisine. The tempura crostini really did it for me, because I was tasting three different textures simultaneously with three different flavors. 

The Futaro (Wagyu, eggplant, cucumber, and sprouts) was also wonderful. Again the textures are playfully put together, and it's extremely attractive on the plate like a roll would look. 

The actual roll that we had was the Shacho (Lobster, mango, jalapeno, caviar, rice paper) The fruit was really unexpected, and the lobster was the freshest I've had in sushi for a long while. The jalapeno is the fusion element, and I think it again excites the palate.

A fine example of their plating was the mixed tempura assortment, in which they fanned out somen and fried it to use as a centerpiece. Great use of the ingredient and great way to make tempura presentable.

However, I really think it was overpriced. There was an extremely large party sitting to our left, which killed any sort of ambiance. The servers seemed to be a little distracted, and I think they could have been more cordial and warm. I like the separation of bar and dining area, as to make the dining experience a little quieter and intimate.
author: Travis L.

description:
Visited Ozumo with a group to get food and drinks.

Managed to get a table despite a party booking most of the area.

Wasn't too familiar with their sake so I tried their Black Dragon sampler, which basically consistent of 3 different sakes. The sakes were delicious that I ended up just ordering the Black Dragon sake by the cup after. 

Also had their famous cod, delicious. Scallops, good not great. Rolls were good. Tako and spicy tuna tartare was delicious.

Totally enjoyed the food and drinks, and had a good time. However, this place is definitely on the pricier side so you kinda expect this level of food and drinks.
author: John N.

description:
I went here yesterday for lunch with some coworkers. I have been to the Oakland location many times and love it - and the vibe of the place.  This location is nice as well and offers more space.  
Ozumo is great for both the cooked food as well as for the sushi.
We started with the ahi tuna appetizer which was nice as well as the garlic edamame (can't go wrong with these warm yummy treats).
I am a huge fan of kale in all forms and tried the kale salad which I was not a fan of unfortunately. It looked beautiful but I think it may have been the dressing as it was too salty for me and make it loose it's "fresh/clean" flavor that I love so much. The beats on the side of the salad plate were good; NOTE: both of my coworkers did infact enjoy the kale sald.
We then did a few different rolls - all were good but my favorite by far was Shacho - This was very fresh and had a great flavor with the cilantro. Very different role (not your typical) and all enjoyed.
We also had Bucho and Sekiwake - Both were very good as well.
Very fresh fish and great experience with the food overall.
We even slurged and got dessert (something we rarely do) and shared a couple.  The rice pudding was very good.  The sauce they serve on the side is fantastic mixed in.  
Overall, the service was fantastic.  Very attentive server and she wasn't too over bearing as we were sitting and conducting business there for quite a while while eating slowly and enjoying the experience.  It was just right and a wonderful atmosphere overall.
I will definately come back for lunch and probably dinner as well.  
As mentoned, I love the Oakland location and I was certainly not let down with the SF location - I will come back in the evening to experience the fun of the evening experience soon :)
author: Kelly M.

description:
Went to Ozumo with my family when they were visiting SF to try out some west coast sushi. We went to Ozumo because it was a holiday at 5:30 pm (had to catch a plane) and it was one of the only places in the area open.

The good:
- food: really high quality sushi. everything was tasty, from the sauces to the fish itself

The not-so-good:
- service: the waiter was overwhelmed (that's the excuse I'm using. I mean, it was 5:30 pm and we were the first group seated, but yeah). We ordered all at once and half the sushi orders hadn't arrived after 90 minutes. After inquiring about the wait, we were told that it "all came out at different times, there are tons of sushi chefs." 30 minutes later, we asked again, and were shown a confused face and no explanation. 5 minutes more and the forgotten sushi appeared. So, after about 2 hours of ordering and no apology or admission of guilt, we were able to enjoy a few more pieces of sushi. In addition, the wrong salad was brought to the table. No big deal, except the correct one wasn't delivered until 45 minutes later. 
- prices: way overpriced, but I can somewhat understand given the location on the water and overall atmosphere of the restuarant.

All in all, it was disappointing enough service not to return, especially considering the lack of apology (or any compensation in any way, though a simple sorry would have been better than nothing). That being said, the sushi is good, so it's too bad the experience was such a negative one overall.
author: Nicole H.

description: Hopped in here after checking out the place next door. I had two types of nigiri Hamachi and Mackarel. I also had a beer and they gave us a complimentary cup of sake. The food was good.
author: Gabriel B.

description: Wow, wow, and wow!  This place has the best sushi I've ever had.  I lived in Osaka for a couple of years, so yes, I am a sushi snob.  I've never had sushi this good before in my life; inside or outside of Japan.  The toro just melts in your mouth like butter.  The uni was smaller and more orange that what I've ever since.  It was more delicate and fresher tasting than the usual stuff.  Yes, it's expensive, but outstanding sushi always is.  If you don't mind paying top dollar for great sushi this place will not disappoint.  The people that are giving average ratings for this place did not order the right stuff.  You don't go here for tempura or udon.  This is all about the fresh sushi.
author: Rene H.

description:
Decor is cool and space is large, reminds me of New York.  You have a number of areas to choose to sit: bar, communal table, private table in front, private table in back, sushi bar in back...Fish is fresh and buttery, but prices are high.  I just moved to the area so I can understand why, everything is pricey here.  But at least you get quality.  The shima aji nigiri "melts in your mouth", but for $12 for 2 pieces, I hoped they were at least large pieces..but no they were tiny.

They have a large selection of fine sakes too.  Wish they had a couple less expensive sakes, I like good sake, but the cheapest glass was like $9 a glass, and they aren't large glasses (really good tho).

The girl who served me was really cute too, always a plus +++

If money grew on my house plants, I would come here all the time, but it doesn't, so I'll be limited though it will be tempting so near by.

***I have to add something, when I went to the bathroom I couldn't help but bust into laughter. At first I was confused, I was hearing a Japanese voice in my head while I was peeing? But then I realized they had speakers in the bathroom and it was playing a translation/teaching type cd for learning Japanese. Pretty cool one I might add, no rosetta stone shit, this had some thievery corporation acid jazz type shit smoothly in the background.

but that wasnt what was funny, it was the translations. it started off something like this

"Hi, do you speak english?" 

"...(Japanese translation)"

Ok simple and innocent enough, next

"What is your occupation?"

"...(Japanese translation)"

whoa gettin kinda forward there

"Married?"

"...(Japanese translation)"

uh..loll wot

at that point i started laughing and started existing the bathroom but i coulda sworn the next translation was something about a hotel, so yea def not rosetta stone, I guess this was more like the "Learn 2 Pick up Japanese Chics on your Business Trip in 15 min" cd

thing is, i could only imagine what they translate in the woman's bathroom.


*I'd like to add in response to the comment. Thank you I did have a good experience. In reference to the prices, I definitely understand the high/variable price of shima aji from Japan. However what bothered me was more towards regular fish on the menu, for example sake nigiri being IIRC $8 for 2 pieces. At even some of the best sushi establishments they do not charge more than $6 for great sake nigiri. I understand this may be a price inflation as a result of the nice ambiance that Ozumo offers, but still it just doesn't feel right and I end up ordering less.
author: Belito L.

description: Went here for my gfs anniversary , it was fancy and nice. , foods are really good! The price might be high and portion r small but the qualify is premium !
author: Tsz Chung W.

description: While everything we had there was GOOD, it was pricey! Decor and location seems to be a big part of the bill. The best things we ate were actually beef dishes, but the portions are sushi tiny. A good place to bring clients dining on expense accounts. Don't think I would go back on my own.
author: John H.

description: Sushi was mediocre, dry. Portions stingy. A4 wagyu was fine. Better by far to go to Roka Akor.
author: H S.

description:
An upscale Japanese restaurant, nicely located along the Embarcadero. I like it's possible to have a more formal dinner at a table, or just hang out by the Sushi bar, on the back of the venue.
Food is in general really good, and their sake selection is impressive. I was satisfied both by their sashimi and their more sophisticated entrees. It's a little bit pricey, so keep that in mind.
author: Steve E.

description: Very tasty and fresh fish and great fondue.   The sake menu is wonderful and extensive but is pricey.  Very trendy and the back room has a beautiful view of the bridge.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
I had to give Ozumo 5 stars because we ordered the Chefs Osusume Course.  Absolutely amazing and I experienced new sushi I would never have tried.  Each course was impeccably prepared and was absolutely delicious.  

I will be returning to try other items on the menu.
author: Chris J.

description: We went for happy hour so our experience might not be the most representative. On friday from 4 to 6:30 they have 5$ drinks and good deals on food. Drinks were good, but tue food was all meh. Nothing was good, nothing was horrible. Blind folded i would of said that i was in a small take out or grocery store sushi spot. But i cannot be too picky on a 5-10$ roll. I will not be going back, too many better restaurants in san fran to chose from..
author: Philippe P.

description:
Ozumo's is a trendy Japanese restaurant that specializes in Sushi. Situated near the Embarcadero, we had a table that gave a slight glimpse of the Bay Bridge.

We ordered a few small items that got us pretty full fast:

Ikakoromo:  AKA fried calamari. Probably the best I've ever had. No scent or taste of fish. Better yet, the texture isn't like the usual rubbery crap you get at other restaurants. 

Dohyo:  Think of it as a Japanese chip and dip plate where the chips are Gyoza chips and the dip is a Tuna Sashimi tartare. This dish gives you a good idea of how fresh the fish is. The tartare sits on avocado cream and tofu. The taste is wonderful when all 3 ingredients are eaten together with the chips.

Kani Croquettes: Pretty much your standard fried crab cakes. You get a lot of crab and less filling which is what you should expect for its price. Nothing out of the ordinary, but still good.

If you are looking for a trendy Sushi place near the water, this is it. Good food, good atmosphere. But be ready to pay above average prices for the food. The miso soup I got was $5! Not a distinct difference in taste between that and a $1.50 soup. Shrug.
author: Sunny D.

description: restaurant was great! only reason they didn't get 5 stars is because it took too long to bring saki each time we ordered and it was a large group, but food was phenomenal, best sushi/environment in SF
author: David G.

description: Started with bottle of wine and edamame and had a few sashimi plates and sushi rolls to share. Good service and good food...
author: Gulya M.

description: Very nice place,  the fish is quite good,  the staff is helpful and the sake list is more than correct.  Good restaurant for a colleague dinner
author: Frédéric A.

description:
The sushi is very very good.  Not world class, but very good.

Atmosphere in the front room is great - dark wood, candles, benches.  The back room is too cavernous for me.

I highly recommend trying the sushi tasting.  Rare chance to learn a bit about this Japanese rice liquor.
author: Gregory Y.

description:
Mixed feelings about this place:

I've been here twice. The first time was awesome, each plate was better than the previous one. The second visit was kind of disappointing, as the service was poor. Hopefully they were just having a bad night.
author: Sebastien P.

description:
The spicy tuna tartare appetizer alone is worth the trip.

This place is fantastic.  We've now found our home for sushi in San Francisco.

Really great cocktails, wines, and saki selections.

Love that the place is really large and takes reservations.

Easy to get to, just a few blocks from the Muni near the Ferry Building.

Desserts were a disappointment.

We expect to visit this restaurant often.
author: David L.

description: I came here for the first time last week and it was quite enjoyable. The uni risotto dish was so good along with the salmon and hamachi belly. The veggie tempura dish was good. I was quite impressed by their extensive sake selectin. Their rice pudding dessert is on point!
author: Carguy S.

description:
If you value ambiance over great food, then this is a great place, especially for dates you'd want to impress or anniversaries you want to celebrate.

I dined here for a friend's birthday party - our server was lovely, and we had a private, sectioned-off area to ourselves. The whole environment was breathtaking, but the food was just okay and definitely did not warrant the price.  The lunch menu wasn't that cheap either. Considering that the food was mediocre, I don't find many justifications of going back again and again.
author: Nancy L.

description:
Came here with some coworkers for a sushi lunch on the company's dime. If you have that option, this place is great! We told the waiter to just bring us various kinds of sushi/sashimi/rolls until we hit X dollars. It was fun to be surprised with repeatedly delicious options. 

That said, X dollars was probably far more than I would pay out of pocket which is why this place only gets four stars. But if someone else is paying, highly recommended!
author: Dave L.

description: What's great is the ambiance, the service and the food...what is just okay are the portions and the prices.  I don't mind spending a pretty penny on good food, and most of the items are not minuscule, but there are a few that amount to barely more than two bites of food, and there is no warning on the menu. The patron is then left to order something to supplement it, while everyone else at the table is eating their well-portioned meal. However, that is my only "gripe". Great place for lunch!
author: Rachel H.

description: Been going here for years when I lived nearby. Had not been awhile so I decided it was time to try again. The sushi quality has gone down significantly. It seems like there was a clear cost cutting effort made in the last couple of years since I last went. Sushi is not fresh and not worthy of the high price. I give 3 stars because the sake selection and ambiance haven't changed, still good. This place used to be special. Now its just another overpriced, mediocre sushi spot. Man, this place used to be really good.
author: Elmer P.

description:
I was here the other night with a group of 10 & don't think I will be going back.

First off, they left the front door open which you could smell the sewer if the wind blew the right way.
