Our waitress came to the table and took 3 drink orders, then disappeared for 20 minutes -- came back, without their drinks, & took the rest of our orders.  It took 45 minutes for us to get our drinks as a table.

Then we ordered a few of everything for the table to share -- they would bring 1 dish out, with 4 pieces of fish on it for a table of 10, then 20 minutes later bring out another dish - we all sat there not wanting to eat since the whole table couldn't.  This would have gone on if someone didn't get up and say something to our waitress.

After we ate, the bus boy and waitress kept knocking into me while trying to clear the table.
author: Kyla G.

description:
I'm reallllly mixed on this place. 

Atmosphere - Cool and trendy looking sushi restaurant. DJ was spinning in the bar and it looked like a great happy hour spot. Great spot for a date or hanging with friends. The tables were set apart from the bar for a more formal and relaxed experience. 

Service - This was a little disappointing. Our happy hour servers were very good and funny even though I confused one a little when I made a joke about a sharpie: It's a marker, not a knife... awkward. ANYWAY - Our dinner server was cordial and knew the menu very well and gave us great advice but he was completely cold, dry and impersonable. It was genuinely odd. 

Food - When we came in the hostess told me one of her fiends had been to Nobu and preferred this place. Well.... I've been to Nobu in Vegas and NY as well as his original Matsuhisa many times and sadly, this wasn't at the same standard. That being said, it WAS very good. Their black cod fell apart in flaky awesomeness, their tuna tartar was good but the tuna was so cold that it felt like it might have not been completely thawed. The age dofu was good and most of the sushi was good as well. Overall it was a good but not great food experience. I'm not in SF that often but as much as I love sushi I'll probably try another place next time as the city is known for that cuisine.
author: Alon B.

description:
Another one of those happy hour gems worth checking out. Ozumo is an upscale Japanese resto-bar with great food and awesome cocktails. During happy hour, which is between 4pm and 6pm, draft Sapporo is $3 and appetizers are pretty cheap as well. I got the spicy tuna roll for $5, Kushiyaki (skewered meat) for $4 (the sausage and beef skewers are fantastic). The Karaage (Japanese style fried chicken) was awesome. Spicy calamari was superb. (ok, I'm running out of adjectives). You get the picture. Great Japanese eats. Good happy hour prices. Nice atmosphere, great vibe. It would be a crime for you not to come here after work.

4.0 stars.
author: Angelo B.

description: This place is legit.  Be prepared to drop some loot, but the food is definitely worth it.
author: Mike G.

description: Really tasty pork jowl, reasonable price for the dish I got (sushi seemed more expensive). Delicious!
author: Chris L.

description: Dila took such good care of us. The waygu beef was a once-in-a-lifetime experience. 5 stars. Tae was our waiter and he was incredibly helpful and kind. We will definitely be back!
author: Sarah S.

description: C/C-. Sushi was flavorless. It was also cut poorly and had veiny-ness. The service was equally lackluster. It's a place where the staff is more eager to talk shop with each other rather than their customers. The extremely expensive fatty tuna was exceptional, though, and actually totally worth the price.
author: David D.

description:
This place is nice but overpriced.  Sushi rolls are pretty small but very good.  This doesn't justify the prices though.  I only had sushi but some of their other dishes looked amazing.  

Also, my waitress decided to give herself a $100 tip right off my card.  Nice touch.  They will be hearing from my CC company.

Overall, I've had sushi that is just as good and a better bang for my buck.  I won't be back.
author: Joey V.

description: Very nice decor, but only so so sushi for the price and selection.  I just dined here this past weekend and had a mediocre dinner.  We tried to get a table for two last minute around 7:30ish, but was told their next available reservation was 9:30. So, we settled for the sushi bar.  When we got there and throughout our dinner, the place was filled with empty tables around us. Although we didn't mind sitting at the sushi bar, it was weird how they said they were fully booked over the phone. They do have a great sake selection, and you have the usual sushi, sashimi, and rolls. We ordered oysters too, they were okay. Nothing was spectacular.  Price came out to $200 for two with a small bottle of sake.  Not unreasonable, but there's definitely better places.
author: Lilian T.

description: Prices are pretty expensive but good experience. Always happening after work and great drink selection. Didn't try the sushi but cod was excellent. Smaller potions but great tastes. I would skip the choc fondue as I found it on the watery side but good presentation.
author: Wendy W.

description:
Ozumo is OK... probably not my first pick in the city.  Sushi is good but not exceptional. Some positives: Great view and wonderful waitress.
Here is the reason for 3 instead of 5 stars... 
Sat against the wall on a comfy bench type seat and was surprised to see it was torn and pretty worn out. This restaurant is pretty pricey so it didn't "match..."  
Food came out far too quickly - started piling up on the table. tempura, sushi, salad all scrunched together... wasn't into that...
The price was crazy high which I know can be a pitfall with sushi, but this seemed above and beyond for the quality.
author: Win S.

description: Visited late May 2013.  I was very surprised in both in quality of food and service. Also great place to see trendy and good looking people. The location in santa Monica, CA did not last long and closed a little over a year and i wasn't impressed.  So naturally I was not too keen on going to the one in SF.  Glad I did, it was fun, and will go again before too long.
author: Darius S.

description: My favorite sushi bar ever!!! I always tend to order the same thing. For an appetizer, I get the Hanabi with avocado - it is freshly sliced hamachi with the a ponzu sauce that adds a little kick. I then get the futago which a perfectly medium rate pice of beef over spinach and eggplant. Surprisingly simple for a dish with so much flavor. I always then order a round of sashimi. The sushi is so fresh here it has turned me into a purist. The Choco flourless cake with mochi and green tea ice cream then always finishes the meal.
author: Ashley A.

description:
Best upscale sushi spot in the city. Love the atmosphere at the sushi bar and super comfy chairs. The cuisine rivals nobu in their artsy presentation

I would suggest: 
Dohyo tuna tartare to start
Washy gyu with dipping salts
Shacho roll- lobster wrapped in tuna and soy paper
Sekiwake Roll
author: Samantha A.

description:
Not the best experience. The food is so-so, and with a high price tag, we needed to spend more than 70 dollars per person, before tax and tips, and it's not including any fresh fish sashimi yet. 
The service is also just Okay, but not matching the price tag of the food. 
The environment is on the modern side, nothing from the traditional japanese feel.
author: Zuck L.

description: I went here for my birthday dinner and it was awesome.  I love the atmosphere, it was  Monday night and it was still busy.  Our waiter was really nice and the food was good.  I will admit I had had a few drinks before I got my food so I can't go into too much detail-- I'm sure anything would have tasted good at that point.  However, everyone else seemed to like theirs and it looked good.  This is a great place to just have drinks too.  There are so many types of sake it was overwhelming.  I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Megan M.

description: The best sushi meal I have ever eaten - highly recommend the lobster roll with mango.
author: Tay A.

description:
Not sure if Ozumo really NEEDS another 5 star review, but they certainly deserve it. From start to finish, our team dinner in the Kontatsu room was absolutely perfect. The room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable.

Our server was friendly, attentive and very knowledgeable about the food and sake. Since we were a large group, I oped to do a family style dinner. We talked about price points, palates, potential food allergies (we have one who is allergic to shellfish) and he ran with it. 

We started with bowls of edamame, then had seaweed salad followed by the most gorgeous tempura I've ever seen - honestly, like works of art. After that we had some delicious sort of rolled up steak w/mushroom - yummy. Next we had giant plates of sashimi, rib eye, cod with miso and some very creative and tasty hand rolls.   
All the while our glasses were being refilled, more sake and beer was brought promptly, and we just felt cossetted and well taken care of the entire time. 

I can't wait to go back.
author: .Hon H.

description: My review is based on ramen and edamame only. My coworkers and I came here to satisfy our ramen craving. We started our meal with cold and hot orders of edamame. The hot edamame was tossed with a very generous amount of roasted garlic and super tasty. Cold edamame was sprinkled with salt. Everyone was very pleased with their bowls of ramen commenting on the flavorful broth and tender pork. One person ordered the Ozumo ramen which had grilled fish and was very pleased with the balance of the seafood and meat. We would all come back here for sure.
author: lenka l.

description:
I avoided this place for a while because it seemed over-hyped to me and I think I saw their sushi being sold at Costco once.  Nevertheless, I heard good things about it and a buddy of mine from Boston was visiting and I figured anywhere I took him in SF would be better than the sushi in Boston.  So I took him to Ozumo and I was pretty impressed.  We sat in the back and had a view of the Bay Bridge which made it a bromantic meal.  

They have awesome flights of sake, super fresh fish, nice presentation, and the people watching wasn't bad either.  The only downside was that my wallet wasn't very happy at the end of the night but she'll forgive me.
author: David Y.

description: My friends love this place and are frequent patrons here. I joined them for dinner over the weekend and unfortunately, I was just not impressed. We had a platter of sashimi, a couple of rolls and some Shabu. The fish is very fresh and the Shabu was tasty. But the food just does not justify the exorbitant cost. I don't mind paying a lot for good food but Ozumo is not worth the splurge. I can get the same quality for much cheaper at other Japanese places.
author: Chi N.

description:
I've been to Ozuma three times now. The first time was a couple of years ago and I was very impressed. Ozuma is a beautiful restaurant, with a great atmosphere. Definitely a place to go for special occasions. There's a view of the Bay Bridge, which looks very cool after dark. 

The sushi was extraordinary, and the service was excellent every time. Ozuma takes great care in presentation, which enhances the overall experience. They have a VERY extensive sake menu, and they always take the time to explain the sake to me and help me find a sake that matches my tastes. 

While the wait staff is pleasant, its always a bit uncomfortable talking to the host/hostess, especially if you do not have a reservation. The first time we went, we felt uncomfortable, as the hostess made us feel like we should had not have come without a reservation. However, we were seated quickly and the wait staff made us feel welcome. The second time we went, we had a reservation and the hostess still made us feel a bit uncomfortable, probably because they had just opened. The manager, however, was at the host station and asked us if we wouldn't mind sitting at the lounge for a few minutes while we waited to be seated, since they didn't have our table quite ready yet. The drinks were excellent, and we were seated within 5 minutes.

Overall, I highly recommend Ozuma if you want a fine dining sushi experience and love to try new sakes!
author: TJ D.

description: Ate there llast Thursday night. The best bottle of sake I've ever half in my life. At $120 it was also the most expensive... A-Rod was sitting two tables down... overall a very enjoyable experience... great food as well...
author: DJ T.

description:
Delicious, creative, beautiful sushi!  Our waiter, John, was awesome.  He spent lots of time explaining the numerous varieties of sake and correctly guessed which sakes my bf and I would enjoy.  He also guided us through the various specials and patiently (and expertly) answered our questions.  

We were seated near the sushi bar, but I wished we'd been seated closer to the bay view area (it wasn't that busy).  As for the prices, yes they were high, but heck, we were in a beautiful restaurant in a beautiful city.  Oh, and the chef sent us a few special items on the house, which we much appreciated.  I keep wavering between giving Ozumo 4 stars and 5 stars... Wish I could give them 4.50 but because John was so personable here goes 5.
author: Janet D.

description:
i just paid $20 for a bowl of miso ramen! if the ramen was properly cooked like ritsu's at izakaya sozai, it would have been worth it. but it wasn't.
these noodles were overcooked. 
if the soup was savory, tasty, yummy like izakaya sozai or suzu or santa or ramen club it would have been worth it. but it wasn't.  
if it had better trimmings other than the old dry shredded  white chicken meat and the packaged fish cake and plain hard boiled egg. 
the atmosphere and decor here is very sexy and comfortable but i just paid $20 for a BAD bowl of ramen. 
that does not compensate for my misfortune.
t-o-t-a-l 
r-i-p
o-f-f
DO NOT ORDER THE RAMEN HERE
author: Jeff W.

description: I have to say that this is one of the more disappointing restaurants in the city. Service was horrible and food wasn't impressive. The place looked decent but that was about it. I wouldn't dine here again unless someone really wanted to go and insisted that we dine there.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I was here for lunch a few days back. 
Enjoyed toro that melted in my mouth with bay bridge view.
The tofu cheese cake was very interesting & tasty as well.
author: Dragon F.

description: This place came highly recommended, but I didn't get it at all. The sushi was so-so, the service not so great. Definitely over priced.  Looked like they had a great selection of saki, but that appeared to be like the only draw. There has to be 100 better sushi restaurants in town.
author: Amy O.

description: I am in town for business, can came here for dinner.  As expected the food was really good, if not a bit over priced, but the service was terrible.  She was exceedingly friendly but I have never waited so long for every part of our meal.  A real shame as everything else was good.
author: Taylor C.

description: I'm definitely a fan of Ozumo. Situated right off the Embarcadero, this trendy dining spot has good sushi with great service, definitely a good date spot or pre-going out dinner location. We had reservations for the bar but got a table after we arrived within 3 minutes. The waitstaff was attentive without being intrusive, something I think is hard to find. M and I split the asparagus salad, the sashimi salad, veggie mix (nasu and shishito peppers), ozumo roll, and the rice pudding for dessert. The salads were both refreshing with a light citrus-y dressing and the fish was fresh. The veggies were served robata style (grilled), tasted nice, nothing too extraordinary there. The ozumo roll actually way impressed me. It didn't taste like your run of the mill over-sauced, over-flavored Americanized roll. It had delicious uni, tempura, and spicy salmon on top with avocado slices, lightly sauced. Good combo. Shared a bottle of delicious sake. Dessert was good, probably rate that a 3/5 because I love rice pudding. Overall, good service, great date night place where you can dress up and enjoy the experience.
author: Joyce H.

description: We came here without reservation on saturday--but the staff was nice enough to squeeze us in to sit on the bar area.  So, that was nice.  The restaurant ambient is very nice with romantic setting.  The drinks are awesome!  Now...here comes the food--super petite size!   The sushi rice, they are definitely too dry and the ribs were too satly.  For the price, you can at least serve good sushi.  So, all in all, the food is MEH, the drink is HORRAY, the ambient is COOL, and when the bill comes---guarantee you will get a heart attack!
author: Elyza S.

description: Best calamari I've ever had.  Period.  Amazing decor.  Great selection.  Accomplished sake varieties.  Great!!!
author: Shannon C.

description: There isn't anything negative I can say about this restaurant, I had a very enjoyable meal here!  The ambiance was very nice, the restaurant is very classy and at the same time, not too frou frou and can be very comfortable.  We ordered the miso black cod, tuna tartare, sushi, and sake.  I even thought their edamame was exceptionally good, which is a strange thing to say, I know!  The tuna tartare was very delicious, it comes well presented on a layer of chopped avocado and is seasoned with ponzu sauce.  The miso black cod was flaky, beautiful, and tender.  Lovely place, def go here!
author: Terry K.

description:
Ozumo is an interesting place. I haven't quite figured out how I feel about it in terms of the atmosphere but I can tell you that the food is out of this world.

First and foremost the bar is really great. I honestly would have preferred to eat in the bar than in the dining room. The atmosphere is so much more vibrant and relaxed. The restaurant is really big. I didn't realize how huge it was until we began our journey to the table. It's just so big with such high ceilings so it get's very loud. Maybe the atmosphere just wasn't for me, but the important part of this review is the food. 

One word: Toro. It melted in my mouth. Everything from the Hamachi to the Ankimo was dynamite bite after bite. I couldn't have asked for more. If you want really great sashimi and sake and are willing to pay for it definitely check out Ozumo.
author: Denise S.

description: Was on a business trip to San Fran . Asked @ the Clift whats the Sushi spot to go to and was refereed here . The atmosphere was lively not to serious and a good vibe . The food was great , the drinks were better . I had a few types of Sake . It was comparable to Koi in NY and LA . Overall a great night .
author: Gene M.

description:
This is a pretty cool place for Japanese food.   The bar is pretty awesome. They had a very extensive sake list and they poured a very strong and tasty cocktail.   
The food was good, but a little on the expensive side.   I'm not a big sushi eater, but the other items on the menu were quite nice.   
I really liked the atmosphere.   It was a nice and relaxing place that wasn't too noisy.   This would be a great place for a date night if you are looking to impress someone.   
Will I come back?   Maybe.
author: Bill C.

description:
This review gets 1 star for their extremely poor and slow service. We reserved their private room for 8 and we were all sadly disappointed. It was a night of celebration and we all wanted to drink and it took about 20-25 to just get a beer each time. When we asked what the hold up was the waiter said the bar was behind. Come on we all ordered Kirin & Stella by the bottle. 

It was annoying that we constantly had to ask our different servers to order more drinks and more food. Had our waiter been on it we would of ordered additional drinks and food. Considering our bill was $800 and a 20% tip was included it only would of benefited our waiter to be more attentive.
author: Stacy O.

description: Everything I ate was so delicious, drinks included! Tuna tartar and the sushi were amazing. The service was excellent and our server Molly was beautiful and so attentive! Definitely going back, great overall experience
author: Shelby K.

description:
I had a really great time at Ozumo!

I loved their appetizers.  Cod was awesome!  

Sushi?? Had better before. I would not order sushi there.  

The interior design is great.  I would love to return there for drinks and appetizers.
author: Julia G.

description: We came in lunch for my husband birthday and fortunately, the sat us close by the window. Since the dinner menu was off limit, the choices were limited. I wanted to try the braised short rib, instead, the lunch only offered pork rib. I did not liked it at all. Kim chee was not well marinated, the ribs are too salty, and not as soft or fall off the bone as it was a bit tough. The tempura fan was a really nice touch. However, the big shrimp itself, was not crispy, a bit soggy batter, even before dipping it in a sauce, which was a bit plain and flavorless sauce. The burger was good, nice burger bun and chips. I just wished the meat was thicker. We wanted medium for the meat but it came well done instead. The hamachi roll with jalapeño was clean, nice and simple. It was drizzled with a sauce which I think enhanced the flavor. The sushi chef looked Japanese and experience, unlike the Oakland location. The server was attentive and friendly, so great service. Price was high, but expected because of the ambiance and location.
author: Wendy T.

description: Chic ambiance, fresh sashimi, extensive sake selections.
author: Victoria Y.

description: My Ozumo experience on Friday, 7/11 was great!  My waiter Eric was attentive.  I overheard how he patiently responded thoroughly to many questions of a customer seated next to me and apologized for keeping me waiting when he finally was able to take my order.  I feel both my waiter Eric, the busboy and the hostess provided just the right amount of attention to me.  I heard the hostess, the barman behind the bar, and the waiters greeting the customers arriving and departing the restaurant welcoming them and thanking them for coming and wishing them a great/nice day with smiles and joy.  I love that!!  Keep that up please!
author: Gina W.

description:
[Review specifically on their happy hour]

Prior to last night, I've only been here once for happy hour. However, after last night's experience it's (super) safe to say that I will be returning!

My coworker and I needed a new spot to relax after work and since there's usually a smaller crowd right after 5pm, we decided to come here. As expected, a couple couches were taken but there was still plenty of room for more. We were seated immediately and the staff was very attentive, even throughout the evening when it became more packed. We ordered two plates of maki sushi (36 pieces; we were starving, apparently), two types of skewers and the okonomiyaki for food, with two drinks each. The drinks were delicious (I got the giddy geisha) and the sushi fresh. For the price, how much we've consumed and the quality of the food, I say this is one of the most "worth it" happy hour spots. The atmosphere is very relaxing, slow-pace and I don't have to haul ass right after work to get there for a seat.
author: Rosa C.

description:
Not your traditional Japanese/Sushi restaurant, if that's what you're expecting. Very upscale & quite a bit Americanized to target a diverse group of people. 

Food is very good but so expensive! Expect quality, not quantity. Everything is family style so expect to order a lot & pay a lot for the amount you order. Dishes are quite small. 

Came with 2 others & we ordered the lobster sushi special for $24 & it came with only 4 tiny sushi pieces. One of my favorites was the uni rissoto. Lots of flavor & decent sized portion, but of course not for the amount you're paying. 

Got the sake sampler for drinks. Drink menu is kind of confusing because I thought it was $11 for all 3 samplers, but it was $20 & $11/glass. 

I would come back again but only for a really special occassion. By the end of the night, I ended up paying $120 just for MY portion of the meal, and we didn't even order dessert.
author: Alysha K.

description:
"Kon'nichiwa."  

Ozumo's a fab restaurant in SOMA, that offers delicate Japanese cuisines housed under a sexy, cool vibe.  

I've been here twice, once for HH and this time for dinner.  And the dinner did not disappoint.  The rolls were light and scrumptious and very unique.  The pairing of certain sauces with fishes, made Ozumo's rolls more fusion-based and exiting to eat.

The service was wonderful, very attentive.  I had an amazing time...laughing, sharing and connecting.  

I love Friday night dinners!
author: Soo Jin K.

description:
Best sashimi I've eaten ever
Rolls were ok, nothing too special - still very good, but the sashimi is the highlight and they have it ALL
Also their risoto was a-m-a-z-i-n-g!

it is pricey,  so I won't go there constantly, but for a special occasion or a treat - great!

4 stars because of the price
author: I B.

description:
Came here with a very good friend from Socal. Funny thing about that night. I have discovered more about my friend this one night than any of our 10 year friendship.
He loves raw food more than I do! The chef kept making him really exotic stuff to eat and he eats them like an expert! And lets a out a moan a la "When Harry Met Sally" that it was so sexy and embarrassing at the same time. 
There is an amazing wall of Sake to the left of the bar. I had my usual saba sashimi while my friend devoured everything and anything that the chef made.The food is excellent. We stayed for 3 hours and the tab was $200+. Worth the whole R-Rated act. BTW dress up-its SF. That's what's cool about the city-people like to dress up!
author: Janet D.

description:
You might ask, "How can you possibly award two stars to an absolutely five star (no doubt about it) eating experience?" Simple, and two words: food service.

I ate here last month with a group and was mesmerized by the food and experience, and made reservations to bring my wife and two adult sons. We arrived yesterday and were promptly greeted and seated. 

Great wait service, great explanation of the food and selections, and a perfect pairing of sake. In all we ordered 2-3 starters, some sushi and then some main dishes (more about these later).

And then the food started arriving. And arriving. And arriving. Until I thought the were either going to bring a couple of double-decker serving dishes to the table or bring an extension leaf or just tell us to hurry the hell up so they could get the rest of the food onto our table so we could eat and then scram. We actually started eating faster so they could clear the serving plates. 

The waiter, albeit fine, did nothing to stop the onslaught, and I finally had to tell a server to stop bringing food to us. This for what turned out to be an over $400 dinner for 4.

Now, on to the food. In a word: spectacular. Five stars across the board. Some absolute culinary masterpieces: the filet, the bacon-wrapped string beans (imported from someone's imagination), the sushi and the warm chocolate fondue as one of the closers. Just knocked our socks off.

We walked out noting that except for the oddly horrible food service, the experience was terrific and everything we'd hoped it would be.

But for chrissakes, folks, slow the service down!
author: Motown D.

description:
We arrived with a group of 11 and they put us in a private room where the table was low in Japanese style, but we could sit on cushions and dangle our feet.  Even the table was amazing.  It was 4 inch thick rough hewn marble.

We had such a large group that we told the waiter to limit us to no more than $1000, but bring us stuff that is good.  We had the most amazing food that included a sushi roll with lobster, tuna, jalapeño and mango.  All told, we got full before we hit the budget.

This is a great place.  I'll go again the next time I go to San Francisco.
author: John M.

description:
One of the best placest I've eaten at in my life, hands down.
This place was D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S!!!!
I went with a large group of 8, and my friend had connections so we ended up getting our own private room that was closed off from the rest of the restaurant.
Since we were a large group, we decided to just make a bunch of orders and just pass everything around the table.

MUST-GET'S:
-Oysters
-Seaweed Salad
-Sashimi Platter
-Rib-eye
-Chocolate Fondue Fountain with Cake and Fruit for dessert

Everything was amazing. Every last piece of sashimi I tried, whether it was tuna, salmon, whatever it was, every bit of it just melted in my mouth.
The oysters... I don't even like shell fish that much, tried oysters before and thought they were gross, but these were out of this world!! I had 3 or 4 of them and would have had more if there were less that 8 people I had to share with haha.
We ordered seaweed salad and the beet salad. The seaweed salad was absolutely delicious, but the beet salad was probably the only thing we had that I didn't like.
But that's probably just because I don't like beets in general.

We ordered a rib-eye steak and one other kind of steak but I don't remember which it was. Both were delicious, tender, juicy, full of flavor with amazing sauces to dip each slice into.
To die for!!!
We also ordered 2 sushi rolls, don't remember which they were but both were delicious and I'm a sushi lover, not the average person who orders a california roll and calls themselves "satisfied".
It was good.

The desserts just blew my mind even more, of course, by the time dessert came, I was already drunk off of the bottle of sake, and 2 bottles of rose that we had all downed. But I'm sure the desserts would have blown my sober mind as well. I mean, PEANUT BUTTER AND CHOCOLATE FUDGE MAN!!! 

I would literally kill just to eat here again. I have no idea how much our bill was, but I'm sure it's out of my price range. Best meal of my entire life.
author: Hilarie L.

description: came here for sushi during lunch. this place was expensive and rolls were small. spent over $30 and left hungry. Rolls are at least $20 and not filling at all. taste is just okay. wouldn't say it was bad.. but wouldn't say it was good either. defiantly not for what they charge. service was not good either. waited long and place was not very busy. won't be returning. if your coming for sushi rolls I think there are better places nearby you could try
author: Jennelle T.

description:
My bf took me here for an anniversary dinner and I realized when we were taken to the back room, I had never dined in the large main area before.  I guess I've usually had drinks and food in the lounge.  I have to say the lounge exudes a certain sexiness that the main dining room doesn't but no matter, it was the company that mattered the most. :)

Sushi, sea bass, dessert all were really yummy as usual.  Prices are a tad higher but it's definitely worth it.  Service was excellent and our waiter was very well versed in the sake department.
author: Rosalind S.

description: I messed up. I need a do over. Why the hell did I go to Ozumo and order a burger?!?!?! Did I think it was going to be magical because it was being offered at Ozumos!?!? o_O yes... Major fail. They need to take it off the menu. The backyard bbq style burger needs a shot of teriyaki or something. My friend got the sashimi combo. The fish was amazing. One thing to note was that the service was pretty non existent. Came in for lunch and from start to finish it took over 1:30.
author: augustine x.

description:
Came here on a whim with the wife on the way home from her work.... it was a little crowded. .but not soo much that 2 couldn't fit at the bar for a drop in.

Service was very good, atmosphere was busy but not so noisy that conversations were difficult.

I think I remember that the quality here wasn't quite the same or as good as at the Oakland location, but still very good.  

Non-happy hour prices aren't cheap... but that's not what I was looking for in SF ....

a nice place to eat.... not necessarily somewhere I'd frequent.
author: Eric K.

description:
I agree that Ozumo probably doesn't need yet another 5-star rating, but it really is the best sushi! This was the first restaurant I went to in the city and I've been back lots of times because I can't get enough. Everything is amazing.. especially the fondue dessert!

If you can't get a table they can almost always seat you at the bar, so it's really easy for me to go back again and again! Love it!
author: Heather T.

description:
A buddy took me here and it was ridiculously expensive so big ups to Travis for being  a homie!  The atmosphere of this place was pretty cool.  Large central sake bars with tables all around it in a busy atmosphere.  The sake list was impressive and we drank the best sake I have ever had.

The fist itself was pretty hit or miss.  I had some pieces of toro that were pretty fishy tasting some that were tough and some that were good.  The yellowtail was pretty bad but the uni was good.  My buddy ordered the Rib-eye which was delicious, tons of flavor packed into that thing.

At the end of the day this place is fun for the atmosphere and the food would be okay if it wasn't ridiculously expensive.  Overall it just doesn't provide the bang for its buck.  As someone else mentioned if you are on an expense account why the hell not otherwise there are a ton of better sushi places in the city at a fraction of the cost.
author: Ryan J.

description:
O M G

this place just does not disappoint. I think about it while i sleep, while i exercise, while i eat other foods.  I think its safe to say i am IN LOVE with Ozumo. 

Nothing new to add from my last review except that my server Alice that i've gotten the privileged of having been served by twice, is amazing, and i will be asking for her again when i am back very very soon!
author: Shadi N.

description:
grabbed a quick bite here on NYE before the partying

lychee martini - one of the best lychee martinis i've tried
mushroom risotto with uni - i love uni, mushroom, and risotto! what a great combination. this was my favorite dish!
foie gras/uni/scallop thing over a steamed egg concoction - there was a lot going on in this dish but it was pretty good. i wasn't exactly sure how to eat it though
lobster mango roll - big pieces of lobster but i couldn't taste the mango :(
chocolate cake with green tea ice cream - nice way to end dinner

I'm glad i had a good experience here before going to a terrible NYE party.  at least something went right!
author: JUDY L.

description:
Last year at Dreamforce conference we visited this restaurant twice and loved it.  First night of Dreamforce and we rushed there.  The guy said that the wait will be an hour or so.  I asked if he could do anything and the answer was: 'fifty bucks will get you a table by the window right now'.  We got the table...
Service was ok, the food was ok, but the evening was spoiled.  Not going back.
author: Alex G.

description:
Delicious food, five star service and a very modern and nice ambiance. Ozumo is one of the best meals I've had in a long time. The Kobe beef is out of this world. The sushi is top notch. Black cod is fresh, buttery and flakes apart, so tasty!

The GM Greg was extremely friendly and passionate about his product. He also selected a few delicious sake's for us which was very helpful. 

I'll definitely be back as this was an overall great dining experience.
author: Rosie M.

description:
This place is more of a scene and good for happy hour if you like a scene and don't mind paying premium prices. That being said I've eaten here several times for dinner and although it's very pricey they do have some imaginative dishes. It's not an huge menu but it is creative. 

On our last visit we tried the crab and asparagus salad which was delicious. We also got a maki roll with lobster that was light and delicious. There was also a steak tatake roll that was awesome as well. We ordered a few other items that were all great as well.

They also have a great bar and know how to make great drinks. Good looking people all over the place in there as well hence making for a great scene. Regardless the food was very good. Our server was young and quirky but he was actually really good so service was on point.
author: Hyung L.

description: Now I'm rating solely on your dinner. The food is really amazing.. I would definitely come back again and you have the most beautiful looking tuna tartare and chocolate cake.
author: Catalina C.

description:
I'm updating my review just incase you could not tell how AWESOME the sushi is here from it.  I crave Ozumo every time I think of seafood.   My last visit did not let me down and I continue to praise Alice's service, she is amazing!

If you have not eaten here yet then what is stopping you?
author: Shawn A.

description:
I loved, loved, loved this place! During my trip to San Francisco I ate there twice and loved it each time. 

My utmost favorite dish that I ordered both visits is their Tontoro (pork jowel) appetizer.  It melted in your mouth like butter and the taste was so divine! I could have eaten that with a bowl of rice every day of my life.

My second favorite dish was their Suzuki (grilled Hawaiian sea bass). It also melted in your mouth and was so delicate and tasty! 

Other items I tried and loved was their Halibut sashimi drizzled in a delicate ponzu sauce, Washu Gyu (grilled ribeye steak), and a lobster, tuna and mango roll wrapped in delicate rice paper - yum!

Now I must admit it is not cheap to eat here but definitely a great place for special occasions or splurges.

The first time I dined here I was by myself and placed in the corner of the Robata bar. Alex (the executive chef) must have felt bad because he visited often and gave me a free taste of several of their dishes!  When I returned with a friend the second time we again sat at the Robata bar and he actually remembered me! He came by to greet me and my friend - what a sweetheart!

I plan on dining here every time I visit San Francisco!
author: Rose O.

description: This place is terrible, it's an Asian resturant with only white people.  How is that even possible in san francisco?!?!?  The management  is rude and service is slow even tho there was no I ne there.  We had a mixed group of people and we were told that we could only be served one round of drinks at 9 pm I n a friday.  Basically this place sucks.
author: Christopher B.

description:
This place is awesome, very hard to get table, food are great with very expensive price, service is wonderful, decor is nice, location is great but it can be hard to find parking space but they do have valet parking.

Note:  It is a great place for business meeting, taking a date but and party two of you with run you easy over $200.
author: Chris A.

description:
Beautiful place with great views. The service was great. The fish was fresh and tasty. The price was steep, and that would be ok if not for a couple of important things. The rice was crunchy, at least on this night. For a food that claims its masters spend years perfecting rice, a premium price tag (everything is around $10 and above per order of nigiri) should not include under-cooked, crunchy rice. Everything we ate had the same bad rice. It wasn't just firm. It was crunchy. Also, the fish was fresh, but the servings were about the size of my thumb and smaller. I have small hands. A $5-$7 piece of fish on crunchy rice could be bigger than my thumb.  Less of an issue is the fact that our chef (we sat at the bar) was very attentive, but didn't prepare anything with his own presentation. Nothing had ponzu or any light sauces. It's sometimes fun to have the chef hand you something like a snapper or Aji, and have him or her tell you not to dip in soy sauce. The chef did give us some nice little bonus pieces of fish and did fry up the salmon skin from the wild salmon we ordered.  Nice touch, for sure. 

There are so many great things about this place. In our opinion, the price didn't match the meal.
author: Scott O.

description: The location is great.  Service was wonderful.  I'm such a sushi snob - but I can't give my 4 or 5 star rating yet as I need to go again and get the RAW stuff.  Give me about 4 months though...I need to have this baby.  Anywho, what I did have that was seared or cooked...was okay.  It was good but it was the same caliber as Katsuya or just a nice, upscale Japanese restaurant.
author: Elaine C.

description:
Why can't more Sushi places be like Ozumo? Trendy, Classy, Lounge-like and still offering an amazing selection of food, sakes and great service! I went to Ozumo twice for dinner on weekdays over the past month and each time my experience was most excellent. 

Food: Favorites are definitely  the Sekiwake Rolls (Spicy Tuna Roll with tobiko, tempura flakes, salmon, hamachi - peanut sauce on the side), the Dragon Roll (a classic), their Shiromaguro (white Albacore) is to die for, I enjoyed their Kinoko Miso Soup (Nameko, shitake and enoki mushrooms) as an appetizer. The Hamachi sashimi was fresh (although the Albacore was definitely better). 

Drinks: They have one of the best selection of Sakes I have ever seen. I recommend trying their samplers once then save the name of your favorite type for your next visit. I got a full bottle once, and a half bottle the second time. My all time favorite Sake there: Tedorigawa Yamahai Daiginjo. 

Staff: Very knowledgeable (or willing to get the info from the Chef and report), Super nice. Had Jenna once and Brandon the second time, and both were super friendly, patient, helpful.. They offered suggestions and explained the dishes. Adds to the experience in a very positive way!

Accommodations: The only minus of this place is that if you end up at a table next to a loud group celebration you won't hear yourself think. The bar is a bit of a social scene. I recommend asking for a quiet table when you book. They seem very willing to help and I got fantastic seats twice.

Location: if you go on weekdays, the Embarcadero is an easy place to find parking at (Folsom St is just 2 blocks away and has plenty) and a nice quiet area for a post dinner walk.

Price: It's not cheap but you should not be either. It's worth it!
author: Jean-Francois R.

description: Came in for lunch, and it was pretty meh all around.  The sushi here is incredibly expensive, and I was actually scoffed at for ordering a modest amount.  Our waitress also seemed super stressed out and although she was doing her job -- it came across as being a bit pushy and overboard.  With the plethora of amazing sushi options in the city, you're better off avoiding Ozumo.
author: Mel G.

description:
I like this place but felt it was quite expensive but i think you pay for the ambience and the real quality seafood that comes with it.  Theres a bar/lounge area by the entrance and it looks very dim and romantic.  The dining area is relatively big and it was packed on a saturday night.  We were a big group so they required a credit card for reservation.  I had a few pieces of sashimi, 2 rolls and paid no liquor, dessert or drinks and I paid 55 with taxes and tip.   So you do the math if you want to order drinks, appetizers, desserts etc.  I am a sushi lover and would come back to this place especially if someone else is paying :) 

The service was just ok, my water was never refilled which is a big deal for me coz im a water guzzler.  So in summary, good quality sushi great ambience but quite expensive not super but its up there.  If you want to impress a date and really enjoy your food come here.  If you dont care about ambience and just want really good sushi and stuff yourself and have a good value for your money ill think twice about this place.
author: Robin D.

description: One of the best and most elegant sushi restaurants in the city and yes it is pricy. But the food is really good. Fun menu with delicious fresh fish.
author: Haleh H.

description: Food and drinks are great. Like the happy hour menu. Short ribs and garlic edemame  on the happy hour menu is must try. Great atmosphere for personal and work crowd. Lots of afterwork crowd who looks like they want to hooked up.
author: Lily Y.

description:
Came here for our 3 year anniversary so expectations were a bit high I guess. We had reservations for 9PM but we got there a bit early. The restaurant wasn't very full, there was a ton of room at the bar and the sushi bar, and I'm pretty sure I saw a bunch of tables open too. We kept seeing parties come in and get seated before us. At 9, we get seated on the worst possible table in the restaurant - the middle area facing basically nothing. I asked if there was seating in the back and the hostess said its all full, but the sushi bar is open. Why didn't you tell me that before making me wait 20 mins?! She came back and said she has a corner table open and seated us. This was a bad start already.

The service is slow as hell at this place. We waited another 10 mins for someone to take our order. The waitress recommends the lamb chop special so we ordered it. Another 10 mins later she comes back to tell us they are out. I had pretty much given up at that point. The rest of the evening was fine, other than just being SUPER slow. Most of the food was fantastic though, except for the nigiri. It didn't taste any different from what I would get at safeway!

I left a note on the check, hopefully someone works on correcting their service. Definitely not the experience I was looking for, especially for a celebration!
author: Shitij A.

description: Favorite place to go.. Adult and kiddie-friendly:) Most delicious sushi, my favorite is bucho and all small plates are must try - sashimi are always fresh to pair with a good cocktail, giddy geisha:)
author: Maus S.

description:
After the Auto Show we went over to Ozumo for dinner.  We were hoping for the best since it was a Friday night and we had no reservations.  I was quite pleased that we were able to get a table with a view of the Embarcadero and Bay Bridge and didn't have to sit at the sushi bar.  

We ordered Bucho, Sekiwake, Zuwaigani (Snow Crab), and Unagi  and cocktails.  Everything was very good and the portions were generous.  I like that the veggies in the rolls were sliced so thin and were crispy.  Yes this place is on the pricier side, for example one roll was sixteen dollars, but the service, quality of sushi, and ambience are well worth a visit. 

I have eaten there before but my guest hadn't so I decided to surprise him with the 'Garlic Soy Edamame'.  This stuff is better than candy and I wonder how you can ever go back to the plain stuff after eating this?  Even my friend was ready to lick the bowl to get the last piece of garlic from the bottom.
author: Sandyann G.

description: I went here for my friends birthday yesterday and both the food and service were really good. However, the portion sizes are tiny and after spending $50 a person, I ended up going out to food afterwards to curb my hunger. They really need to step it up on the amount of food on each plate or compensate by making the dishes cheaper.
author: Andrew E.

description:
Damn, if it wasn't for all the Irish coffee's and shots at Buena Vista before hand, and then the sake and beers to start off at Ozumo, I might be able to remember the dishes we ordered.

We came here with some regulars and got to sample something from all aspects of the menu and three desserts.  Everything was delicious!  I do remember something with tomatoes wrapped with bacon and everyone went apeshit for it!

We sat a the bar and enjoyed an almost empty restaurant on a Sunday night.  

The fondue with fruit and I think mochi was AMAZEABALLS!!!!!!  

I would come back here anytime!
author: Lindsey B.

description:
This place has great drinks and great sushi. A little over priced but the fish is fresh and there is a lot of variety on the menu which I love.

Great place for a business lunch and the happy hour scene is super fun with music and mingling. I wouldn't come for a romantic date but great for a group.

My office and I were celebrating my boss's birthday and our release doing well so we headed over there for an office happy hour. Ozumo made a point of helping us get a table last minute in the bar and the food and drinks just kept coming even though the place was packed and it was a Friday night.

Delicious Sushi... having a craving as I right this. OZUMO!!
author: Mikaela s.

description:
I am always confused when I find Japanese restaurants that are so overrated only to find that they are befuddling the diners with fancy decor and deceptive presentations, when they do not deliver anything substantial. BUT, OZUMO is one of the very few contemporary Japanese restaurants in San Francisco that deserves some praise. It makes me sad to find that this place is below 4 stars in average, because it's really amazing. The ambiance is very nice, with dim lighting providing a romantic setting. I find Ozumo a perfect place for a date.    
The food here is amazing. What many contemporary Japanese restaurants in SF fail to deliver is the authenticity of Japanese cuisine. There is nothing wrong with contemporary approach to reinterpret a cuisine, but when you deliver a dish that has lost the authenticity of a cuisine, and has compromised with heavy flavors and fancy presentations to qualify for a standard of excellency, that is unacceptable. Unfortunately, that is what many contemporary restaurants do. But, Ozumo is different. They have successfully delivered the authenticity of the Japanese cuisine in a novel approach with respect to the choice of ingredients and presentation. The presentation of the food was beautiful as well. Ozumo has killed two birds with a stone. 
Most of my favorite dishes were from the Ippin Ryori section, which are mainly small dishes. I suggest that you start out your meal with a focus on this section, because all the dishes here are excellent examples of a contemporary approach to traditional dishes. The top pick is the "Yamabuki", which is an uni (sea urchin) risotto. I never expected that uni would go so well with mushrooms, but the dish was fantastic. "Tontoro", which is barbequed kurobuto pork, just melts in your mouth. "Hanabi", which is sliced hamachi & avocado with jalapeno ponzu sauce, has a Peruvian approach and it is refreshing. At times, Ozumo offers alternative specials to this dish such as "Lobster Halibut Ceviche", so do check it out. 
From the main dish "Gindara", black cod cooked with sake and "Suzuki", Hawaiian seabass with shoyu butter, are the top choices in the fish section. Both fishes have a smooth texture and cuts like butter. If you are contemplating between the two, think of the black cod dish as the filet mignon and the seabass as ribeye. The Suzuki tastes a little bit heavier as it is a fattier fish than Gindara. From the meat section, I suggest "Hitsuji" or "Gyu Kakuni", but the portions are extremely small, so I would suggest choosing from the Ippin Ryori or Izakaya section for the meat dishes.
And lastly for the dessert fans, I suggest "Choco Chan", "Apple Phyllo", and "Pineapple Maki". I've been here 4 times and tried all the desserts. These are the best without a doubt. I'll keep this a secret for you to find out what the deal is with these desserts. 
Lastly, what I liked about the restaurant was their selection of sake and imported beer from Japan. They definitely have the best selection of sake and beer. But, I'm a beer fan and I have tried this beer called "Hitachino Nest", which is a white ale, that the restaurant recently started importing and it's amazing. It's definitely one of the best while ales I've ever had. I would go back to Ozumo just for this beer. They have many other ones that are rare and I really think it's worth a try. So give it a try!
author: Matt L.

description:
Had been here only once before - around 4yrs ago when we first moved to the Bay Area. The menu was slightly different back then and the quality of their fish was definitely better as well.

I love the view, I love the service and I think the ambiance in the dining area and bar are really cool. They can also make any of their cocktails into non-alcoholic versions, which I thought was super accommodating when dining with people who don't drink.

But I cannot give them higher than 3 stars because:
- the special rolls were $16-$18 each and were the size of regular spicy tuna rolls that are usually $6
- our friend didn't feel like eating sushi so he ordered the bass, which didn't come until all of us had eaten five different plates of sushi and apps! poor guy was starving watching us :( and even after asking our server about his dish, it took an additional twenty mins to get there!
- they don't have the freshest tasting fish and took their sashimi martini off their menu :(

I still say you should go - because it's a cool restaurant - but just be aware you'll be walking away  having paid at least $200+ for substandard sushi and maybe two cocktails that didn't really hit the mark :(
author: Sonal P.

description:
I'm weird, sometimes I want a scene, sometimes I don't. So when I do... I go to Ozumo.

The Bar

Love the thumping house music, the excellent sake selection, and the creative cocktails. You can of course get the full menu, but the bar can be crowded so it's not the best spot for a full dinner. Over the years I've gotten to know Ali (one of the bartenders), he always says hello when I drop in, such a friendly guy...

The Restaurant

Attractive ambiance, though they need to lose the neon signs. Staff is well trained and smiles at you as you're walking in (ever notice they do this at top hotels? If you haven't read the research, smiling increase endorphins). 

Sushi quality varies, but it's been mostly good. Prices are high for what you get, but I rationalize it by focusing on the scene-y yet approachable space and good service.

Ozumo remains on my "regular" list and I'll continue to come by when I'm craving a touch of fancy with a splash of sake.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Ozumo SF is my Go-To place for business lunch and dinner meetings!  Excellent and authentic Japanese dishes and very friendly service.  I have done several fund raising here for Tsunami relief in Japan and they have been very helpful to our community events.  They also have great educational mixers for sake lovers:)))
author: Mia T.

description:
This is probably my go to date spot for Sushi in the city. I go there again and again and it always delivers. You can basically pick any of the rolls and they're going to be good. The nigiri is also wonderful. They bring out the sushi in waves and it's generally pretty well timed so that you don't have too much at any point but you're never waiting to long. They have an extensive sake list and, depending on the waiter, do a great job walking you through the different kinds. 

Fun trick: If you show up without a reservation and they tell you that there's a wait, you can easily just log into opentable or yelp and make a reservation on the spot. I saved myself a 45 minute wait doing this.
author: John J.

description: My friend and I popped in for a drink one evening and we bumped into some people hanging out at the bar, she happened to know him and we hung out with him and a couple of other people.  Never a dull moment with her. Was a fun night, nice atmosphere and interesting people. I've only had the drinks here not sure what the food is like, but drinks were good.
author: K T.

description: Good place for HH. Unfiltered sake was the perdect HH drink of choice. Outstanding pupus. Will come back for more.
author: Gwen K.

description:
Ozumo is now my favorite Japanese SF restaurant.  I should have come here sooner!  Great food, atmosphere, and Mel the manager was just great.

I really enjoyed the full variety of Sake!

Mike
author: Mike L.

description: My only problem with the place is the noise level. The quality of fish is outstanding though
author: Rozita N.

description: Pretty hip and happening. Good place to hang out and be seen. Huge collection of sake if you are into that. Food is pretty good too. 2 thumbs up.
author: Sunil R.

description:
What a wonderful restaurant!   I had the blackened cod and my friend had the sea bass.  They were both fantastic. Melt in your mouth fantastic!    They have a great menu- lots to choose from.  We ordered one of the 4 course meals with soup, salad, sushi/sashimi and dessert.  Every item was absolutely delicious!   I highly recommend it, especially for a special occasion. Kind of pricy for every day dinners, but excellent for out of town guests and someone special.  

Check out the menu online ( though they have specials daily) .   Excellent!!
author: J C.

description:
Had the Kobe Beef tongue, it was exquisite.

Had the Salmon Roe with raw Quail Egg, it was amazing.

Had the Ozumo roll, it was awesome.

Had the peanut butter mouse, it was delightful.

Had Sapporo on tap, some great sake, and some port to finish it off. A great meal and great atmosphere
author: Maxfield A.

description:
Came here for our wedding anniversary.  Someone gifted us $100 giftcard here, otherwise I wouldn't have chosen it based on the reviews.  Our super attentive waiter congratulated us once we were seated and brought out 2 glasses of champagne. He was really good at going over the menu and answering questions.  Bonus points in my book for suggesting the sake sampler.  Husband enjoyed his sashimi and still talks about it. 

We'll definitely be back!
author: Irene D.

description:
Great location, awesome decor, great view, great service. Why did it get a two star from me?  

Because the sushi rolls were horrible.  I was so disappointed it hurt.  They tasted like the prepacked sushi rolls you get at SAFEWAY.  And they didnt have the great Japanese whiskey Yamazaki, even though it was in the drink menu.

If you're going to spend the money here you expect to spend in a place like this, you just expect more.  Maybe if you do decide to come here, hopefully the sashimi is better.  

Hit it over rated my friends.
author: JD B.

description:
I just got back from eating there tonight with my friends, so the memory is fresh in my mind. We ordered A LOT today and i in fact, enjoyed almost everything! From my agedashi tofu appetizer to the fresh and tenderness of salmon belly all the way to my Choco Chan dessert, I enjoyed every dish. We decided to split the tab three way, so we kinda just went crazy with the menu. The sashimi, hands down won me over. Soft, fresh and tender. The moment you put it in your mouth, you suddenly realize you haven't REALLY ate sashimi yet, and the thing is, i only ordered salmon belly and the hamachi, imagine what else i'm missing out on in the whole sashimi menu! My friends ordered the gyu carpaccio and it was amazing. who knew cherry complemented raw beef? 

I've eaten a lot of california rolls, i mean, hey, it's the "easiest" thing on the menu, but am i nuts for believing that this 6 piece order of california roll with REAL crab is worth the 9 dollars?! I think i am, but then again, you need to try it before you agree with me. But the shrimp tempura roll, not so much, it's not even worth $5 in my opinion, there was nothing special there. 

There were a few more dishes that we ordered, but it slipped my mind, we also each ordered different desserts. I'd say the dessert wasn't mouth-gasmic as the sashimi or other entrees, there was also nothing extraordinarily outstanding or memorable but for the overall dining experience, you should finish your meal off with something sweet. I think i should have ordered the chocolate fondue, it smelled really good from the table next to us. 

If i were to recommend this place, i'd say you can't go wrong with the sashimi, whether it be the raw fish to the raw meat, it's definitely an amazing and tasty trip in your mouth. It was, after all my first time, i do anticipate wanting to come back, but with a wiser palette choice. I'd definitely be down to try more sashimi and less "cooked" entrees. 

Service - our waitress could have been more attentive, she did the bare minimum, you know, nothing to complain about, but nothing to rave about either. She checked in twice, took our orders accordingly and served accurately. I think that for the price and ambiance of the restaurant, we deserved better quality from our waitress than what the local waitress at the diner. 

Our reservations were a little earlier than usual dinner time, so the sky was still bright. the restaurant is most lively in the nighttime so i believe the ambiance would be a LOT more amazing when it got darker. 

The place looks great, feels great and the food was great, service, meh could be better, price - meh, for a restaurant intended to be upscale in San Francisco, i expected it, i've seen worst. if you order the appropriate amount, it won't be that deep of a cut in your wallet. 

So do i recommend it? Yes, i do! 
Was it a perfect experience? Eh, could be better, but not bad enough for me to not want to come back.

I'd come back.
author: Pris S.

description:
ozumo is a really nice looking restaurant, great atmosphere for night out, or with friends,etc.

we went for hh and sat near the back.

ordered
skewers of duck, beef tongue?, and shrimp- i thought they were good, tender, flavorful. 
ordered wings, but sadly they were out.
rock n roll and spicy tuna- decent, normal
ramen- totally ordered this on a whim since i love ramen. tastes like....packaged ramen.....literally. 
giddy geisha cocktail- good and strong

food came out fairly slowly...like prettyyy slow.. but i wouldn't mind coming to hh again with friends. but it is pretty pricey regardless.

and i think the owners are japanese....or at least some of the staff are.
author: Christine M.

description: I love this place.  While a bit pricey, the good is great, bar is fun for large groups, and just a nice destination.  Like the other reviews, you hesitate because of price, try the food, and the next you know you have a great big bill that you are more than happy to pay for.
author: Robert H.

description:
I've only ever had good sushi here.  And good service too.

It's clean, chic (I guess), comfortable, and friendly.
author: Jon M.

description:
Really nice venue, we had a little booth/room for a business lunch which meant we didn't have the view of the bay bridge but it was a nice setting anyway.  Waiters were pretty attentive.  We ordered sushi for the table- so a selection of a tonne of different things, sides, salads, sushi and sashimi.   The waiters brought everything out in good time and made it super easy to navigate around all of the different dishes we were sharing!  All of the food was presented beautifully, like art, and tasted....interesting.  I'm a sushi virgin so it was a pretty sweet intro but I have to say, I just don't think I'm a fan!  I'm sure someone who loved sushi would LOVE this place but gimme a $7 burrito from Cancun any day!

Was pretty pricey as well (but awesome if the company is paying for it ;) )
author: Ashleigh R.

description: I called at 2:04 to order lunch, they close at 2 so I asked politely if I could still order lunch, they rudely said we close at 2:00 and wouldn't take my order, that's just poor service and silly to turn away business 4 minutes past closing time.
author: jon c.

description:
I came here on a Friday night for dinner and I've always liked the ambiance to this place. We had reservations at 9:30 pm and got there a little bit early.  
It was packed!! The place is filled with people around the bar having a drink and probably also waiting for their table. 

We ordered a couple of rolls for dinner and I expected alot more from their hamachi roll.  Overall it was ok sushi.  Pricey but I've had better quality sushi.
It's a good date spot if that's what you're looking for.
author: Anna B.

description:
I honestly have no idea what the food here looks like. I was so busy staring at the Bay Bridge that I ate my entire dinner without ever looking down. I'm surprised the fish didn't all land on the floor. I must be pretty good at blindly finding my own mouth...a skill that may come in handy later in life.

Anyway, while I can't comment on presentation, the quality was high, albeit overpriced, presumably inflated for the high proportion of business comped clientele. We tried sashimi (hamachi 5 piece, $16; Aji Spanish mackerel, $22), one of their signature rolls ($15), and gindara (cooked black cod, $28). Watch out for the bones in the gindara, especially if you plan on eating it with your eyes closed.
author: Lou S.

description:
It is expensive, but the quality and presentation of the food is great.  We tried walking in at La Mar - got there at 10P and they stopped serving at 9.30P, so we walked to Ozumo and they were still serving until 11P!  Yay!  I think restaurants on a weekend should serve until 11P.  That was a plus for Ozumo.

We ordered 2 rolls and the Sea Bass - Awesome.  The rolls were very fresh.

for dessert we went for the fruit fondue.  AND O M G!!!  it was heavenly!  It was my first time having fondue and I really loved it!  I loved it so much I bought my own fondue set the next day.

We sat by the window - view of the bay bridge lit up.  Nice touch.
author: R M.

description: Long time patron, but my recent experiences are terrible. Can't sit at the bar with a friend without getting interrupted by prostitutes, charged us $100 for the toro - yes $100 - and the valet was poaching us for a towncar for $50 within the city. This place has become a shameful, pathetic excuse for a restaurant!!!
author: damon k.

description:
Been here many times and it was  always good. This time it was extra good. Service and food combined - a winner.  Of course the cod is just to die for and Hanabi  and Akebono so delicious.
Great night with great views too .  Just loved it.
author: Maria C.

description:
Another pretty standard sushi spot, although the Tuna Tartare was above average.

Ambiance is great, and there is an amazing view of the Bay Bridge. Definitely a hot spot for Happy Hour spillover from FiDi.

If you're in the area and in the mood for sushi, it's definitely worth a shot.
author: Raza M.

description:
Birthday celebration dinner Monday night.

From reading other Yelp reviews I decided to try the Rainwater and the Garlic Edamonme. You guys are rignt they were both amazing! Thanks for the suggestions.

Where do I start...

Arrived a little early for our 6:15 RSVP, checked in and while I waited at the bar, ordered my first Rainwater. The Bartendress was adorable and showed me how to make this amazing drink. Crushed cucumber, sake flavored vodka, sweet base and a squirt of lime. Amazingly refreshing and could easily replace a gin and tonic on a hot summer evening (picture of lawn chair on the dock in front of a lake here). Only regret is that it doesn't come in a big gulp cup..LOL

1st friend arrives and joins me in my Rainwater. Bartendress...on the spot. Second friend arrives and orders a glass of Cab...again, Bartendress...on spot.

The only bad thing that I can think of in the entire evening was the hostess. One of my buddies went to tell her that our whole party was here now and he pretty much pulled back a bloody stub..."I'm busy right now" is NOT the correct response to "Our party is all here now."

On to dinner. Started with the amazing Garlic Edamonme and got better from there. One of the guys got an Ahi Collar but refused to share so I have no personal experience with how good it was, but just the fact that he kept it all to himself (on my birthday) tells me a lot. I can't even tell you the rest of what we got. Rolls, Sashimi, Nigiri, etc. The standouts: OMG the Maguro sashimi melts in your mouth. Also tried tuna belly sashimi, that again melts in your mouth. 

Waitress was spot on all the time. She constantly took our orders for more and never pressured us with more plates showing up on the table before we were done with the previous one.

Sorry, no room for dessert. But I'll be back.
author: Mike G.

description:
We went here on out first night in San Fran at the suggestion of our concierge. It definitely has a great loungy vibe, perfect for a date night or even a night out with a big group of friends (there is a lot of space and there were lots of big tables for groups). We made a late reservation so there was only room at the sushi bar, which was just fine for my hubby and me. 

The sushi was definitely fresh and you can taste the difference. Service was not amazing, and slow at times, but we were not in a rush so that did not bother us. 

My only gripe was that I wish they had more roll options. We got the hamachi jalapeño rolls, which were ok. All the other options had crab, eel, or other bottom feeders which I don't eat so it would have been nice to see some rolls with tuna or salmon. 

If you are going to drink, expect the bill to be  on the higher end. But overall, good sushi and atmosphere.
author: Shelley A.

description:
"Itadakimasu!"...you'll hear it in J-Town but not here ...OK, maybe at the sushi counter, but hey, it's not the same...know what I mean?

If you're looking for that serenity-on-steroids, "Lost in Translation"-Happy Hour at the Tokyo Park Hyatt kind of vibe, Ozumo will likely be your pricey cup of green tea. Staff here is very friendly but sort of like extras from "Gattaca" - very attractive, very faux-Asian-accesorized, very identical, very canned. I came here for lunch with a colleague, and while attempting to converse, we had a very service-oriented server who bordered on verbose in her meticulous descriptions of all the key menu items.

My hypocritical whining does stop with what I had, the $14 Tori Bento Box, which consisted of slices of free-range chicken, charcoal-grilled, with various compartments in the lacquer box for the side dishes. It was tasty enough, though they short-change you a bit on the rice. I guess they just prove there isn't much you can do with a bento box. For the fancy dishes they serve at dinner, I have to say I've never been overly tempted by them as they strike me as more fusion than honest Japanese.

Happy Hour still seems the best time to come if you can stand the crowds in the dark, front bar. Of the zensai plates offered, the best ones I've had is a uni risotto dish called Yamabuki ($10) and the $16 Hanabi, which are slices of hamaichi and avocado drizzled with a ginger jalapeno sauce. I'll continue to come by but frankly not too often. Maybe they need a karaoke machine.

"Takai desu ne?...Sayonara"...and don't let the tatami hit you on the way out.

FOOD - 3.5 stars...tasty enough, just never that outstanding to me
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...you are transported to the Ginza. prices and all
SERVICE - 3 stars...unctuous is the most appropriate term here
TOTAL - 3 stars...a sometime kind of place for lunch and a happy hour get-together
author: Ed U.

description:
This has got to be the most expensive sushi I've ever had and it was delicious! Fortunately, my company was getting the tab so we were able to enjoy a great selection of rolls and even desert during lunch.

It was easy to get a reservation and the staff was very helpful. I generally eat sushi closer to my area, the sunset, and the food is fairly similar but at a much lower price. What makes Ozumo worth trying again is their speciality rolls. They are inventive and very different from other sushi rolls. If you're gonna go with the standard selection of rolls, you'll do just fine at another restaurant with a lower price point.

None the less, it's delicious and worth a try if you have some extra cash to spend.
author: Stephanie S.

description: These guys are very detail oriented. I love that they give you a warm welcome, by going you the best accommodations. Interior was a little tight, but they were well organized and manage to get things around very easily. The sushi was fresh and delicious. True to what they should be. Served beautifully with the sauces on the side and more fish than rice. Yes, sadly enough when you go to average sushi places, they tend to wrap more rice around it than the fish itself. I think my favorite here was their dessert of fruits with the chocolate fondue. It was definitely different and worth trying again.
author: Barbara H.

description: Happy hour rocks here! Great sushi, nice setting, and close to AT&T park :) large selection of saki. Great before a Giants game
author: wayne y.

description:
Best damn sushi in the city.  I'm serious.  We're talking the most colorful, fresh, artful-looking rolls and sashimi slices I've ever seen on a plate.  So artful and beautiful, in fact, that I was hesitant to take a bite before first admiring the presentation that was laid out for my party and me.

I've been to Ozumo three times now and every experience has been positive.   The sushi is fresh, the ambiance is clean and modern, the waitstaff have been very knowledgeable and eager.

I recommend this restaurant every time I have visitors in town and have yet to hear a complaint, aside from Ozumo being so popular on certain nights that seating for some has been limited to the front common area if one failed to secure a reservation in advance.
author: Katie C.

description:
Pros:
High quality fish that is surprisingly hard to come by in the downtown area.

Cons:
A little pricey.

Fun:
Years ago a guy took me here for a lunch interview (my first time at Ozumo).  He then proceeded to have a martini.  Two martinis.  Three martinis.  I don't even know what the "___ martini lunch" saying is, but I'm pretty sure he drank more than "___."  Clearly he was more interested in an excuse to drink than interviewing, but hey, I got the job!
author: Mike G.

description: Came for happy hour and the selection was limited, though decent. Service was excellent as our waiter was attentive and careful about food allergies, etc. I think the normal prices are too high but happy hour is fine.
author: Josh Q.

description:
Extensive collection of premium cold sake.  Attentive staff.  Very fresh sashimi and nigiri.  Cooked food is hit or miss.  Poor value.

Hanabi was fresh and futago was well balanced between the washu beef, eggplant, and spinach.  Hamachi and salmon belly were great although they ran out of hamachi belly which was a surprise since it was still early in the evening and listed as a special. 

The requisite miso cod was very good and cooked just right.  The kamo tataki(seared duck breast with ponzu) was not only seared, it was cooked to a well done portion of duck jerkey almost as if the cook temporarily forgot about it and decided to serve it anyway.  A fusion squid risotto concoction fell flat.

Had an inspired cold sake flight in the "Black Dragon" and a very good hot sake in the Nishida.

Overall some very good items but also mixed with glaring misses.
author: S S.

description:
Starters: Went here on a date!!! She was definitely impressed. Started off with a flight of sake from the Nigata prefecture and a bowl of garlic soy sauce edamame soy beans.  From there we had the tontoro (braised pork jewels) served w/ Karachi vinegarette(sake vinegarette), dohyo(spicy tuna tartare w/avocado cream, cucumber, shiso, tobiko, ponzu, and wasabi oil), hanabi (slices of hamachi yellowtail w/ a ginger and jalapeño ponzu) and the futago(grilled washu beef, sautéed garlic, spinach, and eggplant served w/miso seaseme sauce).  All of the appetizers were DELICIOUS!! The pork was so tender and didn't require a knife. The toro was perfectly fresh and had the perfect amount of wasabi. The beef and all of the other ingredients blended well and the meat was so succulent. 

Sushi: My date and I love sushi. I like Ozumo because they have some hard to come by sushi. We both had the salmon toro (salmon belly), toro (fatty tuna belly), hamachi(yellowtail), maguro (tuna), unagi(eel), shiro maguro(white tuna), hotate(scallops), and mirugai(clams).  All of the sushi was perfect. High quality and the freshest. 

Entrees: We decided to share 2 entrees. The guy filet and black cod. OMG the black cod was so moist and fresh. Very flavorful. Could have that again and again. The filet was prepared w/green beans, shiitake mushrooms in a sansho sauce. All components were excellent. 

Dessert: Decided to order 2 desserts. The choco chan (flour less chocolate cake) , and dark chocolate fondue. The fresh berries complimented the dark chocolate. Not a dark chocolate lover, but this dessert worked for me. Will order again. The flourless chocolate cake was the best I have ever eaten. The bitterness of the green tea and the sweetness of the chocolate cake were a match. Since we were having chocolate we decided a citrus sake would be a nice way to cleanse the palette with the chocolate. Having said that we each had the dewakuza "tobiroku". A perfect ending. 

Overall, great ambience with a good vibe. If you have friends in town or want to impress a lady this is the place. Great selection of sake and wines to choose from. Any spot in the the restaurant is a great place to sit. Sat in all 4 areas as I'm a regular (sake lounge, sushi bar, dinning room, and the front of the restaurant). Can't go wrong. Also, convenient is valet parking. Convenient as this area is tough for parking to come by. Close to AT&T Park. Great spot after a ball game. Matt Cain and Buster Posey frequent the place as does David Lee of the Warriors. 

Great service. Severs are attentive and are well versed with the menu. Have a vast knowledge of all the sakes and food items. I will be back with the ladies. U know it!!!  Even thoughs it's pricey; worth every penny. Better yet go when it's on company plastic. That's what I did.
author: Andy H.

description: I like Ozumo. I know it's pricey, I know it gets packed, I know parking is kind of a pain.....but i still like it. The food quality is excellent, the sake menu is extensive and the service is attentive. I always have a good time here and plan to come back often.
author: J S.

description: Outstanding!  20th time here.  The bar is always fun for people watching, excellent music, cocktails, and great food. Secret with this place is to take the waitress suggestions & try different things on the menu. Go outside of your comfort zone.   Ordered the grilled octopus dish,  Mackerel Nigiri, and a Kazan.   Crazy ABC girlfriend ordered miso soup, tartare and a Uni Nigiri then threw away the rice because she does not want to get fat;  FOUL and she is now single. :-)   For the tourists and occasional uneducated: "Sashimi" is with no rice.  "Nigiri" is on rice.  Employees are uber professional.   Two disappointments; need hooks or shelves under the bar as people are always whording bar seats with jackets/purses.  Need a dress code.   I will be back
author: Jordan M.

description:
Mediocre trendy japanese place that costs an arm and a leg! Yes.

This place is catered for the "single and ready to mingle" crowd....or so they pretend to be? Yeah it seems like everyone here is either here to be seen and get picked up on.  Enough about crowd, the food was ok.  They do alot of rolls which are tasty, but nothing outstanding. I've only had drinks and food in the front area and never had a real sit down in the back area.  The restrooms are in the back and everytime you walk back there you pass by the chefs and they all greet you...one by one.  I guess its their requirement? But its funny that they all say it sometimes at once...or one by one. Kind of catches you off guard when you're racing to go pee.
