But drinks are expensive.  $12 for a Johnnie Black on the rocks?!  At most, I've paid $10. Most of the cocktails are from $10-$12 and there's nothing special about their drinks. Thats expensive in SF!
author: Gina S.

description:
I'm a regular at Ozumo.  The tuna tartare and sliced yellowtail hamachi apps are great to start.    

I'm really glad they finally brought in new chairs around the bar in the main dining section - so much more comfortable!

Excellent sushi - can't go wrong.
author: Dom P.

description:
Why go here for food? they are really a fancy bar/lounge... they have good Japanese food, but there are lot of places in the city with better food.
The food is Average and over prices. it has an awesome bar/lounge... nice happy hour in the middle of the week, good service and great ambiance.
I have had almost everything on the menu... Kobe Steak, 4 really small pieces $180!!! Really?
Great Lychee Martinis!!! I think it is a great place to have drinks... but go somewhere else to eat.
author: Arash H.

description:
Truly spectacular nigiri sushi. We gave the chef a price point ($35 apiece) and asked him to give us the freshest and tastiest fish he had. Standouts included seared salmon belly, halibut, snapper, king mackerel (white, dense, delicately fishy, nothing like regular mackerel), yellow tail, and tuna. The Ozumo roll with fresh crab, avocado, and tuna was very tasty, but it seemed a little overdone compared to the simple nigiri.

Our order of veggie tempura was expertly fried and beautifully garnished, but not especially flavorful, even with the dipping sauce. Interesting choice of veggies including a chili pepper, a slice of burdock root, and some nice baby eggplant. 

A side of cubed purple sweet potato with miso butter was delicious, but as the waiter warned us, it takes longer to prepare than just about anything else on the menu. So, be prepared to wait a few minutes.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
Food was good but I was expecting something exceptional.

We ordered the bento box combo. Again, food is fresh but given the price, it just didn't wow me.
author: Sophia L.

description: I'm from Hawaii so we have lots of good sushi.  Nice environment and polite, helpful workers.  The food was ok.  The raw shrimp was kinda slimey.  Everything else tasted good, but not spectacular.  Pretty pricey, but I guess you're paying for the ambience too!
author: Keith R.

description:
Okay, Yelp, you done me wrong. I'm not sure who these reviewers are who said they were intimidated by the trendy decor at Ozumo and the food was so great, etc., but this place is basically a high-end Red Lobster. 

The decor is corporate, characterless plastic ickiness. The food is insanely overpriced.

I made the mistake of booking this place for my husband's 40th birthday, and the very sweet maitre d' made a fuss and brought us sake, which made us feel guilty about turning right around and leaving, which is what we wanted to do.

So out of guilt, we ordered a beer and a couple of quick appetizers and set about making an alternate reservation at an authentic, charming Japanese restaurant. (SF has many: Try Sebo, Ebisu or Eiji if that's what you're looking for.)

The bill for a seaweed salad, agedashi tofu and one beer?  $56. Gag.

This place didn't look anything like what the Web site suggested and I can only shrug at the taste of my fellow reviewers. To each his own, I guess. 

If you want a so-so view of the water, so-so decor, so-so food and an extravagant bill, Ozumo is the place for you.
author: Megan M.

description:
pro: modern contemporary interior...trendy bar w/a interesting mix of sake cocktails....good sushi (but, korean..so what do i really know about sushi...we eat sashimi dipped in "cho-jang")...good selction of sake...

con: bit overpriced....the sushi, sake and food......my dinner date for two was $three hundred fifty..(did order a variety of only the best sashimi, nigiri and one moderately priced bottle of sake for my dinner)....some of the seasonal prices can be high...

overall: good eats at a high price....if you're on a budget..i would recommend sticking to the plate dinners and ordering a piece or two of off the sushi menu as a starter....you can definitely get similar level eats at a much more resonable price in the city....
author: Hen A.

description:
Everything you've heard about price is true. I was taken here for a birthday dinner, so YAY! I got GREAT sushi, and presents, without having to pay. Woo!

To be fair, the sushi was superb. We had tuna, we had halibut, we had all other manner of fish. Portions were large, and meant to be shared, wich we did. The sake selection was very extensive, so we had a great bottle to accompany our meal.

Service was a little erratic. To begin with they were very attentive. Once they had our orders though, they disappeared. It was sort of hit and miss from then on.

I like the decor here. It's very Japanese with a modern (some might say distinctly San Francisco) twist to it. Clean and not smelly to my nose. :P
author: Wes T.

description: Really bad service at the bar. They make you seem like you are a low life spending a million dollars for their foods and drinks. However, at the restaurant table, they treat you like a king. Very pretentious but so convenient because of their location.
author: Amy W.

description:
All dolled up. 

Where are we meeting those clients again? Sushi? OK. I guess.

I love it when I have no idea what to expect.

Great looking bar and set up. This place is HUGE. 

The Ozumo staff went above and beyond. They put us in the private room where you remove your shoes before sitting. Even though they tried to rush us at one point, I still felt it was cool that they gave us a table that had a reservation. Everything worked out b/c the patrons were running late and we got to relax a little bit longer.

They had mulitple waiters bring our food and drinks. 

Hamachi, tuna tataki and Kobe beef were amazing. I can't believe we had left overs. 

Everything we had was ordered in pairs of 2. Damn..I'm in the wrong industry. Sales people live like KINGS!!!
author: Lily M.

description: Great place for Business Sushi. Really extensive Sake list!
author: Sarah N.

description:
Definitely not your local sushi bar.  Food is incredibly fresh, served in a great location near the bay.  Lots of variety, so if you cant find what you want, ask the helpful, and plentiful staff and they are very accommodating.  I am not a sake fan, simply because I dont know much about it, but we were served several that were fantastic.  Damn it, now if I could just remember their names.  

Not inexpensive, like everything in that area of San Francisco, but overall worth a visit.
author: Felipe M.

description:
I can t remember what roll we had, but mostly it was good. I was just really disappointed with the day boat scallop and something puree(impossible to eat with chopsticks..). The dish was over $20, and yeah the plate was big, but the food itself must have take one-tenth of the entire surface of the plate. Meh..
Thanks to our nice waiter and to their impressive sake list, I actually left with a smile on my face.. Don't know if I'll be back though..
author: Alice G.

description: The sushi is always great here! Just wish the prices were a little lower so we could go more often.
author: Jon H.

description:
Packed to the gills (yes pun intended) with business folks. The night I was here the wait staff was a bit confused on how to work with our table of 5. Three people came by and started off like they were going to take care of us. After they worked through that confusion things went down like clockwork. 

The menu was extensive and they do have a remarkable sake collection. Pretty high end stuff but all great quality. We ordered the typical things one would with a group and everything was extremely tasty and well prepared. 

Really the only negative thing about this place is the massive amount of ego driven guests. I mean at one point I felt like I would rather choke on a pair of cufflinks than sit and watch 7 guys try pathetically hold the attention of the their attractive waitress.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Fantastic food!! We sat at the bar (very cool ambiance).  The bartender who took our orders was great.

Spent more than I expected as each order of food was do good, we had to try something else.
author: Lyndsey F.

description:
Took my clients here for a sushi making class. Sarah Eckersley (who works in events at Ozumo) was SO HELPFUL in setting everything up and came by multiple times to check in on us, which was so great of her. She really was a huge pleasure to work with. Charlie was THE BEST sushi chef you could ask for. He did a wonderful job of teaching us how to make sushi and kept it fun and interesting too! I will definitely be back!

Update: I've done multiple sushi events here with clients and they've all been wonderful.
author: Katherine L.

description:
Went to this place only because Marissa Mayer tweeted it's the best. http://twitter.com/#!/marissamayer/status/56596582925221888

I mean this girl looks amazing, #7 or something like that in google, I always have the feeling like she is the one behind the good products of google, a loyal  Oscar de la Renta costumer, she should know about sushi, but no.

we went for lunch, I took the mifune bento box - a combination of sushi and nigiri, and my friend the kube burger bento.

The waiter started by asking us if we would like some edamame to start with, we said sure, why not.

Why not? we don't know why, but apparently there is some reason, we never got it. Maybe he asked just to be nice? maybe they don't serve that dish? who knows?

My friend got his bento box, and the waiter said mine is coming in a few minutes. 

15 minutes later, when my friend almost finished his, I asked the waiter what's going on? Oh, he will check, he forgot! the bento was waiting for me on the counter - really with 5 tables and 5 waiters he forgot? Isn't this is exactly what he supposed to do - to serve the food ordered?

When I ordered my bento I told him I don't eat unagi - so please no eel. he said no problem, no eel. When I got my bento finally - guess what? there was eel! he said he will replace it. 5 minutes later and more than 30 minutes since we sat, I was finally able to have my lunch bento. 

The sushi was just fine, I could have some better in Japantown or any other place - we are in San Francisco after all...

So it was one the worst services I've ever had.

The design of the restaurant is pretty and the view is nice. Other than that stay away. 

I am definitely going to check her husband recommendation for Ryoko, but from Marissa I will take only non food related advises from now on.
author: Too M.

description:
I took my parents to Ozumo to celebrate their wedding anniversary, and as expected, we had an excellent time! 

The toro melted in our mouths, and was so richly decadent that it tasted like it had been soaked in clarified butter... of course, the extensive sake selection didn't hurt. ;) The sashimi was great, as was the kobe beef - been there a few times now, and I'd definitely go back!

mahalo!
author: Doris P.

description: First of all make sure to start with the garlic edamame. Was there with a group of 10. The waitstaff was great. They gave many great recommendations for sushi. We shared and enjoyed the food very much. Great atmosphere.
author: R S.

description:
Fancy Japanese restaurant.

Nice variety of food, but not filling, expensive, and not good.  Even something as simple as spicy tuna was not good.  

Try sticking  to just simple sashimi.

Overall:
food: not good
service: slow
price: pricey
atmosphere: hip
author: Minako S.

description:
Yes, it's pricey, but the quality and the services is WELL WORTH IT!!!

If you can splurge (maybe for a special event, or to celebrate a surprise bonus), then do what my husband, our best friends and I did and tell the waiter what we like and don't like, and let them bring the dishes.  EVERYTHING was divine:  the fish was fresh and great quality; the sea bass was melt in your mouth perfect; the tuna tartare was heaven on top of bright green and perfectly ripe avocado; and the seaweed salad was refreshing and perfectly dressed.  

One way to keep the price a bit down is to avoid making the mistake I did and ordering the first recommendation for sake that the waiter (who was great all night) recommended, which, although it was excellent, should have been for $142.  The Asahi was quite perfect with our meal.  :o)

The restaurant is gorgeous, and the bar was a ton of fun.  Go if you don't mind spending the money!
author: Ria D.

description: Long wait to get in even with a reservation. Sat at bar for 1 hour waiting to be seated but they forgot about us. The bartender is nice and the wait staff friendly. Most of the sushi is just ok. But got a couple of really fishy pieces of spicy tuna roll and that's not ok. Not as good as it used to be and way way way overpriced for the quality.
author: Kitty S.

description: I was there with a large group of friends.  The place was packed.  Service was somewhat on the slow side.  Food was ok but on the expensive side.  I think I could have had better value for what I spent there.  Nothing impressed me.
author: DJ L.

description: I ate an early dinner here before returning home from a business trip, and it was some of the best sushi I've ever had. I sat at the bar and asked the chef to make recommendations based on what he thought was particularly good at that time, and he made up a couple off-the-menu rolls on the spot that were fantastic. I saw the "bar scene" side and was not at all interested, I'd say sit at the sushi bar and ignore the dark and noisy side of the restaurant. I personally don't think sushi should be eaten in a stressfully crowded bar with dance music blasting.
author: Brian L.

description: So so sooooooooo amazing! The spicy Ramen has a fantastic flavor, the bento boxes are super generous, the curry is unique! and the waiters are incredibly friendly. You're getting amazing food for a good price. Oh, and the sushi is a pretty good quality too :) shout out to my waiter Robert!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
Atmosphere to this place was beautiful, fun and upbeat. The place was packed when we arrived so, you expect to wait. We had reservations and still had to wait close to an hour. Thank GOD! I have good company.

The food was super yummy.  We ordered the Maguro, Sashimi, can't recall the name of the2 rolls we ordered and a variety of sushi. Nothing really to complain about. :)
author: Jennifer n.

description:
Delicious! 

This is what I recommend and you can thank me later.

For appetizer:
(*) garlic edamame - very good!

For small plates:
(*) hanabi - hamachi sashimi carpaccio with avocado in jalapeno ponzu sauce
(*) futago - thinly sliced beef tenderloin with spinach and eggplant

For main dish: 
(*) gindara - miso glazed black cod

I wouldn't  order the seaweed salad because it's very average tasting. Also, I'd pass on the dark chocolate pot de creme because it's more like pudding. 

Overall, great food and service. I like the sushi bar area too because there's a view of the bay bridge and embarcadero.
author: Helen Y.

description:
3.5 stars to be real...extra 0.5 for the cool factor.

The space is really cool and definitely a "fun" vibe all around.  The bar in the front is good for drinks and meeting up and the big dining room in the back is brighter and more casual.

Pros:
-Friendly service (although not always the best at remembering orders, ex: forgot our sekiwake roll and gave us hotate nigiri instead of the seared day boat scallops entree, and when we re-ordered the scallops entree didn't even realize that we were correcting the snafu)
-Good sashimi/nigiri list (red snapper is yummmmy!)
-Good grilled mushrooms skewers
-Good heirloom tomato salad
-Good cocktails (+ on the Aka Lotus)

Cons:
-Entrees are so-so in comparison to small plates/fish
-My gyu don (steak over rice) was not tender
-Scallops entree was tasty but not awesome
-Way overpriced dessert: $6 for ONE ice cream filled mochi
-Green tea ice cream + chocolate sauce + plain mochi + azuki beans = really bland, boring, disappointing dessert
author: Priscilla T.

description:
They have a DJ on some Fridays in the bar area.  Gone here for drinks after work a few times and the bartendars are always super friendly, quick, and helpful. 

Definitely a great place for good food and strong drinks.  =)
author: Vicky T.

description: Couldn't ask for better sushi or service. Reasonably priced considering location and type of food.
author: Jordan F.

description:
The freshest sushi I have EVER had. And I've had a lot. The rolls are amazing (tho they are TINY) and the Kobe beef was like butter.

Only complaint is that I think our server forgot to order out main douse, as it took 90 minutes after our appetizers came out to get it. He blamed it on the kitchen, but after serving for six years, i could tell it was his fault. Dude, just apologize and own your mistake. Food was excellent, service was meh.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
This place has great aesthetics, and is an enjoyable place to have a dinner. In addition, the bar seemed pretty crackin, although I was not out to drink that night. If I was, my review would probably be a four or five star =P.

The food is cooked very well, but the portions are small, and in some cases the visual aesthetics are priority over flavor. The appetizers are awesome, though. The yellowfin tuna himachi was ridiculously good, and there was an Ahi tuna tartar served with fried gyoza chips (essentially a Japanese 7-layer dip) that would make you cream your pants.

Unfortunately, the main courses were disappointing. I had a duck fillet stuffed with onions, and served on a peculiar wooden charcoal-burning plate. It looked like it was going to taste really good, but the duck was bland and the onion inside was undercooked. I tried the dishes that everyone else in my party had ordered, and they were clearly not worth $40. 

All in all, if you want a classy place to eat appetizers and get smashed off of sake, skip the conventional tapas place and go here. If you want a classy Asian-fusion dinner for a date or special occasion, try out Tommy Toy's ( I haven't been there, but my picky French friend has and raves about it).
author: J R.

description:
didn't expect much from Ozumo.  Looked like a cookie cut from the Koi cookie sheet.  But the food was overall really solid.  Some of the fish was hit or miss, but for the most part...they were hits.  

all the fun rolls and dishes were exceptional.  Not the most authentic Japanese food out there, but definitely worth checking out if you want to spend a bit more money than usual on decor.
author: Lawrence C.

description: Overpriced, mediocre rolls, annoyingly arrogant servers. $100 special uni plate was, eh, not so special. Only giving them an extra star for the extensive sake collection.
author: Amelia C.

description:
I give up...just can't resist their drinks.

Delicious lychee martini (extra juice).  Yes, and that same day I walked my friend's Pomeranian for 30 minutes. And yes, I'm very comfortable with that.

Sushi's is forgettable, better than safeway, pales in comparison to Ebisu (9th and Irving).  I'd take a day old 49'er Roll at Ebisu over their entire Chef's Selection any day.

4 Stats for the great ambiance.  DJ, decor, lighting, all very relaxing after a long day and they always have the playoffs on the flatscreen.

I prefer this place after a long day at the office, usually around 8, because at 5 or 6, it's shoulder to shoulder.
author: Mike V.

description:
My family, boyfriend and I attempted to dine at Ozumo this weekend, but our hopes were dashed by a snooty hostess and conflicting instructions.

We arrived a little before 9pm on Saturday and were met by the doorman who was very nice - he greeted us, handed over a menu, and everything looked great.  After entering we were told by the hostess that part of the restaruant was reserved, but we would be able to find seating in the bar area where it was "first come, first serve".  A few laps around the bar quickly revealed that nothing would be available for a while, but then my parents spotted some open seats at a sushi bar just a few feet from the main bar.

Not sure if these were part of the reserved area, my father and boyfriend walked over to the seats and flagged down a waitress to ask her if we could sit there while I continued to look for seating around the bar.  The waitress went off to talk with the hostess, then the hostess tracked me down at the bar to say "only the bar/lounge is available right now" before turning heel and walking away.  How were my boyfriend and dad supposed to know that:

a) The sushi bar is not a part of the lounge
b) Four empty seats set for guests would not be open to us?  

I finally found a table in the stuffy bar/lounge and sat down.  Unfortunately, it is so dark that I couldn't see the "reserved" sign on on the table and a waitress informs me the table is taken; I get up wondering what happened to "first come, first serve"?  Meanwhile, no one on the staff has gone to tell me dad and boyfriend that they cannot sit at the sushi bar and they are still standing by open seats waiting for a response.  At that point I had enough, as I grabbed them to leave the restaurant I was again confronted by a now very agitated, sour-faced hostess, "only the bar/lounge is available right now," and she walks away again.

They say one bad apple can ruin the bunch and Oaumo's sour hostess definitely ruined any chance of us returning there.  If rude staff and cramped bars are your thing, Ozumo is for you ... otherwise: Stay Away!
author: Robyn Y.

description: Paid $20 for a fried crab roll. SUPER, over-priced, along with the rest of the menu. Only worth it if you're going on your company's dime. Will not be revisiting otherwise.
author: E Z.

description:
As I gingerly stepped over the threshold, waiting for me was an ultra chic, dimly lit lounge that epitomizes the amelioration Japanese decor have taken in the last decade.

Radically sleek, immoderately contemporary and violently hip is what's become of most trendy Japanese eateries. Acclimation is key to avoiding total domination.

Beautiful adorned confines, meant to overly stimulate the eyes but not the most importunate of senses, your mouth.

The moral of this story, come to be seen [the end].
author: Lisa W.

description:
I love to sit at the bar and order a "Geisha Moon"...such a refreshing cocktail made with Lychee puree, Vodka, and Grapefruit juice...I believe(don't always know what I'm drinking). This is not just your regular neighborhood sushi bar mind you...expect a little more. They have a DJ nightly that spins instrumental mood music, nothing distracting or too loud. Amazing service...they pretty much cater to your every whim. I also get a major kick out of the Japanese language tapes that play in the restrooms, it's especially funny when you've thrown back a few drinks! Worth a visit!

*update* 12/8/6
They changed the name of my favorite drink...it's now called a "Giddy Geisha"...whatever.
author: Malika K.

description:
The view of the Bay bridge in the main dining room can't be explained. It's one of the most beautiful sights I've ever experienced. The vibe & decor here is very dark & loungy so an intimate dinner is what your going to get or if your in the main dining room a fun group setting. 

There's a bar right up front with bench seating that's very cozy for sitting close. Def a must see.
author: Vanessa X.

description: Food was eatable but not good. Service was behind and waiters seemed confused. The ambiance is nice but there are much better japanese restaurants in SF
author: Shari S.

description:
UGH, This place is so freaking good. They have really high quality sushi and they have good service. I love their drinks and can come here anytime I want. I like the location and everything.

The bathrooms are very clean, I love to use them after a lovely quaint and filling meal.
author: Christian L.

description: The sushi is fresh, as you would expect with the high price. The seaweed salad was different than I've had before but still very good. If you are a "specialty rolls" kind of person, this is not really your place. Instead I'd recommend the Flying Ninja near the wharf. Don't think I'll be back to this place, as it's hard to justify the high price for slightly above average food.
author: Eric S.

description: Great food, nice atmosphere & awesome service by waiter named Elliot. Prices are on the high side but you get what you pay for, in this case its high quality Japanese food.  Great place for a date too.
author: K L.

description: my husband took me here on our first date so there's a special place in my heart for this place.  I enjoy sitting in the bar area and ordering a martini and sushi.  It's the best sushi in SF and the price reflects it.  I've had dinner here, but the sushi bar is my preference.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Love this place. now I've been twice! It was the 1st place I had sparkling Saka!! I'm in LOVE with it.. hehe The service is fast and very friendly. 
Also when you check in on Foursquare you get FREE Edams!! The amount of food on each plate is perfect for 2 to split. It lets you taste a bit of everything on the menu!!
author: lorrin S.

description: 3rd time eating here and it seems every time my experience goes down slightly. I noticed its no where as busy as it use to be as well. I was not a fan of the uni rossoto and our server didnt really come back to check on us that much... but over all i still like the ambiance of the restaurant and its a good loungy date place to go
author: Bobby P.

description:
Have been the fortunate beneficiary of a few biz lunches here.  I really like the fish freshness, diversity of the menu, that the rolls aren't too rice-y.  Never leave with an inflated rice baby in my stomach like many a sushi outing.  The different parts of the establishment are night & day.  So dark & 'romantic' in the bar area - opt for the light-filled front room when with colleagues. 

Unclear if I would pay for this on my own dime.  Not crazy costly, but over my measly lunch budget.
author: Talia R.

description:
I've been to Ozumo many times, and as a Japanese restaurant, it's a decent choice that won't disappoint.  In general, the food and service are good, although the prices are a little high.

But I tried Ozumo for lunch, and their soba noodles are an awesome find!  Not only are they flavorful with good portions (i.e. not too much, not too little), but they are reasonably priced at about $8-11 each.  I had the Kara-age Soba, which has fried chicken pieces on top of the soba noodles in a soy-based sauce.

PRO
- Soba noodles are delicious!
- Not busy during lunch
- Full bar with a very long sake menu

CON
- A little pricey, but not bad at lunch
- TVs in the lounge are a little small for watching games
author: Drew P.

description:
Can I say kudos for the Mashed Potatoes!  Japanese with a fully loaded bar and a twist!  Nice to have another option vs. the sticky rice!

Food is always good.  Try people watching here it's fun but certainly not cheap!!


Romance Factor:  7
Hobnob Potential:  7
Destination Rating:  4

Excellent location for a post dinner romantic stroll pretty close to the water!
author: Megan C.

description:
Not a bad venue, especially when looking to just hang out in the dimmed peach lighting and look good at any angle.  I like the layout of the bar, with lounge chairs and the 90-degree angles throughout.

Move upwards, and it opens up into a restaurant serving pretty expensive sushi.  I don't think the dishes here are that inventive or inspired, but after a good sake martini, the hamachi sushi feels quite divine on burnt lips.

Service was excellent, as we were seated immediately.  I think it helped that my friend knew the hostess  ;o)
author: Miika M.

description:
Their edamame was too salty and their sushi was warm. I have never had warm sushi, but it tasted wrong. Isn't it supposed to be served cold??

3 stars because it was nice ambiance. Oh, and our waitress was a complete BITCH!!
author: Kathy S.

description:
This is hands down the best sushi place in San Francisco, and one of my favorite restaurants here.  The drinks are delicious too. I always order their lychee martini drink and it is fabulous, I could drink them all night. 

I recommend going there on a Friday or Saturday night because the atmosphere is fun.  Lots of young people at the bar, and if you are lucky enough to score a table in the bar area you are winning. They do serve a full dinner menu at the bar.  

Yes Ozumos is pricey but well worth it.  The scallop dish I had there was one of the best scallop dishes I have ever had. I also realy like their sashimi dishes.  There is depth to their dishes and it's very enjoyable. The staff is friendly and professional.  The restaurant is clean and beautiful.  I love the Japanese language lessons that play in the bathrooms.  

Leave the kids at home if you go here, and enjoy a nice and fun night out!
author: Ivanna C.

description:
Ozumo is a great place to grab a drink and a few appetizers with friends.  Lively ambiance, beautiful decor  - on a nice sunny day, my coworkers and I had a table next to an open window, so you could get a nice breeze and a beautiful view of the bay bridge. It was impressive.

I think the cooked appetizers were pretty good (potsickers, shrimp tempura, edamame), and the hanabi appetizer was awesome, but I was disappointed by the sushi.  The nigiri sushi was fresh, but nothing special, especially for the price.  The sushi rolls were on the small side and nothing to write home about.  We ordered a few basic rolls (e.g. rainbow or spider) and a few more fun rolls (jalepeno yellowtail) and they were all quite underwhelming. 

I will likely be back, but probably only I have to stay near my office and someone else is footing the bill.
author: Marie K.

description:
Okay, first things first, dear god this place is expensive.

With that out of the way, their sushi is unreal. I like to pretend I am really into sushi. Sometimes I even play make-believe that I am a snob about it [I don't actually know anything]. I feel like I haven't really been eating sushi until I came here, though. The fish was obviously extremely fresh and was easily of the best tasting fish I have ever had.

My sister and I came here as a goodbye dinner for me moving away from the bay area. I was drawn in by the beautiful food pictures on their website (seriously, go look). We were seated near the back - this place is significantly larger inside that I thought it would be. Our waitress (Charlie), was very helpful in picking out items off of the menu (which is rather lengthy). She helped us pick out a couple of cocktails to start - I got the [I may not remember this name right] Hachi-ban (a whisky-based drink with grenadine and friends) and my sister got a cucumber-based cocktail. My drink was pretty good, and my sister's was great.

Charlie then ran us through some of her recommendations, and we decided on three sushi rolls to start. We got the Ozumo roll, the Sekiwake roll, and one of the specials whose name escapes me. We were very impressed with the quality and flavor of the fish. After finishing those, we ordered the salmon belly nagiri, as well as another roll (which had mango in it - surprisingly good). Additionally we wanted to split a bottle of sake. We are both pretty clueless about what sakes are good, and they have an extremely large selection of sakes. Charlie helped us navigate the waters (sakes?) of the menu, and picked out three for us to choose from. The one we decided on was quite good. I'm not much of a sake drinker, so my opinion is pretty meaningless, though.

After finishing our second round of food, we decided to go for dessert. I got the Peanut Butter Mousse, and my sister got the Choco Chan. Both were very good.

At the end of the dinner, the bill was astronomically high. That is expected, though. Good place for a very special occasion, highly recommended.
author: Ryan C.

description: Last week I was meeting friends for sushi here. It was my first time as I heard they hv great sushi. It was indeed!! Also loved the lounge area. Nice bar/atmosphere/music. I enjoyed it a lot and even decided to have my sister's birthday here. Everybody loved the food and the ambiance. You hv to check this place.
author: Nathalie H.

description: It was fantastic. My favorite dish was the steak slices. I had the multi-course dinner option which basically had everything in the menu, and it was amazing.
author: Dennis D.

description:
KF finally experienced Ozumo!

I came with a friend after work today for a not-so-prompt 5:00 happy hour. The Mary Jane's were killing my feet... but the walk from my office was lovely per usual. I do believe I arrived around 5:16. Oh well, oh well...

We got some rolls (only $5 during HH!) and I had a delicious cucumber cocktail. The sushi wasn't the best I have had in the city, but honestly... it's Ozumo. The decor is interesting yet simplistic, and I definitely plan to come back for a birthday celebration or something like that. 5:00 wasn't a busy time, which is too bad... this is a great happy hour.

I'll update when something funny or ridiculous happens.
author: Kristin F.

description: Great sushi & great atmosphere! I wish we remembered our servers name cause she was awesome! Very cute petite blond working the bar tables
author: Danielle D.

description:
Sake Sake Sake! Food is decent, but when I get back to the city late and I need a power meal and a good drink I'll park and walk 5 blocks to have some unfiltered junmaishu style sakes. I could drink Chikurin all night. Bento box is the way to go at this spot.

Have not tried Oakland location yet, look forward to it...
author: Arron C.

description: Great service, amazing sushi and presentation. The staff is very nice and accommodating and great at making recommendations. We sat in a private room, and enjoyed that we took our shoes off for a more authentic experience. Great place!
author: Michael A.

description:
I love this place. Probably one of my favorite fancier sushi places in the city, however I will admit, it is a bit pricey, probably a bit over priced.

I've always loved the atmosphere at Ozumo's. I love the big open windows in the dining area.  The last time I went I had Rebecca as my server, she was awesome and we bonded over having the same name.  She was great despite the fact that our miso soup somehow got lost and never made it to our table.

The hamachi with avocado and yuzu sauce is amazing. I get this every time I go. We also ordered sashimi which was so fresh and amazing. The Toro just melted in your mouth;  well, with the price tag that came with it, it better have been fabulous.  We couldn't decide between what type of salmon sashimi to order so Rebecca was awesome enough to offer two pieces of each type even though it wasn't on the menu.  The salmon belly was so good and I would have never tried it if it wasn't for her.

So, overall, it's a great place for a special occasion.  The atmosphere is nice and the fish is always fresh.  I wish I didn't have such expensive taste in fish, it reeks havoc on my wallet.
author: Becca L.

description:
We really like this restaurant, less for the "sashimi" style cuts, but more for its overall well roundedness.  You can get amazing black cod, amazing tuna tartare w/ avocado, and really good rolls.  We aren't super impressed with the cuts of sashimi, but we can look past it.  The chocolate fondue desert (with fruit) is amazing.  So you may ask why I gave this place 5 stars?

Well, the location is simply stunning.  When we make a reservation, we sometimes get one of the spectacular tables with a view of the bay bridge.  We love that.  

We also thinks the service from Mel is really stellar.  I think he uses the right judgement on situations and always come through to make us as happy as can be when we leave.  We can't ask for anything more in terms of service from him.  

We always leave this place happy.  Sure, it's expensive, but sushi in the city is expensive, so we know that going into it.

It seems like a lot of people either love or hate this place, so my recommendation is try it for yourself.  They are sure to make you happy.
author: Melanie W.

description: went here for V-Day with my boyfriend. Best Sushi ive ever had. hands down. I got the Dragon roll and some saki and a martini. Everything was great. its expensive but its great for a special occasion every now and then
author: Shelby H.

description:
Number 1 sushi in SF! I'm always satisfied each time I'm here! Mel is awesome, and Sushi Chef Charlie is wonderful! :0) hooray for sushi!

The fish here is very fresh, and oh so mouthwatering tender. You tell Charlie what you like, and he makes every dish a perfection. 

You can't have sushi without some SAKE, and what about the house OZUMO sake? We have it each time we dine in, and a meal isn't complete unless we share some SAKE with the sushi chefs behind the counter. Sharing drinks and saluting everyone is what makes the experience much merrier!

Nice, elegant, warm and cozy decor. They have gotten some new chairs in a few months ago. Makes me feel that much taller while sitting down :) Exceptional service, wonderful food! THUMBS UP!
author: Sweet P.

description: Absolutely amazing. Everything was great; the wine, the service, and especially the food. Be prepared to cringe at the sight of the bill, but believe me when I say that every dollar was worth it (being a poor graduate student, that says a bunch). I'd definitely love to go here again, and just order sushi roll after roll after roll.
author: Alejandro S.

description: Great atmosphere.  A somewhat hip place for happy hours.  Dinner entries are predictably good.  Definitely try their uni.  The freshest in town!
author: Kristen S.

description:
Five Stars?!?!  Yes.

If you have tried their Kobe Ribeye Steak, you will know why.  I've been on a mission to find the best steak in the world, and though i haven't had much meat outside of this country, this menu item could probably stackup with the best--and at a place i had originally intended to have sushi at.

Sake List is ridiculously long...like so long that you wonder if they didn't just make a mistake and print the list out 10 times back to back just to make it look like they have a big selection.  They pretty much have it all and you will not be disappointed.  I was impressed at the knowledge of the server who had an opinion on all the sake variations.  For the ones we finally tried, he was right on!

The only downer is that this place will put a hurt on your pocketbook.  I think the steak i had was about $40, and it wasn't one of those 32 oz. steaks either...but the quality was excellent.

This is a great date place because it's social, hip, a little noisy but not too bad, and right along the embarcadero for a nice evening stroll afterwards.

Happy Eating...and strolling!
author: Bradley H.

description:
Heard a lot of hype aboout it, but was not impressed.  I went here for lunch and got the Sake bento ($14).  The grilled salmon was good, but the rest of the bento box items were mediocre and at most ordinary.  Edname, salad, rice, and sliced oranges for fruit.  What was so special about THAT?  Nothing.  I expect a little more flair for the price, but nah.  I'd rather put in an extra few bucks and go to Kyo-ya where each little dish is done right.  

The chairs are upholstered and are very light colored and usually have spots on them.  What a shame for a nice restaurant like that.  Great view of the Embarcadero and Bay bridge if you're lucky to be seated near the windows.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
Ozumo has great food and can have atmosphere with the correct table.  Some tables here are REALLY bad,  Make reservations. 
Ozumo is also very expensive. It s hard to order multiple rolls ( I crave VARIETY in my food) without spending a fortune.  Some of the Sakes can run you in the double digits a glass.  However, the fish is fresh, the rolls are inventive and delicious.  I love the Sashimi platter here; it is quite large and filled with good choices.
author: Katharine A.

description:
Great food and good service...interesting cocktails at the bar before reaching the actual restaurant (Amamizu - Cucumber wasabe sake vodka lime juice was really good). 
Hitsuji (Lamb 2 ways) and Gyu Kakuni (brasied short ribs) are a must if you are a meat eater. Great sushi and very creative menu. 
Great decor but quite noisy. Clean presentations. Try it
author: Eric F.

description:
3 stars are for the atmosphere,  very cozy, great server, very nicely decorated.  The way they set the foods and decorated on the plate are pretty!
We would come here again if the foods taste better also the price is high for so small portions.  We ve tasted better at other place with more portion we had.
author: Heidi D.

description:
I've been here a handful of times and each time, the food is tasty! Towards the later part of the nights, they usually bump up the music really loud...almost as if it was a club/bar.  So if you want to eat in peace, come in before 9pm.  

Usual menu suspects:
- Age Dashi Tofu
- Tempura Yasai
- Miso Soup
- Kaiso Seaweed Salad
- Futago (one of my faves - so good here!)
- Ozumo Roll
- Dragon Roll

Good food and good service.
author: Cindy T.

description:
The fish quality here are awesome-- probably the best quality I've ever had.

We had the hamachi toro (belly of yellowtail) nigiri.  It was pricey-- about $16 for two pieces, i think?  But it just melts in your mouth!

I've consciously judged and rated sushi for the past 10+ years (my whole family is a sushi buff), but until this past week I didn't realize that there really was a significant step in quality.  It makes you resent the years spent meddling with mediocrity.

It's a true 5 star ranking!

Expect to spend about $35/pax, before drinks.
author: Eugene L.

description:
The fish was excellent as was the wine. A little pricey but I was there for work so I was not paying anyway. So cool enough. I liked that it was not crazy crowded or noisy so we could do the business meeting over a good meal. 

Now this one server. So adorable. That is what I told her too. When I walked in to the place, I just started following her. Couldn't help it, she was so cute. She was not taking me to my table but I didn't care much. Would have followed her around like a puppy all night if I could.  Geez I was trying to buy a company over dinner and I just kept looking up for her, I felt so bad for the CEO of the company I was eating with.  He deserved my full attention but I just could not.  Anyway, I thought we were going to connect but her shift apparently ended and she was gone without even saying goodbye. Sad puppy dog eyes for me.  We men are such fools I guess. I won't write her name, but me and my geometric glasses won't forget it either.  Five stars and a broken heart : (
author: Paul S.

description: Ate here today for a business luncheon and it was magnificent! Great sushi, fresh and attentive service. The view is the best!
author: James W.

description:
First time here and I was impressed.  The decor is very cozy up-scale.  Great for groups or a nice dinner date.  The fish is FRESH.  Four of us just ordered numerous small plates to share.  We had about 10 dishes and all of us were full by the end.  Portion sizes were decent; each dish came in 4 servings which was convenient.  I loved the sea bass! It just melted in your mouth.  The beef on the other hand was just overly salty.  The fish dishes were obviously the best.

We did order a few drinks as well.  The Tokyo something was intensely sweet (not just because of the thick sugar rim around the cup) and the Giddy Geisha was just watered down.  Neither of the drinks had that kick (if you know what I mean).

Overall, pricey but then again it's SF. You're going mainly for the ambiance and social setting.  The waiters were attentive, although towards the end when we were noticeably done with our mean (everything cleared out), it took at least 10-15 minutes to get the bill.  And this is while the crowd was dying down.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I've been here many times.  The sushi is well done with a few unique rolls and cooked food preparations.  The hamichi kama was some of the best I've had in SF.  Latest trip was on a Friday.  DJ playing techo/electronica/groove at the bar and a good scene- not too crowded or too loud.  Good cocktails and very good wait staff.

Dinner was for 9 without a reservation- we had no plans and migrated from the bar yet we scored the private, Japanese sitting table just off the lounge area.  Good thing since the main dining room is a bit too loud to talk to someone more than one seat away.

With 9 people we ordered  a large variety of sushi one no disappointments.  Not the top sushi in SF but a great combination of ambiance, good service, and the size of the place gives you a chance to get a seat on a whim.

Wine list is way overpriced.  Some good choices but the markups are 300% and higher.  Stick to beer and saki or watch the register tilt.
author: John D.

description: They sure do pack the seating in this place...and it's the biggest sushi place I've ever been to.  They could separate the tables a little bit.  My party sat at the sushi bar in the back and some lady kept hitting my chair from sitting at the table behind me.  Although, I've noticed that seems to be the trend here in San Francisco...so anyways.  The chef was awesome.  He made some good small talk and was very attentive.  I wish we could say the same for our server.  We would wait 15 minutes for drinks. The food is phenomenal and presentation (which is probably my favorite thing about sushi) was great.
author: Maggie G.

description:
I was first introduced to Ozumo's food at the 2011 Wine & Wishes Charity Event (shout out to Mai-gf for taking me).  Had a couple of bites of sushi appetizers and when another gf visiting from out-of-town wanted Japanese food for dinner...Ozumo came to mind.

Dinner was delightful.  Ambiance in the resto is nice, esp if you're on a date, but when you're out with girlfriends..it'd be nice if the lighting was just a tad brighter.  Beyond that, I loved the menu offerings - so much to choose from (but may be hard to decide).

I started with the Hanabi (slices of hamachi & avocado drizzled with a warm ginger & jalapeno ponzu sauce) and that revved up my tastbuds.  Then I moved on to the Gyu Filet (grilled prime filet mignon with bacon-wrapped green beans, shiitake mushrooms & arima sansho sauce) and it was cooked exactly to my liking.  It was sooo good that I devoured everything on my plate.  Finally, I rounded out the meal with the Banana Bread Pudding and boy was that a treat!!!  

When can I go again and who wants to come with me???
author: Aurelie N.

description:
Ive been here a few times and each time I am truly amazed. I visited this weekend, for drinks with a friend and ended up having a full on meal. We sat at the bar and were served right away. We had a pretty bartender by the name of Kalia who was very attentive and suggestive to different sakes and martinis.(Bartender Matt was also knowledgeable of Sakes) The drinks were delightful, and the food was delicious. 

I highly suggest the garlic edamame as an appetizer.(Yes they are garlic, but very non-threatening to your breath)

Each time Ive eaten here, I have been pleasantly suprised. The view is incredible with upbeat music going on in the background.
author: Hillary H.

description:
This place deserves an A+ for decor, vibe and phenomenal sushi. Bring a date or friends from out of town to impress (but expect to pay the price for the trendiness!). 

Favorite Rolls: Sekiwake (spicy tuna with salmon), Bucho (tempura shrimp roll), and obviously the Dragon roll.

Great cocktails selection. Wait staff is attentive. 

Tip: Make a reservation.
author: Alisa A.

description:
This place is very overpriced for the portions of sushi they serve at your table!

You will need to order doubles of everything to  feel satisfied.

The only positive = ambiance.

Verdict = Pick another spot and I will never return!
author: James K.

description:
I would give it 4 stars for the sushi, but only 3 stars for the price. I honestly think sushi here is good, but it is much too expensive for the good. I think mostly you are paying for the presentation and the atmosphere, both are very nice. In the end if you want high end sushi and the show and pizazz, you will definitely find it here. If you want good sushi, you will definitely be able to find it for 1/3 of the price elsewhere.

Great bar area though.

Oh, one note DON'T VALET YOUR CAR.  They run your cars into the curb so if you have a lowered car at all beware ... it will be damaged/scratched/
author: Lorrie M.

description:
We stopped by Ozumo on our way home from lunch last week to order a platter of sushi for a cocktail party we were throwing later that night. 

The interior is really cool, and I mean cool. It's a ton of rich, dark wood carved in interesting ways and the floor is beautiful. The location just strikes me as really hip, and it's an incredible work of design (if you're into that sort of thing). 

When we first walked in the door, the woman at the host stand was largely uncooperative and rude, even though we literally walked in and said we were interested in buying a large ($300) platter and didn't need to be sold on it. She's the only reason that this place is getting four stars instead of five. When we persisted, however, she went and got the manager, who was just great. 

The manager was able to alter one of their preset platters for us to give us exactly what we wanted, and she was even willing to deliver the platter straight to our apartment later that afternoon, just in time for the party. 

The sushi itself was beautiful, extraordinarily fresh, and just *good.* It can be hard to find good sushi, but this definitely qualifies. The next time I'm looking to go out for Japanese food in the city, this place is at the top of my list.
author: Stephanie W.

description: I have eaten at ozumo twice before with excellent results, however this third time was incredible. Our server, Saul, was so attentive, and we conversed on the availability of kobe/washu at ozumo, even going to far as to offering washu as an option for our osusume. I had never paired sake with my meal, yet Saul brought us two expert options for the middle and last courses, an absolute delight. His knowledge and attention to service symbolizes the quality that brings me back to ozumo. I must have Saul again when I come back in March for my anniversary dinner with my partner.
author: Sean-Franc S.

description:
I've never had any food here, just Happy Hour drinking after work.

Yummy nigori sake for $5 during happy hour.  They also have well priced hand rolls and stuff, although the last time I was there I didn't get to order any.

The waitress was really nice, we met our coworkers who have been there for a while at exactly 6, which technically was the end of happy hour, but they still served us a round of drinks at happy hour price.  Score!

I can't wait to go and get some food there along with my nigori.
author: Cindy C.

description:
Things that stood out:

- VERY fresh uni. 
My fav for the night. However, I wish they made the pieces a little wider because both pieces didn't hold all the uni in them. We had to take it in 2 bites because it kept falling off.

- Must try the tuna tataki. 
Comes with 5 or 6 slices of tuna. Everything in this dish just works.

- Hanabi was also really yummy. 
Its hamachi and avocado with warm ginger and jalepeno ponzu sauce. 

Note on nigiri: They put wasabi inside.
author: Angelica P.

description: Cool HH after work spot. Met some friends here after work on a HOT summer SF day. No AC inside (typical SF building) so drank about a gallon of water along with my lychee martini. Yum. Great spot to meet friends and have a cocktail and some appies. The bar area is spacious with lots of tables and seats at the bar. Apparently HH ends early so the crowd dies down around 6:30-7pm.
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Just to clarify this ahead of time, my review is based on two sushi rolls, which in my opinion, only moderately constitutes a review.  Anyway, I made a reservation here ahead of time with one of my girlfriends for dinner at 8pm.  When we walked in, it looked like the bar was pretty busy with trendy people.  Almost reminded me of something you'd see in LA: trendy sushi place, attractive people at the bar, swanky music playing.  As we walked back towards the restaurant (which is HUGE by the way), it mellowed out and was instead filled with people out on business dinners.  When we sat down, we decided on splitting two rolls: the Sekiwake and Hamachi Maki.  Our waitress was a little pushy on getting us to order, but in her defense, we kept talking and didn't look at the menu until about 15 minutes after sitting down.  Anyway, our rolls came out after about 20 minutes, but came out one at a time.  The Hamachi Maki, which was first, was presented beautifully.  The fish was fresh, and the next time I'm here, I'd like to try some of their sashimi (which could be the difference between 4 and 5 stars).  This roll had a little bit of everything that I love: hamachi, avocado, cucumber, tempura flakes, and a little bit of jalapeño!  The second roll, the Sekiwake was my friend's choice, but to be honest, was the other roll I was considering.  This roll, which has spicy tuna, tempura flakes, salmon and hamachi had great flavor and was just spicy enough.  We ate through this pretty quickly and to be honest, I kinda wanted another item, but went against the idea since we were knee deep in conversation.  Ultimately, we just about shut the place down and left around 11pm when the restaurant had all been emptied out.  Overall, my conclusion was that while Ozumo is a little pricey, their presentation and rolls at least make it understandable why it's expensive.  Other places in SF will charge something similar, but then lack in either the freshness or presentation.  Like I've mentioned, I'd like to try Ozumo again when I have the chance to check out some of their sashimi.
author: Lisa I.

description:
:( I really wanted to like Ozumo, I really did. This restaurant seemed so promising, but I was sorely disappointed to find out that the food did not deliver. My meal started off fairly strong but got progressively worse. WHYYY did you guys have the worse, not to mention tiniest, sushi rolls ever? Honestly...I freaking LOOVE sushi. Feed me sushi and you've pretty much got a guarunteed shoe in to a great review but WTF went wrong here? My "special" roll was not so special with literally, I kid you not, mixed motherfucking greens in my roll. You know, the stuff you make a salad with. If I wanted a salad, I would have ordered a salad....

I ordered the:
-garlic edamame
-iced green tea
-pan-seared scallops w/ kaboocha squash dumplings, mushrooms, and uni cream sauce
-special roll topped w/ sake (salmon) and thin lemon slices
-spicy tuna roll

The pan-seared scallops were actually really good. However, both of my sushi rolls were terrible. Unfortunately so, too, considering the fact that I absolutely love the faboosh decor/interior of the restaurant. If I were to describe the overall ambiance of Ozumo, the following words would come to mind: modern, casually classy, trendy, clean, & hip. I will give it up to the staff (+1 star) for their great service & attentiveness. I truly hope the sub-par sushi was a freak incident and maybe I just ordered the wrong thing. I would come back again and give this place one more try (but I definitely would not make the same mistake of ordering those rolls again). Perhaps I'll experiment with an entree next time...womp womp.
author: Denise L.

description:
This place is good for what it is but not great.

The sake selection is amazing, never seen anything like it. 

Food portions are on the smallish side but quality is superb. 

We had the Short Ribs- Excellent
Tataki Salad- Excellent
Ozumo Roll- Good
Calamari - Excellent

Our server was very friendly and attentive.

The hostess was not friendly when I asked to be seated at a different spot from where she placed; us due to a very cold AC vent that was directly overhead of the table. 

Overall great Japanese place.
author: Max N.

description:
Certain aspects of this dinner were really good and others were blah!
Here's the breakdown:

SERVICE: 4 to 4.5 stars! ****
Pretty awesome.  Professionally dressed staff and very friendly, welcoming service.  Everyone greets you!  

FOOD: 3.5 stars! ***
Oysters - Rich, fresh! Yummy! Def deserves 5 stars!!  

Piri - Hama Roll - Roll with asparagus tempura, avocado.. wrapped in soy paper and topped with spicy hamachi.  Wasn't impressed at all.  Not very flavorful.  I love hamachi, but this roll was pretty bland. 2.5 stars!! 

Sashimi special with toro, salmon belly, and ? - Fresh fish.  The toro was really good.  The other two types of fish were OKAY.  The cuts of sashimi were pretty decent.  3 stars!!

Hotate - Pan seared scallops with mushroom risotto - Scallops were really tender and good!  The risotto tasted like sticky rice with mushrooms.  Overall, the risotto was pretty salty though, or else this dish would've been on list of favs!  4 stars!!

Gyu fillet - Grilled angus beef with mushrooms - Cooked to order.  Nothing out of the ordinary.  Again, the sauce was pretty salty.  However, the purple yams on the plate were delicious though! 3.5 stars!!

Desert - warm chocolate & azuki bean mochi w/ green tea ice cream - Awesome desert! The warm chocolate was soo good and complemented the green tea ice cream very well! The mochi was fresh, but I can't say added much flavor to the whole desert.  Just added some diff in texture to the whole desert.  4.5 stars!!

Drinks: Giddy geisha martini - lychee with passion fruit - way too sweet!  not enough liquor! 2 stars!!

ATMOSPHERE: 5 stars!! *****
*Awesome, fun environment.  Front lounge/bar area is extremely nice.  Good music.  Upscale!
*Restaurant area in back is nicely decorated.  Bright, fun.  Not too loud!

PRICE: Pretty pricy!! If you factor the price, this place is not really worth it :P Skip the food, and just grab some drinks!! :D
author: Tramy V.

description:
3.5 stars. I came to Ozumo for one of my best friend's birthdays.  It's on the same block as Boulevard and literally right next to Chaya Brasserie (all very good restaurants), with a nice view of the bay right across the street.

I ordered the salmon belly to start with and iron pot sukiyaki as my main entree.  The sushi was good, and the iron pot was very good.  My friends ordered the short ribs, which were fantastic.  The drinks were all good and the atmosphere is pretty nice, appropriate for a special night out.

Anyway, my only complaint is that our waiter was pretty rude.  The rest of the staff at Ozumo is great, very friendly and accommodating.  It sucks that we got stuck with an unhelpful waiter, who constantly make awkward comments and only checked on us every hour or so... Other than that, Ozumo was decent.  I definitely think it's worth a try at least once, though I'm not a big enough fan to come back very often.
author: Amanda N.

description:
My buddy lost a bet a while back, and I collected by making him take me to Sushi.  We threw out a few places, and settled on Ozumo since neither had been for a while, and the vibe is normally pretty solid.

We had a few of the apps before diving into the sushi.  One, a preparation of duck, was really bad to be perfectly honest.  The other was forgettable.

A few rolls came out as we were tearing through the first bottle of Sake.  There rolls are just OK.  The fish is always very nice, but I think they take understated too far on their rolls.  If I just wanted to taste the fish I would just order sashimi/nigiri, so I'm expecting something more out of a roll.

One bottle down, and we get into the real stuff and start ordering nigiri.  Our server has ALL kinds of suggestions, and she is really selling them, so what the hell, we start ordering.

Second bottle of sake arrives (neither too outrageous, both under $50, but those are the rarity on their menu), as does the nigiri.

There were some absolutely amazing things.  I cannot lie.  From the unbelievable blue fin toro, to the outstanding scallops, spanish mackeral, and several other things I can't even remember that were amazing.  It was really something else, some of the best cuts of fish I have had in the city.

We were stuffed, and a little tipsy.  It was an amazing dinner, something worth a solid rating.  And then......the bill comes.

**BAM**  (Left hook to the body)

**BAM**  (Uppercut)

$400+gratuity!!!!  My g*d.  Next time just roofie me if you are going to do me like that.  It was the worst fleecing I've had in years (and I wasn't even paying!).  I have no problem paying for a meal that price range if it is spectacular and I know what to expect, but this just came out of nowhere.  We really felt taken advantage of on the "recommendations", I mean these are coming out 2 pieces at a time for crying out loud.  Yes we should have asked price each time, but give me a friggen break, other than the Blue Fin Toro, what could have cost that much?

Know what to expect if you are going to order their real fish.  And ask the price of each recommendation.  Just be prepared for an extremely expensive meal of sushi.

My buddy, a true gentleman and scholar, still paid, but I felt so guilty I took him out to dinner the next night.......
author: Andrew M.

description: HH is decent here but the food is not all that cheap. Most of the time it gets crowded so it is hard to go in a group and have a meaningful conversation. Tables get taken fast here. Last time I checked in on foursquare I got free edamame. The rolls were pretty good, but the bill for two came out to over $100.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
What an incredibly lovely experience we had here last night.

My mom gave my partner a gift certificate for his birthday, and we were excited at first - but then we viewed the menu and thought - this won't go very far! We tend to avoid places that are as expensive as Ozumo, since we have spent quite a bit in the past at some similarly-priced restaurants and been very disappointed with the quality, atmosphere and service. We avoided using the card as long as possible, fearing that "the experience" would be awkward for us, pretentious, unpleasant. However, Ozumo is worth every penny, for all of those things. We had one of the most enjoyable and delicious meals I can remember! 

We arrived about fifteen minutes early for our reservation, but were seated immediately at a little table away from noise and bustle. Our hostess was friendly, warm and very sweet - complimented me on my bright pink purse! Our wonderful server, Riley, guided us expertly to the perfect choices, both for our tastes and our budget. 

We are hamachi lovers (although I think this will be the last time we eat this tender, buttery, but highly endangered fish - a perfect farewell) and Riley suggested the Tsukasabotan "Fu-In" Ginjo. The crisp, dry cold sake with green apple notes paired beautifully with the succulent fish. 

We began with some truly outstanding miso soup, and after that had the hanabi small plate - hamachi with slices of perfectly ripe avocado and cherry tomatoes in a warm ginger and jalapeno ponzo sauce. It was so delicious, if we had been at home I would have gotten a spoon to finish it! 

Next, we had veggie tempura. It was perfectly executed, and included (I think!) a slice of lotus root, which was incredibly delicious with a crisp yet creamy texture. This was garnished with a beautiful and very yummy spray of crispy tempura-battered and fried vermicelli - delicate and rich.

This was followed by a big plate of hamachi nigiri and an order of perfectly fresh ikura. As I mentioned before, paired with the Fu-In, a very memorable experience.

We decided to complete our feast with dessert. Riley brought a menu with some very compelling choices of confections and dessert sake. We decided on the chocosan, a slice of warm flourless chocolate cake topped with matcha ice cream and shaved chocolate and surrounded by tiny mochis, and at first selected a dessert sake to share that was described as having qualities of "strawberries and cream". However, Riley guided us to a sake (Harushika "Tokimeki") that was actually my favorite part of the meal - it was like the juice of some rare exotic fruit, at once earthy and ethereal, sparkling, lightly sweet, guava and lychee and fresh coconut water. 

Imagine our surprise when Riley brought *two* desserts - the chocosan we had ordered, and a wonderful "sundae" of bananas with carmelized sugar topped with ginger ice cream and accompanied by freshly-baked little shortbread cookies! (I did mention that it was a birthday celebration, now that I think of it - but what a cupcake!) Both desserts were so delicious, and it was so much fun to have the contrasting flavors and textures. 

My partner and I were absolutely beaming at the end of the meal. Throughout it, many different people came by to swiftly remove empty plates and fill our water glasses (just one man did that - such a sweet man!) The restaurant itself is very beautiful, but might have seemed too imposing if not for the graciousness and warmth of the staff. 

We are so grateful for this lovely meal. This is a place Iwe will save up for and return to again and again.
author: Marianne S.

description:
will give it 4...

was in town for work and stayed at the Harbor Court which is right above the restaurant.  

this place will burn a hole in your wallet if you are not careful.  sake was awesome and thought they had a great selection ( overpriced a bit ) of wine.  the front lounge area makes for amazing people watching.  you can watch the old men with their "younger" girlfriends of the night or "not in it for the money"  :)

food is awesome.  bar staff is really cool and they make great recomendations.  will go back again when in town
author: Dan L.

description:
I'm a huge fan of this place because I love the atmosphere. It's a really fun place to go especially on the weekends when they have a DJ. The best place to sit is in the lounge by the bar. 

I've been to Ozumo a million times and I always get their sushi, which is good but not outstanding. Recently, I tried their steak which was surprisingly awesome. I never thought their main dishes would be good but the steak proved me wrong. It came with bacon wrapped geen breans which were also amazing. Keep in mind, it is pretty pricey but it's worth it for the fun atmosphere. I also love the general manager, he is such a sweetheart!
author: Jenna Q.

description:
I've been to this place a few times and every time I go, I always have a good time. Whether you sit at the bar or in the dining room area, you'll receive good service and good food. The only think I would have to say is that the sushi is a BIT overpriced. A $17-20 dragon roll is a little pricey, but not a deal breaker. The sushi is always fresh and I like the variety of rolls that they serve. I usually stick to what I know, but when I branch out and try other combination rolls, I've enjoyed them all. 

Every time I come here, the drinks are always good and I like sitting up at the bar area. The staff is friendly and nice and if I have to wait for a table, it's never very long. 

This place is fun whether you're on a date or just having drinks after work.
author: Reese L.

description:
Went on a date with the gf and thought this place was a typical tourist trap.  Now let me preface...the food is good here.  I just though the prices were a bit high compared to other places in SF with just as equally as good sushi.

I do have to contemplate the window views of Oakland and the Bridge.  Its right on the water and of all the waterfront restaurants this is def. high up there.
author: Mayank D.

description:
I took my wife to Ozumo for her birthday. Honestly, I might have gone somewhere else for sushi. However, I selected Ozumo for the ambiance. She wanted to wear a nice dress for her birthday to go with the new haircut. Who am I to turn that down?! A nice view of the Bay Bridge at night doesn't hurt either.

The food at Ozumo was good. I would give the food 4 stars. I have been to Ozumo a handful of times, and it is consistent. We ordered a variety of appetizers, nigiri, and rolls. 

The reason for 3 stars is that the meal took us nearly 2.5 hours. That's tough when you are paying a babysitter by the hour! The other downfall is the price point. Then again, I expected to pay more to go there for the ambiance. 

Overall, I give it a good rating for a special occasion. Just expect to take time and bring your wallet.
author: Jason W.

description:
I visited Ozumo for my wife's birthday dinner.

Food is okay. Fresh enough, but not super fresh as we expect from the price.
I like Futago, Ohitashi style spinach with miso source on top.
And my wife likes Yamabuki, genmai risotto with Uni.
Tempura is better than average but still oily taste.
Rice in nigiri tastes like plain steamed rice. You should add more rice vinegar and sugar.
Overall, foods are not traditional Japanese ones, that I love.

This place is nor for food, but for expensive atmosphere.
This may good for the first date.
author: Ted S.

description: Ozumo used to be my go-to spot for omokase, but Ichi has now completely displaced it. That said, if you need a reservation, cocktails and an upscale dining atmosphere, this is the spot to go in SF.
author: Maïa Cybelle C.

description: The view was beautiful, and the food was fantastic. The restaurant catered to my wife being gluten-free with special soy sauce and other alternate food options. The server also seemed to understand how to be available without hovering. She checked on us frequently and was delightful. Overall- we will be back (a lot).
author: Peter A.

description:
One of my favorite sushi spots.

You can always tell the level of a sushi place by their hamachi nigiri. Ozumo's is consistently fresh, melt-in-your-mouth, top-grade quality. I'm also a huge fan of rolls, and theirs are inventive and always taste amazing. At other places I'm always a little hesitant to try random rolls off of the menu but, at Ozumo's, it's hard to go wrong.

Always have had great service. Ambiance is great too.

Expensive but - if you're wanting a treat - definitely worth it.
author: Laurel A.

description: They served a good food, but I think they are too expensive.
author: Takashi M.

description: Prices are really high for what you get.  The food is good, I enjoyed the butterfish and we will probably be back because the location is great, but didn't really blow me away.
author: Pooja S.

description:
Do yourself a favor when you get here...

DO NOT listen to the hostess up front. She will give you some spheel about how it is best to sit at the lounge where they serve the full menu with no wait, and how she has no seats available currently. 

Upon hearing this me and my girlfriend said ok we'd sit at the lounge.

Service sucked. Waited fifteen minutes to get water. Waited 45 minutes between dishes. 

Worst part was we hear some people tell the hostess they'd wait for a table, and she says that they can sit at the sushi bar area with no wait, and a table takes 5 minutes. What the heck?

The food itself is solid, but nothing memorable. It's all food you will imagine that you want to eat, but want to pay 2-5 dollars less per dish.

The fried calimari was good, as was the tare glazed pork ribs. The sushi was fresh, but unimaginative and overpriced.

People may go to a restaurant for the food, but they come back for the service. I won't be coming back ever and neither should you.

Pros: Ambiance is nice for a lounge, it's got some artistic flair and some creative dishes 

Cons: Uncreative sushi, horrible service, expensive.
author: David H.

description:
Huh? I've never reviewed this place? That's weird!

Yeah, I've been here more than a handful of times. I like it. Friends love it. You can get free Japanese lessons, if you hangout in the bathroom.

Most recently, someone took me to an unintentional early b-day dinner here. I know he prefers Japanese food, so I recommended it. I'm not cheap, so I don't mind the prices - it costs just slightly higher than the average diner. However, if you are cheap, this may not be the place for you.

After thought: I wonder if there is a way for me to anonymously send my former friend money to reimburse him for my meal. I would have eaten here with or without him. I should inquire about gift certificates. :(
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
Best sushi because it is the most fresh and their sushi chefs are legit. The hot food isn't good, but that's okay when the sashimi is top notch. 

Everything fried, including the soft shell crab, is really greasy. Come here for sushi, cocktails, and dessert.
author: NickJess S.

description: Coming from NYC, I have tried hundreds of Japanese restaurants and this place is on the top of my list.  You get what you paid for and this restaurant speaks for itself.  Every dish was well prepared and the selection of sake is top notch.  We had a party of 12 in the private dinning room and the bill was pretty high (3 bottles of sake cost $450).  Overall....5 stars on my list!!!!!
author: Tommy N.

description:
Suprisingly kid-friendly.  Really.  Okay, all you rugrat haters can skip to the next review but all you parents of well-behaved kids listen up.  

We weren't sure this place was receptive to parties with young kids, but when I called in our reservation and requested a high chair, there was no audible gasp from the reservationist.  Armed with a big bag of distractions (e.g. IPod Touch, coloring book, small toys, plastic plates and forks, snacks and juice boxes), my hubby and I hoped for the best when we took our brood here last Tuesday night.  Yes, we got some odd looks from the posers at the bar but we forged ahead to our table by the robata bar.

Our tykes like plain food so we requested an order of zaru soba (not on the menu) and edamame.  For the grown-ups, we ordered a blue fin sashimi starter, hanabi, futago, grilled shitake mushrooms, and burikama.  Although I had snacks at the ready, I didn't have to break them out because the soba and edamame came out really quickly.   Hubby and I were able to enjoy our food because our kids were full and entertained by the chefs at the grill a few feet away.  Since the place is pretty noisy, your kids won't be totally out of place (unless they throw a sh*tfit).  

Ozumo will likely become one of regular stops when we take Caltrain up to vist my husband. Yes, it is expensive but it's walking distance from hub's workplace (no need to find parking) and the food was tasty for all four of us.  When I was packing up the kids' dirty plasticware, the busboy noticed me packing up the dirty plates and offered to wash them for us.  Wow.  And for those of you wondering, I declined his generous offer and got our asses out of there before we overstayed our welcome.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Hearing this is one of the "in" places, we booked 5 wks in advance for the 10/19 reservation.  We were greeted by 3 hostesses who were more into their own conversation than checking us in.  They were curt and made us feel as though we were a nuisance.  We waited 45 minutes at the bar without an update.  Checking back with the hostesses for an ETA, my answer was "we're busy!" with a look of annoyance.

So, I cannot comment on the food as I found poor service and unwelcome attitude an appetite spoiler, and left the restaurant.  Fortunately, SF has a wealth of great restaurants, and were met with outstanding service and great food at Chaya a short walk away.

I hear the food to pretty good, but I'll never try this place again.  
(wish Yelp accepted zero stars)
author: Rob V.

description:
II have been to Ozumo's before, but I felt that this this time around their customer service was not that great, especially for the amount of money we spent. 

The food was still very tasty, but the service was below average. I made my reservations on OpenTable.com for 5 people. I got called a couple of times, not to confirm my reservation, but to tell me that I had to "give up" my table after 2 hours. When we got there, we were told again. 

During the entire course of our dinner, our waiter did not come by once. He had also forgotten to place one of our sushi orders. We did not have dessert because it was too close to our 2 hour time limit. 

They also knew it was my daughter's birthday and they didn't do anything special....no free scoop of ice-cream...no "Happy Birthday" greeting...nothing. 

It's such a shame that restaurants don't put more effort on customer service.
author: Diana o.

description: Birthday ruined. The waiter forgets my order and did not even offer a dessert menu on my birthday. The tokyo gyu came with a side of spinach that frankly may have come out of a trash can. Quality and service are not worth the price.
author: Ari E.

description: I have no idea why I even went back to this place!  My girlfriend and I got dressed up to enjoy a night out.  We started at Ozumo.  I had a bad experience with the general manager before but I figured we would give it another shot as my girlfriend and I love sushi.  We started with a lobster roll, age dashi dofu and japanese uni.  The uni was literally the best I ever had.  It was buttery and not gamey at all. For the food I would give 4 stars.  The service however, a totally different thing altogether.  It was a total nightmare!  At the end of out meal, my gf ordered a green tea.  They brought over a ceramic pot of tea along with a matching ceramic cup (no handle, Japanese style).  What the waitress failed to tell us is that the cup was as hot at the McDonald's temperature tea inside it.  As soon as she picked up the cup, her reflex was to drop it which in turn spilled scalding hot tea all over her lap (and she was wearing a short dress).  I rushed up, made sure she was ok and asked her to go to the ladies room to check herself out.  Meanwhile i asked for the manager and proceeded to complain about the incident and requested an incident report be written. He said he was sorry and disappeared into the office for 25 minutes.  I asked the staff where he was and they said he's "writing it up."  I asked him to email me the report and comp our food.  He claimed he couldn't comp all of it but would comp a few things.  He handed me a bill for $30 and I tipped the waitress anyways since the food was decent.  Frankly, they should have comped the whole meal.  I told the manager that he was lucky I wasn't going to sue them and he smugly responded, "He he, sue ME?!"  He never did email the incident report.  Never again will I go back.  I hope this place shuts its doors forever.
author: Hooman M.

description: Excellent experience throughout! Great food, drinks and ambiance. The rating really doesn't do this place justice. A cool addition was the free Japanese lessons played in the restrooms.
author: Ole Jakob R.

description:
