The second time I ate here, I ordered the blackened cod, which is to die for!  It was cooked perfectly, tender, and left me wanting more.  Ozumo is a great place, and wow, ladies, one of the managers there is h-o-t!
author: Sarah F.

description: Yummy yummy yummy! I went here on a date recently and boy was I impressed. The decor is really cool and trendy, the sushi and entrees were all fabulous. Paired with a nice bottle of sake and I was in heaven. We sat at a romantic table right by the window overlooking the Embarcadero, which was super romantic! Overall an A+ experience (but then of course I didn't have to pick up the bill! :)
author: A B.

description: I loved this place!  We had a spectacular view over dinner and the sushi was amazing. The best uni my taste buds have ever been introduced to. Melted in my mouth! They have the largest sake collection ever!! Great service. Would definitely go back!
author: Paola S.

description: The sushi was amazing and the appetizers were really good. The only thing that was iffy was the tofu.  The cod entree was delicious too.
author: Danny C.

description:
is the sushi roll with lobster really worth $23 for four small bites?  yes!!!  order it now!

the kimonitini (can't remember the exact name) drink - it is the one with black and red raspberries and vodka is delicious!
author: scott w.

description: We came here for drinks and thought the interior was done nicely...I just remembered the place was so crowded and I'm not sure if  I would want to go back there again though...
author: JenJen W.

description: I have been to Ozumo a handful of times over the past two years. It is the best place sushi restaurant in the city to 'wow' your out-of-town guests with the ambiance, interior design, etc. The sushi and sashimi are very good, and the Ozumo bar area is a cool hangout as well as Steuart Street having great other eateries as options. We ate here last Sunday night, sat in the bar area and everything was above our expectations...there is no cooler sushi restaruant in a happening place than Ozumo.
author: Anthony L.

description: Ozumo was amazing! Food presentation was so good. Sushi & sashimi here were fresh and yummy. They also had large menu for Japanese Sake.
author: Woosung A.

description: Great service EXCellent food cool decor it is always a pleasure
author: Carpe D.

description:
We had a gift card for this place from a while back and we finally decided to use it. The atmosphere is very sleek and modern. We arrived at 6pm with reservations for 3 and was seated right away. Our waiter had greeted us and gave a small introduction. The service here is very good. The waiter we had was very knowledgeable of the menu and gave us suggestions, explained how some of the special request dinners worked. Our waiter was very patient with us as we took almost 30 minutes to order due to a little confusion about how some of the special ordering was. But we finally ordered, My husband and i had the sushi/sashimi special where we tell the chef what we like and dont like and he makes a plate for us and my sister in-law had some plate with risotto and i think sea bass (not sure).  
We received our food and everything was delicious. My sister in-laws dish was really nicely done, risotto was made very well and the fish was cooked just right. Mine and my husbands dish was really good too, the fish was really fresh. Over all the dinner was good. After we had ordered dessert. We had saw another table order the fondue plate, so we decided to order it too. It came with a variety of fruit, sponge cake, ice cream mochi and a pot of Belgian bitter sweet chocolate. It was a very good choice to end a meal.
Over all the experience was great. Would i come here again? Yes if it is for a special occasions as this place is a little pricey. But would recommend it for those who like to fine dine.Didnt give it 5 stars because of the parking, if you dont go early you wont get parking, but if you go early you end up putting a hole in your pocket till you hit 7pm.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: veryyy fresh sushi! cool ambience. went for the gold and ordered the shacho roll--what seemed to be the creme de la creme lobster/mango/jalapeño/cilantro/tuna roll--but was disappointed. on the other hand.... they catered to my raw salmon fettish and made my favorite roll specially to my order, and it was AMAZING! exotic rolls, and so fresh, which sets it apart from other sushi restaurants.
author: Djamila D.

description:
This is one restaurant you got to try when you are in the city!! 

My wife introduced this place and we had a look at the menu on their website....my first impression was "EXPENSIVE", but don't complain if you have decided to try it out.

I am VERY picky with Japanese food since I am from Taiwan and I have been eating authentic Japanese food my whole life, but for the first time in 3 years I have found a Japanese restaurant I would like to go back.

The parking is bit of a mission, otherwise just ask for valet parking.

We had a great waiter. His name is Vunz. If you guys want to try this place, please ask for Vunz area when you make the reservation. He knows details of making of the food, and even ingredients of the food.

We tried the "Kobe beef on the menu. It isn't Kobe, as Vunz explained to us, it is actually Misiyaki beef which is better than Kobe. Ozumo named the dish Kobe because Kobe is a more recognizable name than Misiyake. Misiyaki has only been famous in the last few years. It is market price, therefore ask your waiter for the price. Our price was $105 for 5oz. My wife discussed it for a few seconds, and decided to go for it as it is something we got to try once in our lifetime. Vunz brought out the Misiyaki....man, the presentation is good, and our first thought was "that isn't going to make a dent on our taste buds!!". Vunz described in detail of how to take it correctly and let it melt in your mouth....YES, melt!! We follow his instructions.....WOW!!! I was wrong. It hit our taste buds big time. Wow....excellent. The little piece of beef literally melt in your mouth. We only had 5 pieces each, but that was worth every single penny. Well spend $105. 

We wanted mixed and match sashimi which they didn't have, but Vunz said he will sort it out for us. We had tuna, baby octupus, yellowtail, salmon roe, salmon belly, and another fish which I forgot. Man....the best sashimi I have had in 3 years. The sashimi just melts in your mouth!!! It was just a pleasure to have in our mouths that we wanted more, but we decided to leave some for next time. 

We had another "small plate" (zensai) which had bacon wrapping around the seabass. My god!!! The taste was so sweet and delicious!! One of the best dish I have had in a long time. This was $23 for 4 mouth pieces.

The decor and atmosphere were excellent. The people who came in to dine were sophisticated and beautiful to look at as they are all dressed up in expensive brands.

Our total came to $200+$7.65 (SF health tax)+ state tax= $235 (around that number).

Definite will go back there again for good food.

Keep in mind of one point when you have decided to try it out. Don't compare the pricing to the quantity on the plate. The idea is to enjoy the taste of good food!!
author: shoutjack s.

description:
God help me!!!

The worst sushi experience in the last 10 years.  I don't mind paying big bucks for top quality but this takes the prize in over rated and over priced fish.

I went to Kyo-Ya to have dinner but they were temporarly closed.  My loss the concierge at the Palace suggested Ozumo.

Ozuma may be the place for you if you want to get drunk on Martini's and gobble down combo rolls covered in mayo.  Lot's of ginger will also help cover up the taste of anything raw you may have ordered by mistake.
author: Mats H.

description:
Love it!  Some dishes were disappointing, specifically the seabass, but this one dish and one dessert alone make me give five stars to Ozumo despite its expensive cost. 

The Wa-wu beef appetizer was wow.  I still remember the strong grilled steak taste in my mouth, and the layers with it, the eggplant, spinach, and sauce, made this one of the best appetizers I've ever had.  The beef was amazingly tender.  Just pure goodness!

You must, must, must save room for the Chocolate Fondue, and you haven't been to Ozumo without ordering this dessert.  Warm dark chocolate in a stoneware pot with a platter of fresh fruits and mochi make this the perfect, perfect, perfect dessert to end the meal.  My favorite is when I dip the mochi ice cream in the chocolate, and the duo twist of warm dark chocolate and cold ice cream with the chewiness of the mochi skin created a blast of flavors, textures and feelings in my mouth.  It was quite amazing.

The lobster roll - four pieces for $22 -- was not worth it at all; the seabass sauce was not that great, and the ahi tartar was just ahi tartar, but the above two dishes of wawu beef and chocolate fondue earned Ozumo its five stars from me.
author: Alex E.

description: Came here for my bday dinner i thought it was good we got hooked up so i can't hate be back forsure. The miso sea bass the one thing i will remember.
author: Pedro V.

description:
Some of the food was fantastic, but my sushi roll was very dry.

The server guy we got must have been brand new. He didn't bother with a notebook when asking for my order and then proceeded to ask me to repeat my entire order while he took out his notebook. Very unprofessional.
author: Adie B.

description: This place is really nice. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. The menu has many great options to taste. Prices are relative. Try the Pink Dragon...awesome!
author: Chris L.

description: Surprisingly, a very acceptable place for sushis. Sometimes the rice layer is somewhat too thick, which might just indicate that sushis might not  be a prority for this restaurant (a wise choice indeed, market-wise, but still, a little effort would be greatly appreciated). Be aware that the reservation desk may treat you like cattles, and that punctuality of table avaibility is not their forte. The busmen do a better job than the waiters, who tend to be a little up-nose at times. When ordering a sake, this well-decorated establishment has a pattern of serving you the most expensive on the list; quite understable in an ROI perspective, yet, customers may have some preferences that they might want to express. Well, after this, I better go under cover next time ;-)
author: Philippe B.

description: Over priced....   food is okay.  However, I was VERY impressed with their Sake selections.... very extensive....  presentation was also pretty good.  I personally enjoy food that is tasting good, not looking good.
author: Steve K.

description:
Came here one night because Sebo was closed.  It was ok.  Again another spot with mediocre sushi at high prices.  The toro was good, but that was about it.  

The server was nice, but our food took forever.  It must have been almost an hour.  I was a bit hung-over still from the night before, and haven't eaten much all day.  The wait for our food was almost agonizing.  My girlfriend and I started to get restless.  Trying to get more hot water for our tea pot took a while too.  

Food and service is average, but prices are too high.  Don't feel justified spending this much for mediocre food and service.  If you want a nice dinner, go down the block and walk into Boulevard.  I would have been happier there.
author: Nick H.

description: I have had dinner here three times.  Two for big birthday bashes.  Our group had a great experience.  So it is good for groups.  It is high priced for decent food.  I'm not sure I would return a fourth time.
author: tiffany m.

description:
My two best friends took me here for my birthday dinner.  The atmosphere is really nice and there's a nice view of the bay bridge by the window.  We made reservations at 5:30 PM, but didnt not show up until 6:15PM.  They wre really nice about it.  Luckily the place was not packed with people.  The bill came out to be around $160-$200 for three people (which is kind of pricy!!!)

We ordered out drinks:  Sparking Geisha (OK...), Rasberry "something" (yum), and beer.  For food, we had:  short-ribs (this is sooo goood!), filet mignon (sooo juicy and good), and sirlon (OK....).  We also ordered 2 rolls:  dragon and rainbow (OK...).  The rolls are nothing special.  They taste the same as other sushi restaurants and this place charges 2 times more than others.  The food is in small portions but they are filling.  

 This place is not dressy!  Although it's in a finacial/business district, the dress code is more business casual.  You can wear jeans and tennis shoes.  Just dont wear your basketball attire in there.
author: Linda H.

description: Very cool and hip restaurant -- and the food is amazing!  Highly recommended -- especially on a Friday night for people watching.
author: Sonia A.

description: Saturday nights can be tricky and sometimes expectations simply are not met as was the case with a recent visit to Ozumo.  No quibbles with the quality of the sushi - half dollar-sized Kumis that were positively sweet, Hamachi that melted like butter - it was service at the bar where this place took a nose dive.  I didn't mind the solid five minute wait before being greeted by the bartender but I strenuously objected to wine-by-the-glass for $16!  The message was loud and clear - DRINK SAKE.  Fine, sake it is and they have a superb list.  I've spent big bucks at Ozumo entertaining for business during lunch and I've had quiet dinners in the restaurant proper that were memorable so I already have expectations.  Looks to me like their bar staff is in need of some training.
author: Deborah P.

description: Great place to hanout with friends but way too pricey!
author: David G.

description: I had lunch with my friends here several times.  The sushi was pretty good.   I had dinner with my husband here one time, I had the shabu-shabu...was okay..not too impressed with that.
author: Pikachu P.

description: Somehow I end up here a lot on Friday nights after work. The bar is usually not too bad as far as getting drinks. Food here is fairly solid. I've had a few of the rolls and nigiri. Came here once for lunch and enjoyed the lunch box as well. With the crowd and atmosphere, it can be hit or miss. It definitely depends on whether you can tolerate the crowd. I continue to go back and have no hesitation doing so.
author: Mike C.

description: Came here for drinks and found a bench spot in a crowded bar. They have a very good drink menu with many creative drinks.  The decor is very nice and so was the service.
author: The O.

description: My wife and I love this place.  Thomas, one of the many chefs at the sushi bar, actually remembered us from our last visit and personalized his service just for us.  The wait staff is just ok, but the food is spectacular.  The fish here is fresh and tasty.
author: Stan V.

description:
FOOD:  My husband and I went for a special occasion date.  There are many fine Japanese restaurants in the area, but I chose Ozumo because I wanted nice ambience, design, music and quality food in one place -- which is exactly what the patron pays for at Ozumo. 

We ordered: a seaweed salad, pumpkin robata, purple yam (potato) robata, vegetable rolls, inari rolls. Nigiri: Toro ($20 /2 pcs), Ikura, Jack. Dessert:  chocolate fondue. It was all excellent and high quality.  
All the sushi was very fresh and light on the palate.  The best seaweed salad I've ever had.  It was four kinds of seaweed, lightly dressed, clean-tasting, and only slightly salty.  The purple yam robata was amazing.  It came with a contrasting  smear of light creamy butter on top and slivers of crisp veggies. My husband is a  vegetarian and we find that veg dishes usually are second rate at sushi places -- not the case here.  The veg dishes were good quality and well-prepared. The fondue dessert came with a nice quality dark chocolate for dipping, mochi ice cream pieces, fresh fruit, and pieces of cake for dipping. Good for 1-3 people.
All the food was thoughtfully presented, with fair-sized, satisfying portions. The small plates were small as were expected for this type of cuisine. All in the top tier for what I've had in my lifetime. 

SERVICE: Very good waiter and support staff. Well-trained staff. The receptionists were cordial and quick. The whole staff greets you, and then thanks you on your way out. The waiter was prompt, friendly, knowledgeable. He gave us some very nice recommendations. The support staff always promptly and quietly removed soiled plates and cleaned in between courses.  We sat in the main dining room near the sushi bar and were able to observe the very mindful, professional, skillful sushi chefs at work.

DECOR:  Very nice ambience, esp at night.  Dramatic lighting. Thoughtful, quality interior design, without being over the top. Warm colors and clean lines. The soft surfaces absorbed much of the dining room din. Nice views of the bridge from the main dining room in the sushi bar area. The food was served on good quality ceramics that weren't the cliched Japanese dish ware, designed not to interfere with the nice, simple presentation of the food.  Excellent DJ with upbeat, cool vibes on the Sun. night we visited.  The music was at a low volume enough to enjoy and hold a conversation comfortably. 

COST:  Expensive.  Commensurate with the good quality of the experience.

RECOMMENDATIONS:  I have to admit that we were skeptical at first about the place because at so many restaurants the design eclipses the quality of the food and service. At Ozumo, food, service and decor are all high quality. 
For a relaxing date, I recommend going on a Sunday night when the vibe is mellow and to avoid the after work drinking crowd.  For sushi, I recommend starting with the smallest omakase at $35 for nine pieces.  I will order set-priced omakase next time I visit because: 1)  I over-ordered a la carte and it cost me dearly. (I am not on an expense acct.) 2) I go for the recommended fish of the day anyway.  Thank you, Ozumo!
author: Mrs M.

description: I don't write bad reviews unless I visit a restaurant 3 times and have 3 bad experiences.  The sushi quality at Ozumo is not good.  Whenever I order the spicy tuna, or the yellowtail sashimi dish with the tomatoes, the fish tastes old and fishy.  Also, the sushi chef's slice the sashimi way too thick.  And I also noticed the fish is room temp.  Its nice when the fish has been kept cool - maybe that is why it tastes fishy - because its sitting out?  The first round, the waitress brought out the yellowtail sashimi (with the tomatoes and the yuzu type sauce). I had to send it back - it was awful.  So fishy.  Then she came back with the same dish, except this time they used "different yellowtail".  She said that the chef didn't use sushi-grade yellowtail the first go around, rather he used the yellowtail that they usually cook, subbing it in for our sashimi instead.  I don't see the common sense here???  Next: The shishito peppers were bland- there was no sauce or soy type of glaze.  They were grilled shishitos.  This restaurant has a cool vibe - its great for large parties, but that's it.  I'm sorry, but when I order a burger, it doesn't have to be amazing.  But when I order sushi, it has to be GREAT... not just ok.   It's raw fish!  Now - the one good thing I ordered at Ozumo is the kobe beef.  It was buttery and delicious.  However, if you want good sushi, and better yet know what good sushi tastes like... don't waste your time at Ozumo.
author: KayEl H.

description: The restaurant has a great feel.  Beautiful decor.  Usually pretty fresh fish. I love their uni risotto.  Been here a bunch of times.  Its decent sushi but expensive though.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Absolutely fantastic sushi...i crave the tuna tataki and the garlicky/soy edamame apps, and the fish...oh the fish.

It can be a bit of a 'to do' to get a table there at the last minute, but we like to sit up at the sushi bar regardless and chat with the chefs who are wonderful.  The tables/views etc are very pretty but it can get a little pretentious.  If you can deal with the noise, the front bar area is a cool, dark hip place to sit with a larger group.

Wine selection is great, everything is definitely on the pricey side, but we have never had a bad meal here...how many places can you say that about?

Hate to admit it but never had an entree here aside from the sushi.  we generally ask our waiter what is fresh, interesting and new and get something of a surprise along with our usual faves.
author: Kate W.

description:
This place has one of the best sushi bars in the U.S., it even beats most of the ones I went to when I lived in Tokyo.   A great people watching scene, great cocktails, one of the best sake lists you'll ever see, lounge music, and creative appetizers.   (Get the soy-garlic edamame and the sliced hamachi.)    

The shabu shabu is also a good alternative to sushi.  Some good off-menu items if you get to know the bartenders or waiters/waitresses.  

Yes, it's expensive, but that's partly the point.  If you just want sushi, under florecent lighting, there are plenty of other places to go to.  For an experience, an "evening out", this place is near as good as it gets in San Francisco.
author: Stuart C.

description: The food was gross.  We ordered a seaweed salad that tasted way too salty.  The goma ae was tough.  The yellowtail collar was overcooked and had a fishy taste.  The wait staff was arrogant.  When we arrived, we didn't have a reservation, so they tried to stick us in the corner, as if they were too packed to put us in the main room.  When I refused the seat and opted for a chair at the sushi bar in the main room, I noticed that that room was almost empty.  I suppose they want to exude an image, like they're the kind of place that requires reservations.  Unfortunately for Ozumo, those days are over.  If you serve food that tastes like that, patrons don't need to put up with an attitude.  The place has really gone downhill.
author: Chad H.

description: Their  rolls are great . Their cocktails however, are not so great; they're too sweet, with probably very little alcohol. They have room to improve on their cocktails . Im actually giving them three and a half stars.
author: Monica R B.

description: Took out of towners here and they loved it.  I loved this place already because it has great sushi, but we enjoyed it even more with family from out of state.  The Sake flights were a lot of fun and entertaining for mid-westerners.  The Shabu Shabu is the best I have ever had.  It was a little pricey for how much you get.  It was great because there is a whole lot more than just sushi.
author: Tony B.

description:
I'm surprised by the mix reviews - Ozumo is delicious.  It's great for a special occasion, as the ambiance is swanky, fun, young crowd, and a spectacular view of the bay bridge with floor to ceiling windows to admire it.

As for food, it's not a strictly sushi restaurant.  In fact, my favorite dishes are probably the miso black cod (literally melts in your mouth - almost as good as Nobu's) and the tuna tar tar (unlike any I've ever had, with a tofu and avocado puree as a base  - delish).

The sushi menu is limited, although everything I've had has been both fresh and delicious.  I recommend the Ozumo roll for those looking for something a little different - california roll with asparagus, unagi, avo, and sweet glaze.

Downside?  Price, price, price.  Very hard to get out of here with a check that is even remotely justifiable.  About $120 (w/o tip) for 2 people with no dessert, 1 app, like 4 rolls and 2 glasses of wine....  kinda insane, but worth it for a once a year treat.
author: Casey M.

description: Well, Ozumo has lost some of its food quality. I still give it 4 since I have had many a good meal here. The service was just "ok" the last time I went. The waitress spilled hot broth on my husband from the "Shabu-Shabu" when placing it on the table (no apology) and the meat in the Shabu was not sliced it was one big huge piece that was impossible to cut and the waitress didn't offer to take it away and slice it properly for us when we complained.
author: Amber T.

description: This is coming from a sushi lover... I've been here for happy hour as well as dinner in the main dining area overlooking the Bay Bridge. Their happy hours are decent but a little expensive-they actually serve smaller portions so you're not really getting a great deal but I do really like the space, their sushi rolls are pretty good overall and they have some good cocktails. I did, however, have the chef's Omakase meal in the main dining room and I have to say it wasn't worth it even though my date paid for it. I've had much better Omakase meals at places like Zushi Puzzle with Roger and also at Aka Tombo (I think that's what it's called-on Buchanan street).
author: JM K.

description: Went here last month for a friend's birthday and it was....ehhhh.  The place is totally overpriced.  Food was just ok.  Not worth it to me.  I can get so much better elsewhere for half the price.  And the drinks...ack...terrible.  Bartender didn't know how to make any drink not on the menu.  But this poor review is mainly for the terrible service.  It was our friend's birthday and the manager kept saying that this and that were on the house....things we didn't order but he brought out.  Imagine our surprise when we get the check and all those "on the house" items were included on the tab.  WTF?!?  When we complained the waitress said she didn't remember the manager saying that.  The waitress finally gave in after 20 minutes of arguing.  Never again!
author: Lori A.

description: Food is good! Bar is nice atmosphere. They have nice DJ on weekend. Good to hung out after work.
author: Miho Y.

description: The black cod is outstanding...flakey with tons of flavor. The sake menu is endless...ask the waiter for recommendations! Great service, food and a cool, hip vibe.
author: A D.

description: Nice atmosphere, and great wine list.  Only had apps there...hamachi, which was good, not as good as slanted door. And a seafood risotto, which I believe was a special that night.  I was told this was some of the best seafood...maybe people like it mostly for the scene.** Update, went here for a work lunch.please don't waste your time.they are slow, and SO not worth the wait!
author: Rita M.

description:
Good sushi...bad service...

The bar is cool. The crowd has generally been a mix of FiDi businessmen as well as some pretty attractive 20-somethings. 

I guess it's worth checking out but I'm not "wowed" by it.
author: Nicole R.

description:
I wanted a fancy sushi bar for a festive occasion. We were alarmed when we entered the place because at the entrance is a very loud, packed, trendy bar with a deafening noise level. Fortunately the large sushi bar in the back was calm, spacious and lovely.
The server was competent but was so obvious in her attempts to upsell us that it took some of the fun out of it. A $90 Kobe steak wasn't what we had in mind (we just  wanted sushi) and she looked so dissappointed when we didn't buy it or the extremely pricey bottle of sake that she'd recommended. 
The sushi was fresh and tasty, but not especially well-presented. I think sushi should be cut consistently, but some of the nigiri were patched together with several pieces of fish - seemed rather amateurish. The selection was rather mundane. However, when we asked that the head sushi chef make us a special roll - some creation of his choice - we were pleased with it and the special roll that day (unagi and tuna, with jalapeno and flying fish roe). 
The server redeemed herself by adding a dessert on the house because she knew it was my husband's birthday (I had mentioned it when making reservations), so that was an appreciated nice touch.
author: B H.

description:
This is simply the best sushi in the financial district.  Now, its overpriced, portions are small, and way too frou frou for my tastes.  But given that its been months since I've had good sushi, I was incredibly pleased to find this place.  From now on, this is where I go when corporate types are footing the bill.

The food is *incredible*.  The staff are nice.  And the view of the bay is cool.  If I had to pay for it myself, it might not get the 5 stars though...
author: Jeff W.

description:
Clearly, I luv sushi... I go at least twice a week... I luv it... the food here is great... 

Miso soup has freshly chopped mushrooms in it... and little mini mushrooms... some of the best miso I've had...

Their fish is fresh... their sushi creations are somewhat different... Presentation is fabulous. Full bar. Great scene.

Here is my problem; first time I went to Ozumo, my rainbow roll never came out... it took 45 minutes AFTER my friend got their meal for them to serve me mine... unacceptable... and they didnt offer to comp it until my friend said that we werent paying for it because we expected better service from such a nice restaurant... TRUE

second time i went there, i planned to order the tempura roll for lunch... the server told me about the special and i opted for that, not thinking that the price of the special would be significantly more... more than double the original roll i ordered... so instead of paying $8 for a tempura roll, i paid $18 for their "special red dragon" roll... i would have appreciated the courtesy of the server telling me the price of the roll... especially if it was significantly higher than the original roll I intended to order... i shouldnt have to ask...

Anyway, I'm not going to gripe... I still like this place... be weary of their pretentious service but the food and ambiance is worth trying... :0)
author: Vic M.

description:
This really is the best sushi you can get so don't go there. I don't need you competing for my seat! Seriously if you are looking for more authentic nigiri this is the place. Nigiri is suppose to be small and bite size. With the large number of sushi places out there, rarely does it become a memorable experience. This is good stuff and the tres GF I've been there with would agree. 

Yeah, it's pricey but it keeps out the riff raff.
author: Ron S.

description: Good sushi, awesome sake selection, and very trendy atmosphere with good music. Service was fine although could have been a little more attentive. Definitely hope to go there again soon though =)
author: Julian R.

description:
A really cool place to hang out and enjoy drinks and sushi. The sushi is definitely above average and the crowd is a bit younger. The house music completes the ambiance. 
   The service is great!!!
author: Michael S.

description: I was so disappointed with both the food and the service.  The fish for two of us was subpar and my avocado was so rock hard it couldn't be eaten.  I got a sticky glass and getting the server's attention was difficult even though it was not crowded.  On top of that the prices - ouch!
author: pam f.

description: One of my favorite Sushi places in SF.  I have yet to make a reservation, but I can see how it would be a good idea, they get pretty busy.  The food is VERY fresh, the Ozumo and Dragon are my favorite rolls.  Not a huge fan of the Busho.  Dark lighting, beautiful interior, dressy attire.  I've even stopped by for drinks and a roll before heading out (bar has full menu).  The dining room seating has a great view of the bay, during lunch OR dinner.  Like I said, one of my favorite places to have Sushi.  Pricing isn't bad at all, my friend and I have had 4 rolls and we always come in around $70.
author: Aman S.

description: This place was really disappointing in terms of organization and food.  I will not be back.
author: Pimms H.

description: Sushi is good. But it is pricey for the quantity of the sushi. I wish they can put a bigger piece of raw fish on top of the rice. The dinning area is nice.
author: Emily C.

description: Can I get the interior decorators phone number?  I found myself at Ozumo after work for their happy hour (very popular indeed).  Great prices on drinks and food.  The best part was watching this blond work her way around the bar trying to pick up business men.  She was talking to this one couple who my friend and I just know are swingers but dumped them to continue her conquest.  I hope she got what she was looking for but she would have a better chance if she didn't smoke.  Eww!
author: Toby T.

description:
Don't miss the Otoro - it's the best in the city.  The vegetable platter is also fantastic.  

My party of 4 had a reservation and we were on time, but we still had to wait at the bar for 45 minutes.   We were getting really antsy and asked the waitress for updates every 10 minutes or so (gently reminding her that we actually had a reservation) - but she didn't seem to think we had any reason to be perplexed.

But the food is really that good.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
The restaurant is very stylish, but I prefer sitting at the bar as it gets scene'y with all the pretty people and whatnot (especially on a Friday night).

One of the bartenders mentioned that A-Rod stopped in just before the 2007 All-Star Game. I guess that's cool. Who knows, he might be a Giant next year.

The food is good; some people claim they make the best sushi in SF, but I'm pretty ambivalent. Definitely good presentation and the ingredients are high quality. The sorta place I'd take people visiting from out of town.
author: Dominic D.

description:
I have been here twice.  I had a decent experience the first time, but refuse to return after my second experience.  I love the atmosphere and some of the cocktails ... but that's about it.  The prices are way too high for small portions of good (not great) food and the service is horrible.  It takes forever to be seated and you must reserve your table FAR in advance.

What killed my second visit was when the waitress asked if we were ready for another round of drinks.  We said "yes" as she cleared the glassware from the table, thinking she'd be back in a sec to take our order.  We were quite surprised when she returned a few minutes later with the same cocktails we had before.  WTF?  I'm sorry, but asking if we're ready for another round does not mean we want the same exact cocktails!  What made it worse was when she implied that my party was at fault.  Hello!  The customer is ALWAYS right.

Anyway, I only suggest coming here for the atmosphere and a few drinks.  Just be sure to set everything straight with your waiter/waitress.
author: Michael P.

description: When on the corporate dime, this has, every time, been a good choice. When on my own dime......... I don't know, I've never been on my own dime.
author: Ricardo O.

description: This place is sorta worth the money.  The sushi is decent but the ambiance is really superb.  The service is also good.  The only thing I didn't like about this place is that the edemame is super salty and my stomach didn't feel good afterwards.
author: Janie H.

description:
Have been here three times and I was very impressed with everything.  

The first time was on a date and it was just for drinks so I cannot comment on the food, but I was very happy with the drinks.

The second time a large group of us sat in the private room and while there were some snotty nosed kids in our group (not mine!), the staff was very accommodating and easy-going.  I did not order any of the items, but what I do remember is that the dishes were great.

The third time was for a friends birthday with a group of girlfriends.  We had reservations and we walked right in.   We had four of the dishes (Hanabi, Futago, Gindara and Hotate), two rolls (Sekiwake and ?) and drinks.  I thought the portions were fine.  Each plate is not meant to be a full meal, it is more of a tasting of all flavors.  I suppose it is pricey, but I was not surprised.  As my friend said, her mouth was having a "mouth orgasm", it was that good!

The service was great at all times even at a busy time and the waiter was some great eye candy as well..... (sometimes I wonder if people who complain about the service are bored with their dining company, I am usually so caught up in conversation that I probably would not really notice mediocre service, but that is just me).

I cannot wait to go again.  Next time is it the Omakase (I am eager to compare this to Nobu's version...cause that was amazing!)
author: Lara F.

description: I'm gonna need few more trips to this place, since this, obviously, is not your ordinary Japanese restaurant, with just sushi and tempura and teriyaki.  They have many spectrums of Japanese cuisine: sushi, tempura, robata (Japanese BBQ), appetizers, so it's not fair to give them a rating with only one or two visitings.  One thing for sure is that they are definitely trying to achieve a new plateau for Japanese cuisine.  They can be held accountable for a new horizon in the much-too-abundant Japanese food in the bay area.  The service was excellent.  I didn't hesitate to tip them 25%.
author: Passdatanqueray M.

description:
Mmmmm.... awesome, fresh sushi + amazing desserts!  When do you ever get dark choclate fondue (complete with an amazing assortment of fruits and other vehicles for gooey chocolate) at a SUSHI place?  But there it is.  If only I had more room after polishing off the main courses.

Only downsides are that they're very busy (reservations strongly recommended and you'll probably still wait on a weekend night) and not cheap.  But so good that it wouldn't seem right to subtract even one star -- it's worth it!
author: S J.

description:
I'm the one who always sit at the bar on Friday night!! I love this place after have happy hour at Americano then walk half block to Ozumo. The crow is upper class. Food is very good. Drink and service is awesome. I love Lulu and Laura ( Bartender) they both hot and good personality. i'm very enjoy to chat with them. Sushi here is veryyyyyyyyyyyyy good they also have happy hours and the price is cheap.

  Good crow and good music. Highly recommend :)
author: Grace C.

description: i was recommended by a friend of mine to try this contemporary Japanese restaurant. On a calm beautiful Saturday night, sister and i came here for an dinner date. Surprisly this place is extremely extensive. from outside you would think it's an average sized restaurant. they have an open seating near the entrance with a full bar, large sushi bar in the back, and additional table seatings surrounding the sushi bar. the decor is very modern and has a romantic kick it to which is great for a date. sister and i decided to sit at the sushi bar thinking it would be more convenient for us to order sushi. their restaurant staffs were definitely attentive especially our sushi chef (forgot his name). He has a great sense of humor and also really good at triggering our taste buds. he would ask us what kind of fish or seafood we like and took time to explain the origin of each fish. ALL their raw items tasted really fresh. nonetheless, we enjoyed our 2 hours stay at Ozumo. Our favorites were king mackerel (special of the day), shacho, aji, ozumo, toro, and sekiwake. also their list of alcohol/mixed drinks are endless. I will be back.
author: Connie T.

description: Great sushi. You pay for what you get. Somewhat expensive.
author: Kurt K.

description:
Everything is extremely fresh and they have a good variety of sashimi and sakes but there's plenty of room for improvement on their hot pots.

Great place for friends to hang out for happy hour, their drinks are pretty taste but with a good kick in it too.
author: Kate L.

description: I went there for the first time last night for dinner. The food was DELICIOUS! I loved the explosion of flavor in my mouth with every bite I took. However, Two stars get knocked off due to the rude service we received. Our waitress was very pushy and seemed borderline cocky. We ended up leaving right after our meal to the bar down the street for more drinks in a better and friendlier atmosphere...
author: Aimee S.

description: A group of us had a private room this summer for a birthday celebration.  The seafood is very fresh.  A lot of people rave at how fresh it should be, but hello we live in SF with the Pacific ocean as our backdrop so, damn, our seafood better be fresh.  It is funny how shocked people are at the freshness.  I for one would be shocked if it was not fresh.  OK enough of double talk.  The sake bar was good and I love their list of available liquor.  Hmmm $100 for chicken, rice and salad expensive in my book.
author: Naomi H.

description: Definitely a place for good looking downtown workers to drink after work.  The food is good, but not that special.
author: The P.

description: One of my favorite San Francisco restaurants.  The bar is always a fun place to be.  The food is consistently good.  I love the oysters and the toro virtually melts in your mouth.  I also always get the shabu shabu.  Although I do admit that the price is overpriced and I am not always completely full when I leave.
author: Jen L.

description:
Yes it is very expensive, but it sure is yummy. 
Well not only yummy but beautifully presented, which is just as important in a high-end restaurant.
I forgot the name of it but the sliced spicy hamachi appetizer was so very delicious, and I usually don't like hamachi or spicy food! 
I always order the salmon skin roll wherever I go, and Ozumo's is very good! 
I also loved the yakitori skewer and the miso marinated black cod.
author: M K.

description: Cool atmosphere and good food, even though I don't like sushi.
author: Jake B.

description:
I was sooo hungry when i came. I was sooo hungry when i left.
food was expensive. 
they were really snobby too. the host man said there were no available tables, come back in 40 min. 30 min later, we came back only to be shoved into some corner space around the bar. 15 min later we were seated, also in some corner....but the place was empty inside. i was so pissed that they left so many tables with a nice view empty...and when i asked to sit at one of the tables with a view, the host man with a stick up his bum said "no, they're all booked." 
they SO WERE NOT!

the only reason why i give it 2 stars is because i'm a sucker for sashimi, and altho it was overpriced, it was good sashimi.

they also had a good drink menu for me to drink away the horrible experience with the host man.
author: melanie b.

description: Though the place is huge and spread out, both the sushi and service is a hit and miss affair. Some nights is good others is just lousy service. This place is never consistent with whatever they produce except for their sake variations. Don't expect anything, be prepare to spend big bucks.
author: francis p.

description: This is one of THE best restaurant experiences  I have ever had. Granted I live in Los Angeles and am constantly disappointed by superficial restaurants who cater to the popularity contest rather than the dining experience. Time and time again I look back at my experience at Ozumo( great service, great food, great sake AND great music- what more could you ask for?) and compare every other dining experience to this ( always failing), Please take the aesthetic of your restaurant and introduce it to LA, we need you- I am most certainly a fan :)
author: j l.

description:
i went to Ozumo (the bar/lounge area, not the restaurant section) for the second time last week because I am a generous person who believes in second chances.   the milk of human kindness literally flows from my pores.   the only positive thing that i can say about ozumo is that its consistent - consistently bad!

lets start with the service.  the waitress was very slow bringing the menu and never stopped to check on us eventhough we told her that we would be placing more orders as the evening progressed.  i had to flag her down 3 times to order more drinks and food.   i wont even bore you with the saga refilling our empty soy-sauce dispenser.

continue on to the food.   we selected 5 types of  sashimi including Otoro (special occasion.)  the presentation was nice - the sashimi was well laid out on the platter.  i started out with the basic maguro - it wasnt top notch, but it was ok.  it was all down hill from there.  the uni was a mess - definitely grade c.  the biggest disappointment was the otoro.  it was not fresh at all with a distinct fishiness both in flavor and texture.  it was also pretty stringy.  it wasnt the decadent experience that the tuna gave up its life for.  to add insult to injury, th otoro alone was $50 for just 5 pieces!

the only somewhat positive features of the experience were the dessert, drinks and music.  my first time trying wasabi and chocolate.  valiant effort but not really to my taste.  the pot de creme was a bit too salty, but interesting.   their gimlet was a bit too sweet for my taste, but it wasnt bad.  i tasted some other house cocktail that was pretty nice also.  the best part of the evening was the remix of a phil collins song i had never heard before.

so, third time's a charm?  im not that generous.  bye bye ozumo.
author: Yonas F.

description: Fabulous services and the food was absolutely delicious. Everytime we go there it's a splendid expereince :). Deffinately goming back.
author: Yulenka M.

description: the sushi is good but the price can be hefty.  I went 1 day when the weather was really hot and let me tell you that was a bad idea.
author: Yen T.

description: Was expecting more.  I'm a fan of Nobu in London, and SF needs a sushi place to stand up to places like Nobu.  Kinda embarrassing that we don't have a high end, see and be seen Sushi place like Nobu.  Anyway, took the wife here with the hope that it would stack up, and came away dissapointed and slightly embarrassed.    Seating is very open, and lighting is bright.  That said, it is a popular place, and I doubt they will feel the loss of my patronage.
author: frank l.

description: This is my favorite sushi restaurant in the city- when I can afford it.  It is pricey, but look at the location.  I do love the food though, the rolls are amazing and they have a great bar.
author: Rachel S.

description: great sushi but never expected when i walked in to be walking into a NY trendy hot spot ha.. i didnt mind because my party was a little drunk already but if we had gone there for a nice sushi date it was hard to talk but perfect for sake bombs and yummy sushi rolls :)
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Food - good, sushi okay
Service - fair
author: Phi N.

description: You get what you paid for... their sushi's soOOo GOOD! Nice place inside too.. good for dates.
author: Aquino L.

description:
Ozumo is one of the best sushi places in the city. 

Atmosphere- Gives you that "zen" feeling 
Service- awesome
Sushi- amazing, so fresh! 
Drinks- come for hapy hour- they have great deals on cocktails, beer and appetizers!
author: Ashley N.

description: Very good Sushi and a fun atmosphere.  I also like that they have a full bar.  They serve Shochu (Japanese Vodka) which is a nice change from having Sake and Beer with Suchi.  I really liked their Haamonii Sochu.
author: Kendall F.

description:
So I made reservations for my boyfriend's birthday and brought my boyfriend there for his birthday dinner. Our waitress, came to take our order. After ordering about 5 dishes or so, she collected our menus, and asked us, "Would you like any Sake to go along with your dinner?" (ever so casually). Since she had already taken our menus, we said "Sure, why don't you recommend something?" She goes, "OK, the first choice has a rice taste, the 2nd choice has a sweeter taste, and the 3rd choice is a really strong, slightly acidic." We were like, "OK, the first one sounds great." When she brought us the sake, she apologized and said that it normally is served at room temperature, but it was in the refrigerator, so if we let it wait a bit, it should warm up a bit. We didn't complain though, and accepted it. Unfortunately, the sake was completely disgusting to us and we didn't even finish a shot each, but we didn't bother to return it. since it was his birthday and I didn't want to make a scene. When we got the receipt, I was shocked to see that the total was $220!! I knew that the entrees were already overpriced, but how could it possibly have summed up to $220?? I scrutinized the receipt, and realized that our waitress had charged me $78 for the bottle of sake!! I burst out crying and was so embarrassed that I might cause a scene that I just tipped her 15% of the total--not including the Sake--and we left in a hurry. 

The next day I thought about it and discussed the situation with my coworkers and we concluded that it was completely inappropriate that she charged me so much without telling me how much it was (so sly--she had the menus in her hand and was so casual about suggesting sake), so I called the manager that evening in hope to get a refund on the sake. The general manager, was completely and outrageously rude and unprofessional to me. He was very impatient and curt on the phone, and after I told him my experience, all he said was, "Well, I'm not going to refund your sake, and I'm concluding that this was just a matter of you not like your waitress' service, so I'll refund you the tip later this week that you left her." I was really unhappy about his decision, but he refused to give me anything else. The next day I called him again and tried to tell him it wasn't just about the tip that I wanted back, but the sake since I felt 'tricked' into getting such an expensive sake!! (I mean, it was it $78 for a tiny bottle, NOT to mention it was served incorrectly---freezing cold!!). The general manager was like, "Look--we consider ourselves a very POSH restaurant, and if you can't afford to pay for this sake, you shouldn't even be coming here." I told him, "Well I consider myself an excellent customer--I was more than happy to pay for ridiculously overpriced entrees, but that was my choice since the prices were written plainly on the menus and I wasn't tricked into anything." I told him, fine, that he didn't have to refund the entire cost, but certainly a more significant portion of it. Again, he repeated that they were a posh restaurant catering to a certain type of customers, and he would consider my case one more time and whatever decision he makes will show up on my credit card statement in a few days. After about a week,  I looked on my credit card statement, and he had only refunded my tip (as he originally was only willing to refund) PLUS $5!!!!  It was outrageous and outright offensive--he might as well just have refunded me the tip!! So I called him and asked him about it. Again, with his impatient and hostile manner, he said that "He thought about it, and this was the decision he made." As simple as that. So there was nothing left for me to do, so I told him that I was going to certainly write reviews about the terrible, contemptuous, and patronizing service. He then yelled at me, "Well if you do so, we have a legal department that will sue you, and I'm going to end this discussion right now" and he hung up on me. So here I am, warning all of you of the waitress (make sure to choose your alcohol on your own or to make sure you know what the price is before she 'recommends' an outrageously and improperly served sake to you!) and of the general manager, the pretentious, patronizing, general manager that thinks he is all 'posh' and thinks that anyone that isn't willing to get ripped off is, in his words, pretty much unclassy and undeserving of even giving Ozumo their business.
author: Jasmine L.

description: i've eaten here a few times and the food is pretty decent, but i mostly go for drinks now. i love sitting in the bar area-- especially in the nook-in-the-wall piled with cushions. very trendy but cozy at the same time if that makes sense. when i ate here last i sat in the "sake bottle" room and it was very nice, a lot of privacy for our group.
author: Michelle I.

description: This review is for the new "happy" hour menu. It's sad. The original was by no means a bargain, but now they've taken some options off the happy hour "specials" and have altogether removed some of the better ones, namely the hamachi roll and the beef skewers (you now have to get it with chicken and vegetable skewers too and it's not a happy hour "special" any more.)  The Geisha Moon, now renamed something like the Geisha Margarita can be yummy, if made my the right bartender, but $10!   When I was presented the new menu, I assumed they expanded their happy hour specials to compete with the nearby Palomino's but that was not the case.  Different vibe,of course, but if you're just going to grab a drink with some co-workers/friends and not to looking for a "singles scene", then it is preferable.  Palomino's new happy hour menu has all apps and pizzas half off and draft beers and margaritas for $3...you know where I'll be more often...
author: Amina B.

description: Went there for lunch and were seated in the glass room surrounded by sake bottles which was nice.  Started off with the garlic edamame which were really good.  Some people ordered bento boxes and some shared sushi.  I opted for a bento box since I don't eat raw fish and ordered the grilled sea bass.  The sushi came way ahead of the bento boxes and they looked really good.  15 - 20 minutes later our bento boxes came out and mine looked really pathetic.  My sea bass was the size of two fingers and was completely not fresh and overcooked.  It wasn't just a little dry, it was dry like cardboard.  Unfortunately, I missed breakfast and was starving so I forced myself to eat.  If I were with the bf, I would have sent it back, but bc I wasn't paying, I didn't want to seem rude.  The sea bass was accompanied by a tiny amount of rice, small mound of sliced cucumbers, orange slices, and a small amount of these wet veggies that tasted weird.  Cardboard sea bass and oranges for $15?  Wow.  I left the place with a headache bc I was still so hungry.  I realized I should have ordered a shrimp tempura roll or something bc the sushi did look good.  We had a variety of desserts but the one that stood out was the fondue.  I have to say that the service was very friendly but also very slow.  It took them forever to finally take our meal order.  Half of our table had eaten most of their sushi by the time the bento boxes arrived.  And it took us an extra 20 minutes just to get the bill paid.  Although I didn't pay, I won't be back.  There are way too many other restaurants for the same price or cheaper that will satisfy me.
author: Casey F.

description: very very good!! went here with some friends and i loved it! upscale and chill.. i even got to try some of my friends kobe beef... yum! how can you not complain about kobe? from what i remember.. the food was good, but we ordered every dessert on the menu and they even brought an extra dessert!! that topped it off, i would go here again
author: Dae M.

description: Over-priced sushi that you can find better in a million different places in the City. I like the garlic edamame and the decor of the place, but the sushi is far from spectacular (fresh, but uninspiring) and mos def not worth the price. They do have a large room to accomodate a big dinner party, but don't make your friends shell out $$$ to take you here for your birthday. Its just not nice. Go here if you must, but I guarantee you won't be making a return visit.
author: Mama L.

description: i was aware that this place was going to be expensive but we went for my sisters 30th bday..and it was wayyy overpriced..the service wasnt that great they took a really long time and the waitress was a little rude. i ordered the short prime ribs which was 24 dollars for literally 7 TINY pieces of meat it was good but the size and amount does not match the price at all...they were literally the size of those bite size brownies....the sushi was good the bar service was better than the dining service....but i doubt ill ever come here again...theres better sushi downtown for wayy cheaper.
author: alyssa p.

description: The only reason this places gets two stars is because the food was good and the decor is pleasant.  Otherwise, this has to have been the worst dining experience I have had in San Francisco.  I went on a Saturday night. I had a 9:00 reservation and was sat at 9:30. While I understand that restaurants get behind, I don't understand why I wasn't seated when there must have been 15 open tables when I finally walked back into the main dining room.  The hostess was rude, did not move the table for my friend so that he could actually get into his seat.  She forgot the drink menu which is a huge no no in my book.  Our waiter was one of those cool waiters that doesn't write any of your order down.  He needs to get a pad of paper.  He asked us outright if we wanted any edamame and we said no. Food runners proceeded to bring us 3 bowls of edamame (which we kept rejecting). We ordered our drinks and ended up waiting almost 30 minutes to get them.  We had to keep tracking our waiter down so that we could order food. We ordered a salad before the rest of our entree- we didn't get our salad until the end of our meal.  Plus food runners kept bringing dishes we didn't order to our table while our own food seemed to just never show up.  Plus when the bill came to our table there were about 3 items on our bill that we never ordered.  It was just AWFUL!!!!!
author: Anna S.

description: outstanding cooked food and sushi, good service, great atmosphere.
author: John R.

description:
All Hat and No Cattle.

While the presentation and ambiance were lovely and the service was fine, this place fell down flat on its face. The food was slightly below mediocre.

For a 50$ lunch for two (without drinks) I expected much more.

Reserve this for lost tourists or people who would relish a Jack in the Box burger, as long as it was wrapped in golden foil and the tomatoes were cut in the shape of a flower.

The gory details:

Orange slices: A little old and soft, not a fresh tasting citurus.
Salmon: Not a bad peice of fish, but not a good one either. The sauce was forgettable. The fish was not 'seared' properly as the cooked flesh extended most of the way, but not all the way to the center. Felt more like 'underdone' than 'seared'. No crisp, flavorful outer skin.
Broccoli: If you give me a tiny piece of broccoli it better be good. This one was was overcooked and again in a thick brown forgettable sauce.
Radish puree: ICK, it tasted off! I love radish and this one had sat a while to long at room temperature, enough to gain a bit of 'funk'. Without this particular flaw, the place might have squeaked by with 3 stars. Placing spoiled food on the plate is a health concern as well as just plain classless.
Cucumber Salad: Neither warm nor cold, made me think the bento box had sat around for a while, even though we ate promptly at noon. Dressing was not to my taste.
Berry: Overripe. 
Rice: They had used sticky sticky sushi rice to make the shape of a flower, looked great, tasted ordinary.
Ume Plum: Awesome! The saving grace of an otherwise poor meal.
author: Kenning N.

description: Words can not describe the disappointment  I have in this restaurant. I took my boyfriend's here for his birthday. Huge mistake! The service was total crap. I think the only thing that came quickly was our drinks everything else was super slow. The sashimi portions are both small in size and in amount, not to mention over priced.  It was nothing special. I have had way better  for half the price. My boyfriend who had ordered an entree  waited 30 minutes just to be served the wrong thing. When he said it was ok and he would just eat it the man quickly took the plate away leaving him to chew on his napkin for another 20 minutes! When he finally got his dish is was something we could have made at home with done a better job cooking. He left still hungry. I am a person who enjoys a dining experience as a whole. I don't care if I get charged 15 bucks for sting beans at a steak house as long as their good and are served in a timely manner. But this was not that case. We won't be eating here again.
author: Sharon M.

description: I do not recommend this restaurant.  I understand the appeal of the bar and the "scene" but unfortunately it is very yesterday, which is demonstrated by the clientele.  We came here for my birthday, thrilled that the restaurant featured an omakase.  However, based on the price and the quality of the food it is not worth it.  We specifically asked the waiter for sake and wine pairings which were not available and his suggestions were not very good.  (I still have not found an excellent omakase in San Francisco).  To top it all off, when we went to get our car from the valet someone had smoked in it.  Again, there are better options elsewhere.
author: Anne P.

description:
im giving this place 3 stars, only becuase i havent eaten dinner here yet.  i went for a wedding celebration last night, and they had part of the bar blocked off for our party.  the space was great - i thought the bar atmosphere was really cool.  there were plenty of seating areas, and there was enough space for quite a large group.  we were served a few appetizers, which were good (but nothing crazy great, hence the 3 stars).  edamame, sushi, beef skewers, sliced cucumbers, calamari.  i liked the edamame and the calamari the best.  the sushi that we had wasnt anything special, which surprised me since its their specialty.  but it also wasnt a selection of creative rolls - just tuna, california, salmon, etc.  i think if you ordered sushi for dinner, there are probably a lot more choices.  
our service was great i thought, given how many people were there.  our waitress remembered us throughout the night, and kept the bubbly coming!  i would love to try ozumo for dinner sometime and hopefully increase my stars.
author: Carolyn B.

description:
wonderfully fresh fish, knowledgeable service, deep sake menu, cool hang out bar down below with stunning  waitresses

highlights: toro, sake,  the roe with the raw quail egg and again the waitresses (it's all part of the experience, right?)
author: Fortuna F.

description: Food is beyond delicious, but in no way is this establishment worth the price.  You may be decieved initially, as was my boyfriend, when he reasoned that $28 for a uniquely prepared scallop dish at an acclaimed restaurant was reasonable.  Reasonable until the dish comes and includes 4 scallops (not giant ones- about the size of  quarters) and some seaweed.  Delicous as they were, 4 scallops couldn't possibly make even the lightest eater feel satisfied.  We thought that one roll, two entrees and some miso soup would be plently.  Not particularly huge eaters, we left hungry.  The waiter remarked that most people order 2 or three rolls and an entree.  We'd have been happy to order more, if our tab wasn't already over $140 with one cocktail a piece.  Perhaps other yelpers are right, this may be considered "the best of SF" for those that have expense accounts, but as a long time sushi eater I assure you, you can get a FAR better quality:price ratio elsewhere.
author: Jenni D.

description: not quite awake on a monday for lunch.. i did myself a favor and ordered a bento box as i didn't feel like ordering a mix of salad and rolls like i usually do at japanese restaurants.. i got a bento that came with sea bass.  and it wasn't exactly what i expected.. the sea bass tasted a bit overcooked but it wasn't bad but it wasn't super good.  it came with veggies, edamame, salad. i was full but  whatever about the meal.  my ice tea tasted watered down.  sure, it was a nice change from the usual rincon center and one market.. but ehh not entirely thrilled. overall, just okay.
author: ally o.

description: I really love this place but I wish that they had a few more rolls on the menu and I wish it was a little less expensive. The rolls they do have are excellent, some of them have some interesting twists, like a peanut sauce drizzled over top and a roll with no rice and wrapped in cucumber (actual cucumber insides, not just the skin). And the presentation is incredible for every dish! Every time I go I order the chef's special roll and I have never been disappointed. The garlic-woked edamame are fantastical and you must try them! I love the Sekiwaki, Ozumo, and the sumo roll. The green tea mochi with chocolate sauce sounded terrifying to me, but my friend ordered it and I took one bite and was in love. So delicious! They also have an incredible sake menu, and their liquor drink choices are quite tasty; I especially like the Tokyo Glow. The bar in this place is crackin after work on Fridays and the crowd is mostly FiDi-ers lookin to get a little tipsy after the long work week. Oh, and if you're lucky enough to be seated near a window in the dining room, they have some really nice views of the Bay Bridge. So, if you have the money to spend, you should definitely check it out, especially for special occasions.
author: Amanda S.

description: can't say anything about the food since i didn't eat here, but the drinks here are good.  i came here for happy hour last night, but i got there too late to take advantage of the happy hour specials.  my friends were there earlier and said drinks were half off and apps were about $4.  good deal!  the space is really nice and sleek.
author: Helen T.

description: Fresh delicious beautiful fun. Great experience for a sushi date or sushi business dinner.  Maybe the best  toro in San Francisco!!
author: SFlover D.

description: The sushi here is great! They have many different types of rolls to choose from. They have a vary large selection of sake which is great as well. The atmosphere here is trendy and fun in the bar, they have cozy little tables to sit at. They have a DJ who plays a techno type of music. I have been here 5 times and when I visit SF I am totally going back! If you like restaurants for the food, drinks, and atmosphere this is the place!
author: Nicole R.

description: I wish I could give the event organizer nad the entire staff at Ozumo 12 stars! No matter how hectic we were as clients they always treated us with kid gloves  and kindness. Sarah helped me pick out the most amazing wedding dinner menu. Althougth our party was small ( 12 guest) we were greeted like royalty! The entire staff greeted us in japanese when our party arrived! I mean that every staff member spoke to us and cheered as we walked by! I have NEVER in my life felt so special at a resturant, not to mention our wait staff even took pictures of our dinner and texted to us!  i was a picky bride and gave them my own decor to decorate our table, which they made even more beautiful than i could have imagined. It was my wedding day and I felt so specail thanks to the staff at Ozumo! I highly recommend them to anyone, wedding, special dinner whatever! Yes the food is pricey- but you get what you pay for! my guest literally fought over the food- best i ever tasted! Thanks to all!!!XOXOXO 11.11.11 Bride!
author: PA H.

description: wonderfully expensive sushi. it's a scene of sorts after work.
author: Michael S.

description: i dream of this cod...if youve read my reviews you can tell im a friggin black cod fanatic. however, i've found that as good as it is, it is 1. too small, and 2. DEFINETLY too small for the high price theyre charging.  nobu has a bigger, better tasing cod for $8 less.  ozumo is def. a favorite of mine...its just an exciting, fun restaurant to go for me.  the vibe is always upbeat and i will most likely run into someone i know there.  great jalapeno hamachi, too.  its big...lots of seating.  its just too expensive for what they offer.  not the best place for large parties...i had my birthday there- the food came out all at different times and our sever (one for a 13 person group) was lacking.
author: Genevieve M.

description: The food, was awesome and fresh!  I would rate them on food, 4 stars!  I had booked my rez on opentable, and then needed to change in the middle of the day.  I called, there was no clear menu for rez or a beep to leave a message, very confusing.  The service was awful! It was a friend's b-day..The food, was slowly coming out for 4 of us.. We had to remind our wait staff, three times about one of the items.  We had to sit in the corner, next to window, nice view.  The only view, that was not so nice was the roach crawling under my friend's coat, when we got ready to leave.  I would think during these economic times, with at bill over $300.00 we deserved better?  Plus, the credit card machine was having issues, and asked if I had cash? I did not and I was thinking really, I'm downtown, and I have to walk to my citi ATM?? It was service experience that has made me re-think bringing friends and my clients there.  Ozumo, great food, great atmosphere, horrible wait staff.
author: Kim P.

description: I have had tons of sushi all over LA and SF and this is THE PLACE. The atmosphere, the service, all the food, the drinks...EVERYTHING is SUPERB, esp. the food, which is the most  important. It is a great place for a date, with friends, groups, family. Very fabulous ambiance. The sushi is amazing...best Toro and Caterpillar roll I have ever had. I almost had an orgasmic experience after tasting the sauce on the black cod.  A little pricey, but well worth it. I recommend the Lychee cocktail after or during your meal at the bar.
author: sarah e.

description: Ozumo is place better for power business folk trying to get a drink more so than it's sushi.  The bar area has a good local feel to it, plus creative drinks and a good looking crowd.  The nigiri is good but the rolls aren't so good.  I've only had the hamachi collar, which isn't on the menu so ask for it, and that was pretty good.  The down side is they don't have it all the time.  The spicy tuna roll is hotness.
author: Jerry T.

description: 2 words.... LYCHEE MARTINI! I love them, the bartenders here are great mixologists, I HEART great bartenders that know how to make a good tasting cocktail.  The food here isn't bad, the fish seems to be very fresh, I've actually only eaten here twice, but I mainly come for the drinks and the atmosphere, it gets packed! I like the crowd, and I love the fact the have a DJ on certain nights after a certain hour. Great place to come for a few good tasting cocktails and head out to a club after.
author: S A.

description: Great location and overlooks the bay so that adds to the price.  The food was good though; quite fresh.  Ordered the Ozumo roll; had to order the roll that's named after the restaurant, and some other roll.  Wish we would've gotten something off the robo-grill, or something like that, but we got a small plate, the scallops and risotto.  Everything tasted great.  Ordered a bottle of sake, which was really quite expensive (for me at least).  All in all, I'd go again, but stick with a beer and get wasted somewhere else.
author: Gabriel M.

description: Sporadic service coupled with overpriced sushi equals the absence of my return.  Randomly selected this place last night after meeting up with a couple of friends and really wish I hadn't.  It's definitely a see and be seen kind of place whereas I am a seat and eat kind of girl. Sat at the robata and was largely ignored by our server for much of the evening.  My friend's food was the last to come and that was after my other friend and I had already finished eating ours.  Nice.  The sake flight sampler was okay and I'd recommend that but that's about it.  I had the sashimi cocktail that was attractive and tasty but didn't have $15 worth of sashimi.  Also charging $5 for miso soup is a ridiculous affront.  The spicy scallop roll was good and so was the rock n' roll but they're standards and hard to fuck up in all honesty.  $66 later...I'm NOT full, NOT drunk and NOT impressed.  Therefore I'm NOT coming back.
author: Jill D.

description: i was taken here on a business recruitment dinner, and thank god i didn't have to pick up the check. although expensive, it's definiitely one of the better sushi places i've gone to in san francisco. the staff is extremely knowlegable when it comes to their sake. i had the most amazing melon sake that was extremely smooth going down. the fish was extremely fresh and well prepared. i recommend the rainbow roll and spicy tuna roll. the service was excellent and the waitress was attentive. i recommend going here if you want the atmosphere of a hip and trendy sushi restaurant combined with an extremely large sake list.
author: Aly L.

description: I just love this place! My husband and I go about twice a month for the past 4 years and we have never been disappointed.
author: Joni E.

description:
alright, it's been about a month since i had dinner here but i feel obligated to say a few words. 
the decor in this joint is boss. if i were gonna open a trendy sushi spot, i'd model it after ozumo. i've been here before, but it was more for drinks than anything else and i didn't really get to appreciate the  ambiance.
the service was ok. nothing to write home to your mama about. but just ok is a problem for a place that charges what ozumo does. i remember asking twice for a something and looking around for my server a couple of times.  
now for the food. to be honest with you, i'm not the brightest ray of sunshine. and after a few drinks, the menu looked a little like instructions on assembling a dresser from ikea. not too difficult for most, brain surgery for me. maybe i should have asked for suggestions from the waiter, but i was too drunk or too proud. whatever. i ordered a few things just to cover all the bases and for the life of me can't remember any of it except for the agedashi. that was damn good. the rest was neither great nor bad.
now, i didn't pay for any of it (thanks doc!), but if i had to go back and use my wallet, i think i'd be open to some suggestions from the wait staff.
2.5 stars
author: Jeremiah J.

description: Had dinner here on Christmas Eve for the first time. I have heard reports that the service is sometimes on and sometimes off. It was definitely on tonight. The waiter, Pheng, was pleasant, knowledgable about every step of the cooking process, and very attentive. 5 stars to him. Hanabi appetizer was great, but a little overpowered by the avocado. I took the avocado out, and it worked, 4 stars. Kaiso seaweed was beautifully arranged and fresh, but surprisingly not very flavorful, 3.5 stars. The signature black Cod was absolutley incredible. Intense sake-miso flavor, the chef marinates it for 24 hours, 5 stars. The special entree of the night, lobster grilled over sumi charcoal at 1200 degress, huge lobster served open-faced and stuffed with uni rissoto was unbelievable, all the stars in the sky. Seriously, this was the single best dish I have had in my entire life, $65 dollars and easily worth double that. Incredible smoked flavor, with lots of colorful peppers, ingenious uni risotto, and absolutley none of the overly buttered lobster that so many restaurants serve. This is lobster done right: Iron Chef cooking at its finest! If I ever end up on Death Row, this will be my last meal request.
author: Johnny O.

description: Service was the best I've ever seen anywhere or maybe it was just our server.  Our waitress was so friendly (but not fake) and truely knew about the food and sake.  She actually gave us a brief history on sake and I had the best tasting sake ever.  And the food was absolutely delicious and very very fresh fish!
author: Helen V.

description: the best features of this establishment is the bar, mood, and that it's on the embarcadero.  the food is whatever and high priced at that.  had the most bland $7 eggplant last night, it was probably techinically 1/15th of an eggplant and tasted like it hadn't even been salted much less anything else.  stick to a few rolls at the bar and have a good time.
author: e w.

description: Definitely worth a trip if your boss if paying for it.  It's easy to run up triple-digit figures at this place, particularly when the cheapest of the four bottles of sake you consumed was $60.
author: J R.

description: i would give 3 and half if i could. the place is beautiful and the service was great. but it's all about the food at a restaurant and nothing here really blew me away worthy of me coming back on a usual basis. the dishes are well plated but portions are small and pricey. the location is great because you get to stroll the pier after dinner. nice for once in a long while.
author: Charlie L.

description: loved the atmosphere, great sushi and sake. the bar area seems like a great after work spot with a dj and lots of people. would definitely go back. everyone in our party really enjoyed it. next time i would try to get a table closer to the back of the resturant so you can get views of the bay.
author: Jenifer B.

description: top notch japanese sushi bar, i totally recommend it if you have money.  money speaks but you will gurantee your guest will be flattered. best sushi in town taste wise.
author: A Y K.

description:
i went here with the bf and 4 friends to celebrate his birthday.  it was pretty busy considering it was 12/30/08, but we managed to get a reservation at 8pm.  the restaurant itself is pretty big, has a really cute ambiance and pretty big tables i might add.  it was a little funky b/c i'm not totally used to such big tables and chairs, but it was a nice, little family-style dinner.

we let the waiter choose our dinner for us.  the guys basically told him to bring out whatever he thinks is best.  we had quite a few dishes including the futago (grilled washu beef), the hanabi (hamachi), two types of oysters (can't remember which ones though), two rolls, an udon type duck soup and some others i can't remember.

the waiter and staff in general were really great.  we had some nigori, one of the dessert sakes and the yesibu beer.  it was the first time i had it, it's a japanese lager.  it's pretty good.  

we had a few of the desserts as well.  my fave was the fondu though, just b/c i'm a huge choco lover.  the raspberry and mango sorbets were pretty good as well.

so all in all it was a great birthday dining experience.  i love my industry boys and i'm so happy when i roll with them.  we have a great time and the food is always great.  

i have to go back and sit at the sushi bar.  it looks awesome.  oh..and i give 4.5 stars.
author: H. G.

description: i went here with my intramural scrabulous team last night and had a good meal.  thinking back, i guess i ate about 80% of the food on the table - i was with a woman and a man who ate like a girl with a new year's resolution - so it's hard not to be pleased with $100 of sushi in your face.  we (i) ordered this weird quail egg thing that was a huge miss (you're supposed to mix up the unbroken quail yolk in this bowl of ahi and some grain, turning it into a $20 bowl of fish flavored oatmeal).  otherwise it was pretty spot on good sushi and service.  (8)
author: Matt S.

description: I LOVE happy hour here...i miss it, actually...Food here is amazing, even the late night sushi menu is good!  Tuna Tartare, highly recommended!
author: Poonam G.

description: I was invited to go here for a birthday dinner  with a party of eleven. We had our own private room which was like 80 degrees hot and musty at times but what do you expect, the whole restaurant was packed.
