I was told that the waiters would just "bring stuff out for us".  They began bringing out delicious dish after dish after dish.  Some highlights were the kobe beef, lamb, and rolls which names I can't remember.  We also had sake, beer, and a delicious chocolate fondue for dessert.  So, with every story  comes an ending and this particular  ending included an  $1,800.00 price tag. Holy Crap!  The kobe beef was $10 a piece for sashimi sized pieces and we had three plates of it. Thank God one of the guests was loaded and generous and decided to cover most of the bill.  So be careful when splurging at this place.  And don't forget to practice your Japanese in the restrooms where they play language tapes.
author: Glenda D.

description: my fiance and I went to the city to visit a good friend of mine and we told her we wanted Japanese food.  she took us here and it was amazing!!  the small plates were fantastic especially the Futago.  we also had the black cod which was just delicious and simply melted in our mouths.  the sushi rolls were very good also but it was the other small dishes we tried that I really remembered.
author: Laura T.

description: it was ok .everything was just over priced.you can get the same grade of fish at some other sushi joints for half the price.the lounge and dining area was very nice.go there and get a drink AFTER dinner..for the over priced fish go somewhere else..
author: kobe b.

description: More of a business expense account meal than a date place (its fairly stuffy for a sushi place).  Food was good, esp the non-sushi items including the mushroom risotto.  Fish quality was excellent but overpriced and small portions.  Definitely worth trying for a biz meal.
author: Stacy N.

description: I would have to say this place is not worth the $ if you're looking for good food, good service & a nice atmosphere. My boyfriend and I had a table for 8:30 on a saturday night, and we arrived 10 min. late because we had to wait for the valet to park our car. Then we had to wait for another 30 min. for the table to be ready. Once the waitress had called us, we found out that we had to sit at the sushi bar instead of the table. The place was noisy, the music was too loud. The food was ok. I would expect it to be better with this price range.
author: Pinkie B.

description: Great appetizers, and sake. The sushi was good, but I wasn't that into the entree. But the decor was cool with each wall being a different material (glass, paper, metal, wood), and the staff was friendly and informative.
author: John J.

description: if you're willing to trade in great sushi for poor service, i think this place will do quite nicely. i was very disappointed by the service, but the food made up for it. the sushi is extremely fresh, and they have some other nifty dishes (trythe seared tuna with the bean sprouts). the only reason i gave it 4 is that it's pretty pricey... not the best value for what you pay. i still think oyaji is better in terms of value.
author: monkey l.

description: Sure, its expensive. But if you're eating raw fish, wouldn't you want it to be kind of pricey? People who complain about expensive sushi must be the same sorts of people who would go for $1,000 dollar face lifts in Tijuana. Ozumo is great. Highly recommended.
author: Niya M.

description: A friend of my husband & myself  lives in San Francisco and for my husbands birthday i surprised him with a visit there. He likes sushi and this is where Brad who is also a sushi lover recommended we go. For drinks we started with the saki flights  2 of them,  there are 4 different flights on the menu and one flight gives you 3 full glasses its worth it.  The chef sent out an  amuse bouche  of  seared tuna on some greens with this killer olive oil that was just excellent.  Next we had the Hanabi...GET IT.the avacado is so good with the tuna. Right now for the summer they are doing  robata grilled items try the asparagus and the shoshito peppers both were great the mushrooms were just ok. The sushi was fresh and good & I would go here again however,  downside was that it did suffer from higher prices and i've had better if not just as good sushi for a fraction of the cost.  Great  atmosphere make sure you ask for a table where you can see the water its worth it!!
author: Renee L.

description: Good afterwork bar downtown.  Go for the happy hour prices for drinks and appi apps.  The music can sometimes be loud but that can be fitting too.
author: kimberly t.

description: excellent nabes, especially skiyaki. a bit overpriced for what it is, but then everything was prepared well, so no complaints. interesting variaty of desserts and appetizers. will definitely go back
author: alisa o.

description: Eh i wasn't that impressed. I was expecting some amazing sushi. I wasn't that amazed, but it could partially be my fault for not ordering anything completely crazy. I did order 6 pieces of toro, white tuna belly. the pieces were really thick and hard to bite into. I was extremely dissatisfied because it was 10 per piece AND I've had better for $3 a piece at Niwa in Orinda. I think i need to try this place again for the menu but i know the waiter is not the one bringing me back.  Our waiter was rude made us wait a lot when it wasn't busy, and forgot some of our order so ugh.
author: Colleen M.

description: Went here on a Friday night, with two friends.  We were lucky enough to catch a group standing up from one of the small tables near the entrance, so we didn't have to wait the estimated 30 minutes.  The ambiance was crowded and lively, with house and breaks thumping overhead.  But what really makes Ozumo worthwhile is the food.  Ah, hamachi!  How I love you so!  Absolutely glorious sushi, and quality drinks to boot (I recommend the lychee vodka, if you're into sweet drinks).  I'm looking forward to my next visit!
author: R K.

description: This place has seriously good sushi and seriously high prices to match!  The scallop sashimi was a highlight as was the edamame in garlic sauce.  Our server was very nice, but she forgot a few items we ordered.  It didn't matter much though, as we were happy with what we got and happy to keep some cash on us!
author: Sarah H.

description: I have eaten here a couple of times when they first opened and it was great. Past two times I have been here I have been extremely disappointed. The newer manager gives very poor service along with the waitstaff. The waitress wouldnt take the time to describe the robata menu. When she did, she lied about the mushroom dish, which we were under the impression was oysters. No explanantion or offer to take it back. Then we waited over 20 minutes on one roll, the place was half empty, and I finally asked the manager and he disappeared. He sends the waitress with the roll 10 minutes later and offers no apology or explanation. My husband overhears the manager talking to the waitress and saying rude stuff, that we were expecting her to run around and do what? Her job? Bring a roll within 20 minutes? How about some more hot water for my tea? We ordered $100 worth of rolls qnd drinks, sorry if we expected courtesy and a waitress willing to do her job and a manager that can offer some respect. The fish, especially shrimp tasted old. I love sushi, and at this point Sushi Raw on Taraval is much better. The price means nothing if you are treated well. They need lessons on customer service, they should try Gary Danko's for pointers. And the quality of fish is same as any Japantown restaurant. So disaapointed, this was a fave of mine a year or two ago. Maybe the trick is to drink enough sake so u dont notice the food quality or poor service.
author: Kim L.

description: I love the bar here -- it's perfect for a date.  The food is pretty good too -- great combo of grilled Japanese food and sushi.
author: T D.

description:
I travel to San Francisco on business quite often, and my "home base" is Ozumo.  A number of reasons:
  - The food - wonderful nigiri and sashimi, edamame (you *must* try the garlic/soy version).  Excellent "cooked" dishes as well (black cod and a variety of beef dishes).
  - The staff - I always sit at the bar and, to a person, the bar staff is the best I've ever encountered.  Over the years, I've gotten to know each of them  and they are helpful, warm and friendly.  I can't speak about the guys working there, but I will also add that the women bar tending and cocktailing are all lovely as well.
  - The atmosphere - they have various DJs in the evening and while some are better than others, it adds a "vibe" that is relaxing and energizing at the same time (go there and you'll see what I mean).
  - The crowd - yes, there is some of the typical self-absorbed, new-money, ultra-hyphenated male crowd.  I've learned to ignore them.  There is also a fair amount of medically enhanced, money worshiping young women (both of the professional and amateur variety).  I admit that I have a bit more trouble ignoring them (some of them are so heart-stoppingly nice looking that it seems almost unreal).  Despite that, I almost always find someone to talk to and generally have an excellent evening.

Would I be there so often if it weren't for the trusty expense account?  I would *want* to, but I'm not sure I could afford it.  It's expensive, but like my parents always said, you get what you pay for.
author: Michael F.

description: ... I never ever thought to write a review about a restaurant we, girlfriend and I have gone to. This occasion was different. It was an inner office lunch and there service will have to modify from previous visits. In the past we been there and the service was outstanding, the food first rate, and nothing to really complain. But of course my girlfriend had to give her two cent (to be honest, it was perfect, then again, she is Korean (joke)) Moving on with my review. It was a 6:PM reservation with a party of 7.  We all get seated. Our waiter takes our drinks order and at no time I we felt pressure to order our entrees. And let me say, when our entrees came, our party was blown always with the first class service we received. I was also impressed when the floor manager came over and greeted our table. His professionalism was well welcome (I believe his name was Curtis) Any who, it was a good change from the usual feeling, get in, eat, get out, you get from most restaurants I've been to. And speaking of the food, we had the sashimi, a couple of small dishes, futago and hanabi, and I ended up with Kobe beef. By far, the best piece of steak I've ever had. Overall, will I bring my party to another sitting at Ozumo's, the answer is absolute f*# yeah; Pardon my French.
author: Daniel R.

description:
the food and presentation was great. 

the service was another in itself. i swear that my waiter was on drugs. he looked like a younger version of weird al yankovic. he was totally out of it. i met up with my party late so they ordered before me. the waiter told us that he would be back to take my order. by the time he took my order, my friends' food already came out. he repeated my order to me like 4x's, as if he didn't understand it. we waited until closing to get our check. oh yea, and we mentioned to him that it was our friend's birthday and he was supposed to come out with the dessert. he completely forgot. we had to waive the manager over . when he saw the manager coming to our table, he jumped in front of out table all crazy and whacked out singing 'happy birthday." and said "oops i forgot the dessert!" he was crazy! damn professional waiters! i really think he was on drugs or some other shit because i have never in my life had a waiter like him.
author: clarisse n.

description:
service is good, food is excellent! the view outside is nice :) you can see a bridge ehehe
ambiance is awesome! perfect for a date or a group thing... a very social place if you're at the counter.
make reservations for the best service! and dress up!
gotta luv those mixed drinks they created! place is a bit expensive but the food is fusion goodness. portions are a bit small so you may want to order more? 

this is a happening trendy place to eat, drink, and socialize. very classy for a night on the town!!
author: Pamster j.

description: Our first time here we sat at the bar, which we had very quick service. Great sushi - would say best sushi in San Francisco actually. A tad on the pricey side.
author: Annie S.

description: The atmosphere, the quality of sushi is outstanding. Try the mochi sundae awesome, I love trying to different sushi places in the country and haven't been able to find a place that had such a good desert menu. The sashimi, the rolls are all superb but it is a bit pricy
author: Nadeem R.

description: Anyone who is complaining about the price on here, they're right that it's expensive, but I wouldn't say overpriced.  I went there with one friend (two in our party) and the sushi alone was $170.  With a sake sampling and tip I walked out with a $240 tab.  BUT, this was the second time I had been there and both times it was the sushi I'd ever had.
author: Michael M.

description: Go for the atmosphere and drinks.  For some reason I can't remember my meal.  That must not be a good thing...or says something about the drinks? Sanraku is where the fresh sushi is.
author: meg d.

description: four stars for a really fun happy hour place.  the sushi is just okay and overpriced.  four stars for happy hour, 3 stars for sushi.
author: michael k.

description: Just went here last night, and while the food was amazing, the service was so horrible I will never go back.  The waitress was trying to up sell us the whole time, and made us feel guilty for "only" ordering a large variety of sushi rolls.  To top off the night, about 5 minutes after paying the bill, we were told they needed our table and asked us to move to the bar.  We were a group of three, and had only been at the table for a little over an hour!  Its really too bad, because the ambiance and location are fabulous - but they really need a kick in the pants when it comes to service.
author: Kate E.

description: good fresh sushi in a kind of psuedo chic atmosphere. kind of pricey, but good
author: hugh k.

description: Very nice place, and the service i had was great. The food was excellent  and the staff and very professional and friendly. The Gyu Don was very good and Gindara was terrific And the friendly manager named Curtis checked on us to see how the food/service was and we were doing. Also our waitress was very professional and friendly explaining what was on each plate. Great place to take a date you will enjoy this place alot!!
author: tony m.

description: Food is ok and the decor is nice, unfortunately it's let down by being expensive and having hopeless people running the front of the house. There's better places to go, this is very "business man from out of town"
author: Ben F.

description: yummie! they serve the best food ever and the service is amazing. the sushi rolls are not even that expensive (similar to Ryoko's for example) but they are soooo tasty. I love this place. Everybody should go there to try it.
author: Cianna X.

description: nice vibe & service, good high end sashimi, okay bento, pricy
author: Peter W.

description: Went to this bar for a year and it was nice until I got treated like a piece of shit one friday.  I signed onto yelp just to give this review of how I was treated.  We patronized this place for about a year every friday night .  Then one night we try to take our friends out for a good time in the town.  Long story short when  we got there we saw some ppl we knew that were  a little drunk and the waitress told them that they had to leave.  I mean its understandable that they had to leave if they were drunk.  but they then proceeded to kick us out also.  when we had nothing to do with them other then association.  when we asked the waitress why? she couldnt give us an answer other then she was going to call the security guard if we didn't leave.  So we got treated like shit and got kicked out of a place for no reason.  it's some waitress I've never seen before, and i've been coming to this place for years.  I'm extremely dissapointed with their treatment toward us . And would not want to come here again.  there are better places like palomino or americano.  Seriously they have to know how to treat their patrons!
author: goof b.

description: delicious food (5 stars) although some things were over-flavored and strong. it lacks the subtle delicacy of most japanese restaurants, although the toro (no sauce) sashimi was amazing. we were seated in the middle room where it was very loud, dark, there was no view and we faced a black wall (0 stars).
author: I. K.

description: I was up north for about 10 days and in those 10 days i went to ozumo twice.  I really liked the atmosphere of the restaurant as it was trendy but not annoying,  the louder bar was placed in the far front of the restaurant while the main dining area stretched towards the back.  My first time here i had the sashimi sampler which was $50 with about 15 pieces of sashimi.  This included toro, salmon belly, salmon, yellowtail, japanese yellowtail, sweet shrimp, snapper and maguro.  The sashimi tasted very fresh, although it wasnt the best sashimi that i have had. The rolls here are a little creative, with some having fish on the inside and different types of fish layered on the outside.  I also had the monkfish liver nigiri for the first time ever and I loved everything about it.  My date had  the "spakling geisha drink which is like a peach bellini and she absolutely loved it too. Altogether our bill with tip was  a little over 150, but we ordered ALOT.
author: Mikey L.

description: great after hours bar.  also fun to go sit at the sushi bar for dinner.  very elegant sushi place
author: chris y.

description: the atmosphere was great and the resturant itself is awesome. unfortch, the service was very poor--our waiter disappeared for a while and it took us 3 hours to finish our meal (there were only 3 of us).  the salmon sashimi was excellent but the rainbow roll was a bit disappointing.
author: marcie d.
